item.title: Technischer Produktmanager Advertisement
item.description:
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen technischen Produktmanager im Bereich Email-Advertisement. Diese Position ist deutschlandweit zu besetzten und auch als vollständige Remote-Stelle möglich.


Ihre Aufgabe 



  • Entwickeln und Aufsetzen von neuen Produkten im Advertising  

  • Erstellen und Pflegen von Produktkonzepten und technischen Spezifikationen  

  • Planung von Roadmaps und Releases  

  • Aktives Management unserer internationalen Partner und Dienstleister

item.title: Sales Consultant
item.description:
10xFactory is looking for a sales consultant to join our small but insanely talented remote team to help onboard new applicants. This is an inbound sales role - demand for access to this community is incredibly high and we are inundated with inbound leads. We need your help to screen applicants, collect payment information and onboard new members.

What is 10xFactory?

10xFactory Is the fastest growing private Slack community for world-class entrepreneurs. Moderated and co-founded by a serial entrepreneur whose previous companies have generated hundreds of millions of sales, this community has 1 mission. Help its members 10x their growth and not in a hypothetical manner but in a true meaning of the word. Whether it's learning how to build a scalable, repeatable customer acquisition model, raising capital, structuring partner deals, building sales teams or even just dealing with personal work / life challenges, there's no other community in the world quite like this.

10xFactory is strictly for serious entrepreneurs and we maintain a strong bar of quality across the board. There is currently billions of valuation in our community.

You can learn more here: http://www.10xfactory.com/

What We're Looking For

We have an incredibly high bar for talent - we are looking for nothing short of an incredibly talented, self motivated sales consultant who is passionate about entrepreneurship and helping us continue to build and foster the 10x Factory community.

You will possess an uncanny ability to build rapport with entrepreneurs who apply to join the network and help them recognize the massive value in the community, getting them to sign up (this is an exclusive paid access membership) and assisting with onboarding and intros.

We have an unlimited number of inbound and very warm leads / applicants to the community so this role is strictly for a consultant that loves being rewarded for hard work.

What You Will Do

You'll be handed over hundreds of inbound leads (people who've applied to join) - you will contact, build rapport and onboard people daily. You will build a stellar follow up program for people who are not yet ready to join and you will drive significant and rapid revenue growth while sharing in the rewards.

This is a 100% remote opportunity but you will be required to work across the US timezone mostly but also across other timezones as we have many international members and applicants - flexibility is an absolute must.

To apply: Please apply here: https://10xfactory.betterteam.com/sales-consultant/apply

item.title: QA Engineer - Remote
item.description:
QA Engineer - Remote Job Description:

Joinpiggy.com is looking for the highest caliber QA engineer to join its technical teamâs expansion.  Remote based candidates should be based in an Asian time zone.  

What We Are Looking For

  • 8+ years of experience testing web scale distributed platforms/systems/applications
  • Hands on experience with testing automation of MEAN stack on AWS, SOA, REST based APIs design technologies
  • Strong CS fundamentals and OOP
  • Experience with migration of large scale enterprise systems to new platforms
  • Experience designing test strategies and orchestrating work on multiple teams to create highly efficient QA process and very high quality bar
  • Hands on experience with creating automation test suites using leading industry standard tools and frameworks (eg: Selenium Web Driver etc.)
  • Excellent grasp of web technologies (HTTP, sessions, site performance, Javascript, HTML, and CSS) and javascript are a must.
  • Experience working on various Agile development methodologies, and having strong opinion on them
  • Bachelorâs Degree in Computer Science Engineering or equivalent
  • Strong communication skills, both written and oral

Job Functions:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Estimate, prioritize, plan and coordinate testing activities
  • Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Identify, record, document thoroughly and track bugs
  • Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to meet client needs
  • Liaise with internal teams (e.g. developers and product managers) to identify system requirements
  • Monitor debugging process results
  • Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to implement solutions
  • Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts
  • Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies

Job Requirements:

  • Strong English language skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation.

How to Apply:
Remote based candidates should apply via our online careers portal at:

https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/801a2f8a0cdc

Or you can send your CV to the following email address:

801a2f8a0cdc@apply.breezy.hr

To apply: Remote based candidates should apply via our online careers portal at:https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/801a2f8a0cdcOr you can send your CV to the following email address:801a2f8a0cdc@apply.breezy.hr

item.title: Senior Rails Developer
item.description:
The Senior Rails Developer would be a critical member of the product team, working on all of the products within Kalkomey and an integral part of moving the business forward. This member would work as part of a larger team of UI/UX developers, content writers and editors, product owners and the business owners on Kalkomey software products across the board, ranging from our Learning Management System (LMS) which powers sites like https://www.boat-ed.com and https://hunter-ed.com, to our Event Manager product (http://register-ed.com) to our Certification Manager product (https://www.ilostmycard.com), and all things in between!


This position would be crucial to helping to drive and push technology forward on the Ruby and Rails stack building new applications, all while helping to maintain and improve our existing applications.

item.title: Affiliate Wrangler
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced affiliate marketer who can build and manage a strategic affiliate marketing program from the ground up. The affiliate landscape in the website building and hosting spaces is highly competitive and evolving. The role will involve not just on-boarding established affiliates but cultivating influencers and other current or potential partners to become Automattic affiliates. The WordPress name carries a lot of weight and the Affiliate Wrangler will need to think creatively about how to fully leverage the brand across new affiliate opportunities.
You:
Have experience building the technical backbone needed to start an affiliate program.
Can build and maintain relationships with affiliate partners.
Have negotiated paid placement opportunities, commission, and volume goals.
Provide reporting based on KPIâs on a regular basis.
Have strong interpersonal and communications skills (oral and written).
How to Apply
Does this sound interesting? If yes, please send a short email to jobs @ this domain telling us about yourself and attach a rÃ©sumÃ©. Let us know what you can contribute to the team.Â Include the title of the position youâre applying for and your name in the subject. Proofread! Make sure you spell and capitalize WordPress and Automattic correctly. We are lucky to receive hundreds of applications for every position, so try to make your application stand out. If you apply for multiple positions or send multiple emails there will be one reply.
If youâre reading this on a site other than automattic.com please make sure you visit automattic.com/work-with-us for the latest details on applying.

Want to increase your chances of standing out? If so, please address some or all of following points in your application:
If you were starting an affiliate program from scratch, what software and technology would you use and why?
What are the pros and cons of building an affiliate program in-house, vs. relying on a network programs like CJ, Linkshare etc.?
â Work With Us

item.title: Senior SalesForce Engineer
item.description: Lenox Park Solutions is seeking a Senior SalesForce Engineer with substantial experience developing custom, institutional software on Force.com. As our full-time Force.com engineer, your focus would be working closely with our Development & Marketing staff to advance the functionality and scalability of Harbor, our keystone software for General Partners. Initial day-to-day will include all aspects of managing the technical requirements of this product. The ideal candidate will also grow into a more senior leadership role in managing other outsourced development projects, and will have technical expertise beyond Force.com that will inform an expanded product suite. And as our team is comprised primarily of financial professionals, the candidate will have ample room to guide our strategic development and technical efforts. At LPS, we focus on accountability, proactive-ness, and creative thinking. Staff members retain the option to work remotely, as we are a goals-oriented team.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Weâre looking for a Senior Software Engineer with expertise in Node.js and a focus on server-side technologies. You must have excellent non-verbal communication skills for our fully remote team. We are a small startup building Node and React apps for the Real Estate industry. We just launched our first product to over 700 users and we are looking for a smart, responsive, and talented JavaScript Engineer to take us to the next level.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You have at least 2 years of experience with Node.js
  • You know the concepts behind Sails.js and React.js (actual experience is a plus)
  • You have experience with ES6 and Promise-based asynchronous coding
  • You have experience with AWS (EC2, S3, RDS)
  • You have experience with MySQL, Reddis, ElasticSearch
  • You have experience with nginx routing
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning is a plus
  • Knowledge of Lua and OpenResty is a plus
  • You have experience with unit testing and know the pros/cons of TDD
  • You have excellent non-verbal communication skills (we use Slack a lot)
  • You are extremely self-motivated; able to find opportunities for improvement and tackle them, without external direction
  • Comfortable working in a dynamic, low-structure, constantly changing atmosphere and prioritizing work appropriately
Node.js experience

For this position, a significant amount of experience with Node is a strict requirement.

We would love to hire all great backend developers, regardless of the language they have most experience with, but at this point we are looking for developers who can get up and running within our code base quickly and without much training, which limits us to developers with a large amount of existing experience with Node.js, and preferably Sails.js too.

To apply: https://native-axis.workable.com/jobs/424810/candidates/new

item.title: Senior Software Developer
item.description:
So you’re a happy, dedicated engineer, but what if you could be even happier?


As our name suggests, here at Smart Tuition, we believe in working smarter not harder, and that makes us really happy!  


Our development team is a group of diverse and passionate technologists using the web platform to provide financial services to over 2500 schools and 400,000 families worldwide.  We value teamwork and take pride in our quality, aren't afraid of change and always looking to improve by embracing what works.



So whether it's crafting a SQL query to gain those last milliseconds of performance, tweaking a responsive UI until it's just right, or anything in between, Smart Tuition has a place in our stack right for you.  If you're a critical thinker who enjoys a challenge and is willing to question things, we'd love to hear from you.



What you’ll be doing: 


In this role you’ll work as a member of the technology team to develop, manage, and monitor our cutting edge application infrastructure, release pipeline, and continuous deployments that power over 2500 K-12 schools. You’ll join a team dedicated to Improving the ability of schools to operate, integrate with leading accounting and education platforms and accept payments easily. If you’re a savvy technical interpreter that can translate a challenge into an opportunity for improvement, you’ve come to the right place. In this role, you’ll design, build and maintain the software to guarantee successful production deployments.



The Technology:


Our modern stack is comprised of AngularJS, Bootstrap, C# (WebAPI), WCF, Node.JS, SQL 2014, MongoDB, Elastic Search (Big Data), Redis (Distributed Caching) and Titanium Appcelerator (Mobile).



Purpose:


At Smart Tuition, we assist schools in focusing on their primary mission of education by providing tools for tuition management, financial aid and accepting payments or donations powered by cutting edge software. We also take pride in a great parent experience that allows families to pay from anywhere with highly flexible payment options.



People:


We are a company dedicated to providing outstanding customer service and delivering better living through technology. Our software team is comprised of forward looking individuals who approach challenges not only as engineers but as technologists.



Place:


We are based out of Woodbridge, NJ but you don’t need to be. We are looking for talent, regardless of location. There is a comfortable spot waiting for you in the office but work from home is totally an option.



Other things you might care about: Competitive salary, four weeks of PTO, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, Flex spending accounts, tuition reimbursement, volunteer for vacation, and community involvement.



Curious? Reply back. Worst-case scenario - you learn a little more about us, we learn a little more about you and keep us in mind for the future. Best case, you get to help empower organizations that are actively making the world a better place.

item.title: Senior Curriculum Engineer
item.description:
Are you passionate about learning new technologies and teaching them to others? Do you love writing, speaking, and storytelling as much as you love coding? Then this may be the position for you!



At Trilogy Education Services, we’re creating innovative programs to train new audiences for careers in the digital economy. If you have strong skills in programming, mobile development, data analytics, UI/UX, networking, or cyber-security, we want to speak with you!



We’re looking for people with passion, a demonstrated ability to learn on their feet, and a desire to escape the cubicle and stretch their creative muscles in new ways.



Who You Are:




  • Someone with at least 2-4 years of real coding or design experience. Self-taught dabblers are encouraged to apply, too! But you need to have demonstrable skills.



  • Someone who is always “creating.” This job is all about thinking on your feet and spinning quick and fun activities to demonstrate key concepts. You need to be someone who can dream up a proof of concept idea… then code or create it in a day or two.




  • Someone who possesses strong writing and communication skills. We write as much as we code. If you’ve always wanted to write teen novellas while staring at for-loops, then you should definitely apply.




  • Someone who is a lot of fun! We want learning technology to be exciting, engaging, and a little funny. Imagine an engineering class that feels like a Disney movie. We need fun people to make this a reality.




  • Someone who is well versed in any number of the following:


    • HTML / CSS

    • JavaScript, jQuery

    • Node.js, Express

    • MySQL, MongoDB

    • Angular, React

    • Python, Pandas, NumPy

    • Android or iOS Development

    • UI/UX Design, Accessibility, User Story Mapping

    • Ethical Hacking, Kali Linux




What You Will Do:




  • Dream up and create instructional activities for demonstrating key concepts in your area of expertise (...or ones you will learn to master).

  • Write detailed lesson plans to be taught in classrooms across the country.

  • Create visual diagrams and annotations to break down abstract technical concepts.

  • Collaborate closely to improve and QA the curriculum with academic peers.

  • Stay abreast of tech trends to identify and build programs that teach what’s “next” in tech.

  • Learn to infuse empathy, support, and encouragement into all educational materials you create.



Other Perks:




  • Up to 100% remote work

  • Great health, dental, and vision benefits

  • Flexible hours

  • Nonstop learning

  • Great mentors

  • Plenty of room for advancement

  • Ongoing training and a culture of investing in employee growth

item.title: Fun Loving PHP Developer
item.description:
WHAT'S UP, WORLD?! My name’s Acuity, but my friends call me Cutie. I’m an online scheduling tech company from New York City, and I’m 9 and 4/5ths years old. But that’s, like, 25 in software company years.


Hobbies include: craft beer, using finger guns in a completely non-ironic fashion, adult coloring books (don’t act like you don’t have one), and helping businesses of all sizes manage their busy schedules. Pretty niche, I know.


“Why managing schedules?' you ask? Well, I like to help people. I guess you could say I take after my dad that way. His name’s Gavin and he built me from scratch almost 10 years ago! Can you believe it?––A whole decade!


And that brings me to what I’m doing all this for...


See, my full name is Acuity Scheduling––and no, it’s not one of those weird celeb baby names or anything. I’m a tech company. And right now, I’m looking for my ride-or-die, go-to, right-hand PHP App Developer, whose main role will be developing the core of Acuity Scheduling and helping us continue growing!


I’m going to describe a human, and if it sounds like you might be the human I’m describing, you should contact me. And you should probably attach your résumé.

item.title: ReactJS / Python developer
item.description:
ExecVision is a rapidly growing conversation improvement platform; we provide a dashboard to all of a company's call and video recordings, allowing for analytics, coaching, and research using information that would otherwise be lost.

We're looking for a front end developer to work on our React JS ui and the Python API that backs it. You'll be working as part of a team to build out new features and improve quality in our existing codebase.

Requirements:
* At least one large or several small projects using React. You must know the framework well, warts and all.
* 5+ years frontend web development, using Javascript, CSS, HTML. Current skills in these technologies.
* 3+ years Python experience.
* Good time management skills, self drive, and good english communication.
* Commitment to high quality software, and good sense of how to create satisfying user experiences.
* 3+ years SQL & relational database experience.

Nice to haves:
* D3, HighCharts, or equivalent visualization library.
* Experience with implementing admin user interfaces.
* Experience with playing media (audio, video) through a Javascript UI.
* NLP, interest in linguistics.

To apply: Send a resume to rfirmin@execvision.io. Please highlight relevant experience in your cover letter.

item.title: UI UX JavaScript Ninja Cool Product Company Location Flexible East Coast Pref
item.description:
Want to work in a cool and innovative development environment? Us too. ThreatConnect is a dynamic and fast-growing leader in the threat intelligence space, and we encourage our developers and engineers to explore new ideas and solutions to improve efficiency and ease of use.


We are currently searching for a talented Senior Front-end Engineer ready to hit the ground running as part of our User Interface Engineering Team. The ideal candidate should be a versatile team player with the ability to think critically, conduct research and creatively solve problems. Proven experience in JS frameworks such Angular, NodeJS, Type Script with a solid foundation in front-end development is essential. 


We would love someone who is well organized and demonstrates a curiosity for learning and continually stretching boundaries with responsive web design utilizing emerging web trends. You will work as part of close-knit team, so a willingness to lend development tricks towards enhancing our conventions and workflows is sought. Most importantly, we want you to contribute, expand your talents, and really innovate with us.



  • Work in a fun collaborative environment solving complex problems to produce innovative solutions with your team

  • Actively contribute and guide our front-end technology and design roadmap

  • Architect effective front-end quality software components to be integrated into multiple projects

item.title: Visual / UX Designer
item.description:
Are you a user experience star looking to revolutionize the way people innovate and build software? Do you want to help design something that is changing the way people think about innovation? We are looking for a high energy, hands on UX designer who is looking to take a huge career leap forward â and jump on a rocket. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a UX Designer, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two companies were acquired by Aruba Networks [ARUN] and Citrix [CTXS] respectively. Over 100,000 users trust Aha! for their product strategy and roadmaps.

We're looking for someone who:
  • Is experienced in UX design for SaaS applications
  • Enjoys crossing back and forth between UX and graphic design
  • Understands product management and can understand user behaviors and motivations
  • Loves to create wireframes and mockups and refine them based on team input
  • Wants to have ownership and responsibility of key work and measure the success of new designs
We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:
  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Has a "get it done" attitude and a background of delivering beautiful work again and again
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team which has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit sharing program to the right candidates.

To apply: For immediate consideration, please contact us at Design-jobs@aha.io. Please include a resume and link to your portfolio. If you have the right background we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third party agencies.

item.title: Software Developer Web
item.description:

  • Assist Professional Services/Support staff as required with investigations of technical issues

item.title: Director, Brand & Content Strategies
item.description:
Remote Year Business Description
Remote Year brings together communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to spend a year working, traveling, and exploring 12 cities around the world.  Spending one month in each location, communities connect with local cultures and business ecosystems, forming lifelong, borderless personal and professional relationships along the way.  Together we will shape the future of work.

Role Description
We're looking for a seasoned marketing leader to bolster Remote Yearâs brand awareness and to develop a robust content strategy to serve the company and the broader work and travel movement.  Reporting to the Head of Marketing, you will own Remote Yearâs external facing brand and content strategies to fuel the growth of our customer base (both consumer and enterprise), to shape Remote Yearâs message and authority as an industry leader, to build and oversee a small but talented team, and to ensure that the Remote Year brand is understood, trusted and loved. Additional duties of this team include managing the Remote Year presence on social media and on the web, oversight of the recently launched Remote Year Ambassador program, conference and event planning, and agency and related vendor relationship management.  The right person will be comfortable in an "all hands on deck" environment, loves solving problems and can thrive in a fast-changing startup culture where cross-functional collaboration is paramount.

Responsibilities
  1. Brand Development -  Refine and boost Remote Yearâs brand to protect, promote, and enhance the companyâs reputation, credibility, and awareness. Develop standard brand metrics and best practices around brand stewardship, and lead the socialization of brand guidance and tools.
  2. Marketing Strategy - In partnership with Remote Yearâs Director of Digital Marketing, evaluate, size and segment Remote Yearâs current market position, identify growth opportunities and implement marketing strategies and campaigns to achieve customer goals for the company and its product(s).
  3. Community Engagement - Lead the creation and execution of ongoing customer and community engagement, and design and manage loyalty programs.
  4. Collaboration - Liaise with key leaders and different parts of the company to ensure brand alignment, especially with the enterprise sales and admissions teams to better understand our customer needs, communicate to customers effectively, and launch new products and brand extensions that that matter.
  5. Content and Collateral - Provide editorial direction, design, production, and distribution of all organization collateral, and ensure Remote Yearâs marketing, social media, PR, content development and communications efforts are effectively supporting our emerging brand and broader corporate goals.
  6. Leadership - Coach, mentor, and develop a small team of marketing professionals to successfully achieve business objectives and contribute to profitable growth.
Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in related field; MBA or graduate degree a plus
  • 7+ years of well-rounded marketing experience, working with consumer-facing brands that have a passionate end-user and brands that have an enterprise sales component
  • Demonstrated experience building and leading a marketing team

Qualities
  1. Nimble - We need someone proven in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment who can handle multiple projects with stakeholders spanning the entire organization
  2. Solution Oriented â We embrace a bias for action, and need someone who will be proactive in leading this team and strategy to the next level without being told to go
  3. Data-Driven Design Thinker  â We need a leader with an analytical mindset combined with a flair for storytelling and an empathy for the customer
  4. Organization â We rely on great time management skills and the ability to stay connected and productive in a distributed work environment
  5. Collaboration -  We need someone with a proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and to manage agency relationships

To apply: Apply online at https://remote-year.breezy.hr/p/ec5a4d1ff6c0

item.title: WordPress Application Developer & Customer Support Engineer (f/t or contract)
item.description:
About Jhana:
The mission that gets us out of bed in the morning is simple: help millions of people get the great manager they deserve. Peopleâs relationships with their managers are a major driver of job satisfaction. With good managers, teams and companies thrive. With bad managers, teams and companies implode. Thatâs why we built a web application to help managers be effective people leaders.

Weâre a high-performing team of entrepreneurs and deep thinkers who get really excited about ideas and learning. And with more than 50 delighted customers (including FitBit, Etsy, Carfax, and Glassdoor), weâre well on our way to building a strong, sustainable enterprise SaaS company. To learn more, visit jhana.com.

About the job:
Weâre looking for a strong WordPress developer to be our first in-house engineering hire (we prefer full-time but are open to part- or full-time contract or contract-to-hire for the right person). This is a huge opportunity to help us (or even lead us!) in scaling our technical onboarding and support processes. Youâll also be collaborating with our WordPress development agency and product and client success teams to ensure a secure, seamless, and downright awesome experience for managers.
This often means collaborating and coordinating with multiple stakeholders, from a clientâs IT department to our own non-technical writers. If youâre the type whoâs motivated by translating peopleâs real-world problems into technical solutions that users love â and doing so seems all the more exciting in an ever-evolving startup environment â then youâll probably like it here.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage technical onboarding and support for new Jhana customers.
  • Provide first response WordPress platform support for Jhanaâs customers.
  • Work with our Platform team to design and code WordPress platform innovations.

Requirements:

  • 4+ years daily WordPress development experience including: Demonstrable understanding of WordPress standards, database structure and security, custom theme development, custom widget development, and responsive mobile WordPress theme development and testing.
  • Support and full-stack development experience with PHP/MySQL, JavaScript, and HTML5 at a minimum.
  • You have a people-person side and enjoy communicating with a range of stakeholders (clients, internal teams, IT staff, and non-technical people).
  • Youâre self-motivated, collaborative, adaptable and excited about building, fixing, and improving a fast-changing startup.

Benefits:

  • The opportunity to move the needle and to see the immediate impact of your work
  • Competitive salary
  • Generous stock options
  • Company-paid medical and dental coverage
  • Discretionary paid time off: we treat employees like responsible, trusted adults, giving the flexibility needed to manage their work + personal lives
  • Remote-work friendly company culture
  • Personal learning and professional development budgets
  • 401(k)
  • Dog friendly office

We value diversity
Jhana is an equal opportunity employer, and we're actively recruiting diverse candidates from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences. Not sure What do we mean? Read this article by Robin Cangie, head of our Diversity Impact Team, to learn more about our approach to building a diverse company.

To apply: Please apply here: https://jhana.workable.com/jobs/417058/candidates/newQuestions? Don't hesitate to reach out to Maddy at maddy*at*jhana.com. Thanks for your interest!

item.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Full-Time Support/Sales Engineer For Its Cloud Storage and Hosting Products
item.description:
Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have nearly 2,000 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each team member like family.  We have 12 staff members and we're looking to grow our family by adding another full time sales and support engineer to our team.

We say Support Engineer rather than Support Representative, because that's what our support people do:  they work with technical customers to solve technical problems.  You aren't expected to be able to contribute to the actual development of our applications and platforms, but you are expected to truly learn how our products work and to take responsibility for helping our technical (and non-technical) customers successfully integrate and use our products.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in design, coding, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.


âMost startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.â  
â Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

You'll start in the role of Support, but you'll add new roles over time, based on the intersection of your interests and our needs.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.  That's why we consistently pay above-market rates for talent and are generous with raises and bonuses.

Even though Holacracy is a lot to learn, we have a great onboarding process and the rest of our team will guide you through your first few months.  We will take responsibility for ensuring that you quickly learn how to be productive at Action Verb.  We expect that you'll be more productive here than you've been anywhere else.

As a support and sales engineer at Action Verb, here's what you'll be doing:

You'll talk to our customers and prospects via email and telephone.  You'll learn the details of all our products and be able to offer suggestions to customers.  You'll work with our backend engineers to resolve any systems issues that come up. 

You'll maintain a back-and-forth conversation with customers letting them know the progress of anything you're having fixed for them.  You'll give our customers "5-star" service.  We have a reputation for really caring about our customers, and you'll help us maintain that.

You'll be "the face" of our business to all our prospective and current customers.

You'll patiently deal with users who don't fully understand our products.  

However, most of our customers are highly technical CTOs or IT director-types, so we hope that your time will be spent mostly with high-level customers who understand our products.

You'll give live demos to prospects.  You'll help new customers get onboarded and you'll help them integrate our systems into theirs.

You'll give them advice about which tools to use and how to integrate to our many APIs.

We believe that great communication skills are not optional.  We expect anyone who writes for our website or writes emails directly to customers to have perfect phone demeanor and ability to communicate effectively via the phone.  We also expect perfect grammar and professional tone via email.

We believe that our products require intermediate-level coding and systems administration skills to sell and support.  Our hosting products are not your normal run-of-the-mill hosting products.  Vae Platform is highly customized CMS hosting (think Squarespace or Shopify) and BrickFTP is entirely focused on file sharing (think Box.com or Dropbox).  With that said, we still want to see a hosting-centric skillset. Specific hosting-related skills we're looking for include:

  • TCP/IP and understanding of IP routing
  • DNS
  • FTP
  • HTTP
  • E-Mail (including IMAP, POP, SMTP)
  • Firewalls and Ports
  • SSL
  • The following skills are a plus: UNIX experience, PHP/MySQL coding experience

We believe that our products will never be finished.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience.  We constantly reach out to our customers to learn about new ways that we can help them get their job done.  Our support staff tracks feature requests and helps our product designers know what to prioritize.

We believe in paying well for great talent.  This is a full-time, salaried work-from-home position, with full health, dental, and vision benefits (including an additional contribution for 50% of the cost of ensuring your spouse or immediate family on the plan).  The starting pay is $40k-60k per year, depending on experience.  We also provide annual raises or bonuses to employees who continue to work for Action Verb.  You will get to travel with the rest of the team on four trips per year for training and brainstorming.  

Tell us about what you believe.  Please use the form on this page to send in your application now.  We only read cover letters in our first screening round, so make sure yours counts.  Specifically, we'd like you to address the following topics:

  • What is your level of experience with Holacracy?  Had you heard about it prior to this posting?  Do you have any questions about it?
  • What is your level of experience with customer support?  Is any of it within a hosting or datacenter or SaaS context?
  • Have you ever supported a technical product?  What qualifications of yours speak to the ability to support a technical product?
  • What is your level of experience with a remote team?
  • In addition to support, what would be your ideal focus areas and roles within the company? 

We hope to hear from you!

To apply: Apply here: http://actionverb.applytojob.com/apply/b9YTLViLIw/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-FullTime-SupportSales-Engineer-For-Its-Cloud-Storage-ProductsMake sure to include an original well-written cover letter!

item.title: Remote Rails & Front End Developer
item.description:
Are you an Engineer looking to revolutionize the way people innovate and build software? Do you want to create something that will change the way people think about innovation, and work with cutting-edge visualization, collaboration, and social ideation technologies at the same time? We are looking for highly ambitious engineers who want to work on major aspects of the Aha! product â from the back-end through to the end user experience. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As a Rails Engineer, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two companies were acquired by Aruba Networks [ARUN] and Citrix [CTXS] respectively. Over 100,000 users trust Aha! for their product strategy and roadmaps.

We're looking for someone who:
  • Is experienced in Ruby-on-Rails
  • Has worked on key functionality for a cloud-based product
  • Wants to work on a major aspect of product functionality from back-end algorithms through to the user interface
  • Wants to be great and work in a fast-moving, online environment where the end-user is king

We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:
  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Has a "get it done" attitude and a background of delivering superb work again and again
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team that has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team and you can work from anywhere in North America for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit sharing program to the right candidates.

To apply: For immediate consideration, contact us at engineering-jobs@aha.io . Please include your resume and a link to your GitHub.If you have the right background we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third party agencies.

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Architect
item.description:
DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Full Stack Javascript Architect to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

In this role you will have significant responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by executing on the deliverables.

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Technically, you have an excellent background in data structures, design patterns, and modern programming practices with more than 6 years experience. 

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth. Our standard projects use full stack javascript, however we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or C++ .

---

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses. 

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh. 

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out http://why.clevertech.biz.

To apply: https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/587cf17057e2b97032a55289

item.title: Call Center Rep
item.description:
We are looking for a Call Center Representative that will be the liaison between our company and its current and potential customers. The successful candidate will be able to accept ownership for effectively manipulating customer issues, complaints and inquiries keeping customer satisfaction at the core of every decision and behavior.

Responsibilities

Manage large amounts of inbound and outbound calls in a timely manner
Follow communication âscriptsâ when handling different topics
Identify customersâ needs, clarify information, research every issue and provide solutions and/or alternatives
Build sustainable relationships and engage customers by taking the extra mile
Keep records of all conversations in our call center database in a comprehensible way
Frequently attend educational seminars to improve knowledge and performance level
Meet personal/team qualitative and quantitative targets
Requirements

Previous experience in a customer support role
Strong phone and verbal communication skills along with active listening
Familiarity with CRM systems and practices
Customer focus and adaptability to different personality types
Ability to multi-task, set priorities and manage time effectively
High school degree

To apply: email resume to career@intouchhealths.com

item.title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
item.description:
Are you passionate about security? How about being able to work anywhere on the planet? On a beach in Hawaii or taking your lunch break fly fishing a stream in Alaska. Or perhaps you'd rather be close to your home town near friends and family instead of commuting to a big city with the herd every day.


We are one of the fastest growing cyber security companies in the World. You will be working for us remotely full-time, with full benefits including platinum level medical, dental, 401K, gym reimbursement, company paid security certifications (CISSP, Security+ etc.) and conferences.


We are a team of fast moving, nimble, self managing innovators who work in a relaxed atmosphere with a sense of humor. Rather than working for a mega-corp, you will be working in a company where your work has real impact.


Wordfence has experienced incredible growth in the past 3 years and you will be joining the team during a time of steep growth. Our team is 100% remote. Everyone in the company works from wherever they want to work. Most of us are based in the USA and we have international team members in many other countries from Europe to Scandinavia to North Africa and more.


Wordfence has security built into our DNA. Whether you're an analyst, QA engineer, developer or ops engineer, you have a deep interest and passion for security. You will be working with team members who are incredibly talented, well known in the security community and who are from a diverse range of backgrounds.


We use apps like Slack, GitHub, Fogbugz and Dropbox for our workflow. Each team member is World-class at what they do. We have flexible working hours and we are a diverse team ranging in age and location.


All permanent positions will involve a trial period of approximately 2 weeks with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week. You will be paid for this time and it will be used to evaluate whether both parties want to pursue a permanent position.


Here are some of the core skills we look for in team members:



  • A willingness to grab whatever task is required of you and run with it. This may include work outside of your core tasks. We are a small team and everyone needs to pitch in.

  • A high level of productivity and self-management.

  • Must be comfortable working remotely and interfacing with other team members using Slack and other remote tools.

  • Excellent analytical ability and problem solving skills.

  • A strong work ethic.

  • Effective communication skills. This is critical for remote workers and we can't emphasize this enough. You will spend a significant amount of time interfacing with our customers and/or other team members through your keyboard and it's critically important that you can effectively convey your thoughts.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer / DevOps (100%)
item.description:
If working with a sophisticated cloud environment spanning multiple service providers and using a range of innovative technologies such as Docker is music to your ears, then hereâs your chance to join our team as a Site Reliability Engineer/DevOps for Divio Cloud!

Start date: according to mutual agreement (approx. June/July 2017) Location: Australia

Divio has placed Django software in the hands of literally thousands of users across the world, through the Divio Cloud platform and the open-source django CMS. Our company offers world-class services and tools that empower agencies, developers and organisations to build high-value and sustainable online presences and experiences.

At Divio we enjoy technology and love working with Python/Django, AWS, Docker or JavaScript, React and Bootstrap. We believe good products are born out of collaboration and the passion for our work comes with the challenging goals we set for ourselves and the people we work with.

Is it your dream to join a talented team of movers and shakers, working on new ideas and approaches for cloud-based services and products, in a fast-paced environment? Wonderful!

Meaningful, satisfying work

The prospect of working as part of a team to advance the Divio Cloud platform makes your heart beat faster. As our Site Reliability Engineer/DevOps, the overall performance and reliability of the cloud infrastructure will be in your hands and with it the responsibility for all aspects of security, stability, performance and cost-effectiveness of the platform and its related components.

Youâll participate in product meetings and consult with the team on priorities. As an experienced Engineer youâve mastered professional programming skills, and you produce fully functional programs writing clean, tested code. Your output is of a very high standard, which means you have checked, tested and reviewed your own work, and you are aware of the unpredictable.

In close collaboration with the team youâll create robust solutions that follow security principles. Youâre able to work independently, to manage and monitor your own work, and understand the value of going the extra mile in your work. Together with the team, youâll manage the entire software development life cycle, end to end and youâll swiftly answer queries from clients with prioritised support contracts. Since you strongly care about results, you deliver your work and achieve your objectives within the given time and budget.

Your proactive nature makes it easy for you to anticipate problems and communicate any risks at an early stage. As a Site Reliability Engineer/DevOps you act wisely and with foresight, you think entrepreneurially, make accurate estimations, and assess the consequences of your actions thoroughly.

If youâre looking for a challenging cloud platform to work on and a position that offers true responsibilities and a great team to be a part of, then this is the perfect place for you.
 

What you'll need to join us

Above all, you need to really care about what we do. You want to be a part of our resourceful and fast-working team, and you are able to contribute to our ambitious aims.

Required:
  • Very good expertise in programming with Python (experience with Django is required, Twisted is a plus)
  • Very good knowledge of Docker and related technologies (experience with Swarm/Kubernetes advantageous)
  • Very good Linux system administration and optimisation knowledge
  • Very good knowledge of the TCP/IP network stack (including UDP)
  • Very good knowledge of web-related protocols (HTTP, TLS, DNS,...) and load-balancing thereof
  • Experience working with different IaaS providers (AWS, Rackspace,...)
  • Experience with backing services such as Postgres (required), Redis, RabbitMQ and Elasticsearch, including setup, administration, scaling and monitoring thereof
  • Experience working with configuration management software such as Ansible (preferred), Salt, Puppet or Chef
  • Experience with zero-downtime deployment of complex web applications
  • Experience with Django or other Python-based web frameworks
  • Familiarity with git
  • Very professional in the contact with clients and a high degree of empathy to assess their concerns properly and rapidly
  • Extremely reliable character, able to work independently and to cope with pressure
  • A team player, experienced in working in intercultural and geographically dispersed teams
  • Excellent command of spoken and written English (German advantageous)

Additional:
  • Experience with django CMS is a plus

Furthermore, applicants must have a valid permit to work in Australia.

As well as being part of an inspiring team and having the opportunity to contribute your own unique skills and expertise to it, youâll also benefit from an environment where everyone contributes and where we all get our hands dirty to get things done. Your future colleagues are friendly, easy-going, hard-working people who are curious about and stay up-to-date with developments in the tech world, always ready to share their knowledge and support each other to reach the goals. We foster a friendly workplace of respect and trust, and our team enjoys from great flexibility and opportunities for home working. And when we meet for lunch or dinner, we are all in for a burger or raclette and healthy things too. Sometimes we even get the chance to meet abroad as we actively sponsor and attend conferences like PyCon US or DjangoCon EU and have always contributed back to the open-source projects we rely on by supporting their inspiring communities.

Information for recruitment agencies: for this position, we only accept direct applications from candidates and will not consider applications from agencies.

To apply: Do you think you and Divio would be a good fit? Then write to us at jobs@divio.com and tell us why. Oh, and please donât forget to send us some code examples of your previous achievements (ideally links to GitHub, Bitbucket or other repositories) together with a CV and references.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
item.description:
TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 7,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. Weâre passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers."

We offer TaxJar Reports, a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation.

We have an immediate opening for a Ruby on Rails Software Engineer who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs. This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the US.

As a Rails Developer you will:

  • Write excellent Ruby on Rails code daily.
  • Be challenged weekly to solve new problems
  • Review and test your teammates pull requests
  • Create and maintain our existing Rspec test suites
  • Maintain and update our sales tax reporting application
  • Build out apps and services for managing thousands of sales tax rules
  • Help with improving and scaling our SmartCalcs API
  • Work with Rails, Heroku, Postgres, Sidekiq, Magento, WooCommerce, and more.
  • Help monitor and support 24/7 Rails applications and services
  • Ensuring the happiness of our more than 7,000 paying customers is everything to us. Every employee, even the CEO, spends time working the customer success inbox.

Requirements

  • 2+ years production experience with: Rails 4, Postgres, Heroku, AWS, Sidekiq
  • Ability to write clear and accurate tests using RSpec/Capybara
  • Write code that is maintainable and readable by your team
  • Be accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Manage development tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in ecommerce
  • Prior SaaS development, API development or similar app dev experience
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

Youâll be a great fit on our team if you're

  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (Weâre all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Weâre a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. Weâre always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

Benefits

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

To apply: Visit https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/226091 and click the green button to complete an application

  • Help monitor and support 24/7 Rails applications and services
  • Ensuring the happiness of our more than 7,000 paying customers is everything to us. Every employee, even the CEO, spends time working the customer success inbox.

Requirements

  • 2+ years production experience with: Rails 4, Postgres, Heroku, AWS, Sidekiq
  • Ability to write clear and accurate tests using RSpec/Capybara
  • Write code that is maintainable and readable by your team
  • Be accountable for the code you deliver to production
  • Manage development tasks from assignment through to production
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for building simple and intuitive solutions for complex problems in ecommerce
  • Prior SaaS development, API development or similar app dev experience
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

Youâll be a great fit on our team if you're

  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (Weâre all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Benefits

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

To apply: Visit https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/226091 and click the green button to complete an application

item.title: Passionate Rails developer (+ AngularJS)
item.description:
2.5 years ago, I started QuickMail.io, an internet application that allows users to send automated emails as well as follow-ups if no reply is detected (super useful to help start-up and sales teams).

Today, the product is too big for me to be the only one working on it anymore and I need someone able to satisfy more users looking for cool stuffs. We are just a couple of dudes (1 support person and myself) working incredibly hard to satisfy our user base and we really could do with some skilled help. You'll be employee number #3 and the first developer hire.

If you love programming (it has to be your passion) and want to join a hard working small start-up that has zero bullshit in it, no investors to please and is focused 200% on having the user have the best experience possible, please consider applying.

Some of the challenges I face:

- Our users love QuickMail.io (I just found out that our Net Promoter Score is above 8) but many find it confusing at start (something I plan on addressing this year with your help). This will require a few UX changes and may be a perfect place to get your marks.

- So many cool improvements suggested but I don't have the bandwidth to do some that are aligned with the product direction. The magic word expected in the application form will be gem.

- Improve code coverage and refactoring for bigger items (I had a period of high growth and could benefit from more refactoring in some parts of the code base).

- We are using Ruby on Rails 3 & AngularJS 1.3.15, I had no time to evaluate the impact of a possible migration to the latest version yet.

You'll get the chance to work closely with me as a founder, and I do happen to have 18 years experience developing programs. I was Scrum master and lead a few small technical teams so you'll be in good hands (we are a tech company first and foremost).

These are 3 core values: https://quickmail.io/values/

Main role and initial responsibilities?

  • Improve code coverage
  • Implement UX changes
  • Brainstorm and help designing big items
  • Possible RoR migration

Your opinion on how to improve the process is not only valued but expected.

What I'm looking for

  • A passionate programmer
  • Excellent understanding of Ruby on Rails (2 years work experience)
  • Some experience with AngularJS
  • Database understanding (scalability and optimization...)
  • A person of action, self directed & self motivated
  • Have a webcam & stable internet.

I'm looking for someone responsible and reliable who enjoys solving technical puzzles in a self driven manner and can move things forward.

Position

It's a full-time remote position.

To apply: Fill in this form: https://goo.gl/forms/auysIGDbuCYE1oPo1

item.title: Concierge
item.description:
Our Concierge Team is the face of Suiteness, we help our customers find the perfect suite, restaurant, nightclub, limo, or tour. Our customers book suites at luxury hotels and expect impeccable customer service.

Concierge Role
  • You will be communicating via live chat, email, and phone with customers looking to book suites and ancillaries such as limos and helicopter tours.
  • Constantly making sure that our customers have the best trip possible, their check-in should be smooth and we should be there to help if any issues do arise.
  • This is a full-time position on a rapidly growing team of passionate customer support people.

Qualifications
  • English language proficiency.
  • Must have their own personal computer with internet access as well as a personal cellular phone.
  • Someone who has had experience in hospitality or customer service is a plus.
  • We are looking for people in the following timezones: Pacific, Central, Eastern, and any of the Australian Standard Times.
  • People who will go the extra mile to make sure our customers are happy.
  • You must love travel, we are driven by our love of travel.

About Suiteness
Suiteness is the only place to book luxury hotel suites online. We are a start-up located in Oakland California with team members in Denver and Austin. We started in 2012, we've raised our funding from great investors like Y Combinator, Structure Capital, and Bullpen Capital. We are on a great growth curve and are approaching profitability.

Our Core Values
  • Open and honest communication - Everything we do is in the open, because we are a small team we all help each other.
  • Work life balance - We started Suiteness because we were also starting families and keeping those two in balance is near impossible at most companies.
  • Respect and assuming positive intent - Trust is given out quickly and taken back slowly. We all make mistakes and we want to foster an environment of solving problems without blame.
  • Humble craftspeople - We want to be the best at what we do, our focus is on doing the best work and learning more without ego.

To apply: Send a resume and a cover letter that includes your favorite vacation to jobs@suiteness.com

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Credly helps the world recognize lifelong achievement with the most popular platforms for verifying, sharing and managing digital badges and credentials. Its enterprise-class Open Credit platform allows organizations to officially verify skills and competencies; distribute portable and secure digital credentials and open badges; and gain actionable data and insights. Thousands of education institutions, industry associations, employers and workforce developers worldwide use Credly to make achievements visible, marketable and useful.


Credly is led by an experienced and energetic team, and is backed by a widely-respected group of venture, strategic and non-profit impact investors.


What we build ... 



  • A platform that supports the creation, issuing and earning of credentials.

  • Rock solid support for validation of credentials & securing all user data attached to them.

  • A set of APIs to support a growing developer ecosystem.

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
Kuali builds open source higher ed solutions in a competitive space where users are just waiting to be delighted.

Why join us? Our work matters â weâre helping our customers improve the quality of education by decreasing administrative costs. We compete in a competitive space where users are saddled with outdated, inefficient, legacy ERPs and eager to be delighted. Weâre generating revenue and growing quickly with nearly 150 customers and 50 employees. Youâll have a significant impact on what we do and how we do it because we are an empowered group of entrepreneurs. Plus, youâll get to work with some truly amazing people at a fast-growing, design-centric EdTech startup.

Kuali is committed to open source software development funded by SaaS revenue and development projects. If youâre looking to make your fortune off a quick flip with no business model, youâd be happier someplace else. The Kuali community recently celebrated its 10 year anniversary, and the participating colleges & universities are rooting for us to deliver something amazing with the next generation of Kuali products.

We offer a truly exceptional benefits package including full premium coverage for employee and dependent medical and dental care. We offer 401(k) matching, employee profit sharing and all the paid-time off that you need (just work it out with your manager).

If these company values appeal to you then we should talk:

  • Deliver Amazing Experiences
  • Cultivate Openness
  • Iterate to Evolve
  • Act with Accountability
  • Assume the Best
  • Practice Humility

Our products help universities and colleges manage their administrative business so they can focus on their mission of teaching and learning. They replace cumbersome legacy systems built by big ERP companies. Our Financials product has been in production since 2008 and is used in multiple countries. It has improved efficiencies and audit experiences for our customers but needs improvement in the areas of user experience, configurability, extensibility, and fit for the cloud and continuous delivery. And, of course, there are tons of new features we would like to add. In the past year, weâve made great progress. Our teamâs knowledge and skills are deep and wide, we work hard, we are open and collaborative (everyone has a voice and contributes), and we have fun. Weâd love your help as we continue to evolve. 

REQUIREMENTS

Youâre curious. You solve problems. You execute. You advocate for the customer. You produce value.
Our engineers are equally interested in creating new functionality and refactoring old code because they care about solving problems for customers. Theyâre all architects and scientists, spending time learning new technologies and also inventing new ideas. They spend time honing their craft and teaching one another.

Currently our tech stack is Java, react.js, Oracle / MySQL, and MongoDB. As we evolve the product, JavaScript and NoSQL will become more prevalent and we will be introducing more RESTful services. You might know Java, or Rails, or .net, or Node, or Haskell. We donât care. Great developers can learn new tools.

Youâre one part architect, one part execution machine, one part customer advocate, and one part learner.

Youâll be responsible forâ¦

  • Helping set architectural direction for our new micro-services architecture
  • Creating elegant code
  • Building relationships with customers to develop a deep understanding of their needs
  • Collaborating with and invigorating the team, the company, and the open source community
  • Supporting critical bugs or security issues in a âdevopsâ role
  • Advocating passionately for customer priorities during product development
  • Creating amazing software and services

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

About youâ¦

  • Youâve worked on multiple web applications.
  • You care about the quality of your code.
  • You care about user experience and also about the back end.
  • Youâre well versed in at least one programming language, but preferably many.
  • Youâre versatile. You know when to think big and when to act small. Youâre equally comfortable in both greenfield and refactoring projects.
  • Youâre inspired to achieve results, and your enthusiasm is contagious.
  • Youâre passionate about your role in helping customers and other developers achieve their missions, and you advocate for them fiercely.
  • Youâre curious and continuously seek knowledge and share your discoveries with others.
  • You know how to influence and serve.
  • You understand the complexity of large enterprise applications.
  • Youâve used agile methodologies and have ideas on how youâd improve them.
  • Youâre into Continuous Delivery and devops.

If you have some of these too weâll be delighted:

  • You have experience with the Higher Education community.
  • Youâve shipped Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions.
  • You've worked with micro-services before.
  • Youâve been through incremental refactoring efforts.
  • Youâve worked on mobile apps.

BENEFITS

  • Autonomy
  • Profit sharing
  • 401k matching (up to 4% of your salary)
  • Full health premiums for you + dependents
  • Take the PTO you need
  • Technology and training allowances
  • Telecommuters are welcome

To apply: Please apply at our career website. https://kuali.workable.com/jobs/166880

item.title: Intermediate Web Applications Developer Drupal
item.description: __DESCRIPTION__Advisor Websites, a software company recognized as one of the top 5 best workplaces in BC, is looking for a talented and self-motivated intermediate developer to join our growing product development team working on our Drupal 8-based content management system. You will have the opportunity to work on maintaining our CI/CD workflow and mentoring a team of developers solving challenging problems which will directly improve our client experience. If you enjoy growing your technical skills, driving growth in a startup-style environment, and working in a culture that loves creativity, experimentation, and innovation, then this is will be a great place for you!__Responsibilities__* Follow sound engineering principles to find practical solutions to problems assigned* Provide scripts and documentation for maintaining secure and up-to-date template-driven infrastructure on AWS* Evaluate and implement tuning optimizations for the stability and speed of our applications* Provide excellent code in PHP using standardized development frameworks, procedures and processes* Work with other team members to specify, update, and prioritize software system requirements according to business objectives* Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time and according to spec* Help and mentor other team members for the execution of new software features and improvements* Recognize opportunities to benefit us by eliminating inefficiencies in our systems & processes__Additional details__This is a full-time position in our Coal Harbour office, or remote. If remote, you must be available during 9am to 1pm PST weekdays.Read more about Advisor Websites and what it is like to work with us: https://advisorwebsites.com/company/culture----__REQUIREMENTS__* Experience with Drupal* 3+ years of PHP development experience working on high-traffic web applications* 3-5 years of professional development experience* Exceptional communication, presentation, and organization skills* Self-reliant learner and creative problem-solver* Able to write consistent, clean, concise, and well documented code* Experience with managing code-driven infrastructure for high-traffic web applications (using Terraform or similar tool)* Experience with maintaining continuous deployment workflows for PHP applications (using Jenkins or similar tool)* Understands common Linux system tools' configuration (systemd, firewalld, etc)* Understands common web application security attacks and how to prevent them (SQL injection, XSS, etc)* Strong understanding of relational databases (preferrably MySQL)* Experience working with distributed version control systems (git)* Experience with Project Management tools (Jira, Basecamp, Trello, etc)* Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or Computer Science----__BENEFITS____The Perks:__* Opportunity to be a part of a Top 5 Company to work for in Vancouver as voted 2 years in a row by BC Business* Profit-sharing plan* Enrolment in Advisor Websites' Bucketlist Program = 1 day off and $$ to spend every year to knock items off your BucketList* In additional to vacation days, you get 4 wellness days per year to use when you just need a break* In-office massage chair* Free beer on tap every Wednesday and Friday* Company snacks and coffee* Weekly activity groups* More after-hours foosball games than you can handle

item.title: Visual Designer
item.description:
DESCRIPTION

Food Blogger Pro is looking to add an experienced Visual Designer to our team.

Our ideal candidate has a deep love and appreciation for web design that solves real world problems.

If that sounds like you, then chances are you enjoy reading design blogs, attending design meet-ups, have strong opinions on design software and tools, have a basic understanding of HTML and CSS, and regularly bite your tongue when viewing websites or apps that miss the mark in obvious ways.

Still resonating?

Glad to hear it.

As the Visual Designer at Food Blogger Pro, you'll be designing and evolving the brands behind our five main sites:

  1. Pinch of Yum
  2. Food Blogger Pro
  3. WP Tasty
  4. Nutrifox
  5. PlateView (beta)

If you join the team, these are some of the first projects you'd dive into:

  • Nutrifox, our SaaS app that generates nutrition labels for bloggers, does not have a dedicated pricing page. We need one. We have a good handle on the direction and content, and need you to bring us through to a finished responsive design.
  • The RSS emails that are sent from Pinch of Yum are busy and underperforming. Every blog post that we publish on Pinch of Yum is emailed to thousands of subscribers, and our current execution of RSS-to-Email is far from outstanding. We need your help to design, test, and iterate until the email hits our targets for clarity and results. We'll be there to collaborate all along the way.
  • We need a blog design on WP Tasty, the parent site for our new WordPress recipe plugin: Tasty Recipes. We're excited to start producing content for the blog, but the blog design is basic and lifeless. We're looking for you to create the blog index page, individual blog pages, and specific call-to-actions (like opt-ins or call-outs) that might appear within the posts.

REQUIREMENTS

Still interested?

Wonderful.

We have 5 more things we're looking for. If you meet these 5 last requirements, we'd love for you to apply.

  1. Have an up-to-date and impressive portfolio
  2. Have the ability to clearly communicate in a written medium
  3. Have the ability to see what needs to get done and do it
  4. Be detail oriented and organized (you know who you are)
  5. Be self-motivated (again, you'll know if this is you)

BENEFITS

We're a remote company, so you can live just about anywhere. We're open to hiring internationally, but prefer to have at least 4 hours of overlap in the 8AM-5PM range (CST).

You'd be working from home. Or a co-working space. Or from a hill overlooking a vineyard. Anywhere you can get the work done.

We offer a 4% 401(k) match, health insurance reimbursement, a flexible schedule, and the chance to work with a small but mighty team of kind, caring, and passionate people.

To apply: https://food-blogger-pro.workable.com/jobs/423743

item.title: Vue.js Javascript Python Developer
item.description:
Are you an awesome programmer? Do you take great pride in your code? Do you naturally make the time to make code efficient, readable and maintainable? Do you lose track of time while coding? Do you feel a deep glow of satisfaction when you've come up with an elegant solution to a problem and it just works. In short, do you enjoy really coding? Do you enjoy challenges - do you look for them or even make them up sometimes? Is a good looking UI as important as a clean efficient ORM to you? If so, we really want to talk to you.


We are looking for a Web Developer with about 2 years of experience. You will need a good eye for UI - CSS will be a big part of what you do. You will be required to take one or two coding tests along with a phone and in-person interview.



  1. We prefer local candidates who can work from the office daily, but are open to qualified remote candidates

  2. We're unable to sponsor visas

  3. Direct candidates only, we'e not looking for third parties, recruiters, contracting agencies. Unless you're the candidate applying for this position, DO NOT contact us

  4. We're only looking for candidates in the USA or Canada

  5. This is a full-time position, we're not looking for part-timers


CODE TEST:


Write and deploy a small web application (preferably using javascript &/ python) to store a list of persons, containing the following fields: firstname, lastname, date of birth and zip-code. We’re looking for basic CRUD functionality. Any bells and whistles are welcome. Send the link to the deployed web-app and the source code. This is your chance to impress us. This is more important than your resume.
