item.title: Senior Operations Engineer
item.description:
At FreeAgent we help freelancers and micro-businesses be more successful by putting them in control of their company finances.


We have built an award-winning online accounting product that offers full end-to-end compliance, from time tracking to tax return filing. We're based in beautiful Edinburgh and we're growing from strength to strength with over 55,000 paying customers and strong YoY growth. Our NPS is off the charts - customers love what we do!


We're looking for a talented Operations Engineer to come and work on the FreeAgent app, internal services and supporting infrastructure. You'll be working as part of our Infrastructure team, squashing single points of failure, fixing bottlenecks, profiling load and solving interesting scaling and automation problems.


Our Infrastructure team is responsible for the application in production at all levels in our stack. Being this flexible means we've achieved near 100% uptime over the past year (99.98%) whilst performing daily code deployments, countless database migrations and, every quarter, a complete DR flip between our physical data-centres. We're happy with this, and we're looking for people who can help us keep going!


Responsibilities



  • Support the smooth running and uptime of our external and internal production systems

  • Support the path-to-production for our frequent changes to application code and data

  • Maintaining our disaster-recovery and data backup processes

  • Conduct peer reviews of infrastructure and configuration changes

  • Be actively involved in the continuous evolution of our systems and infrastructure, from small tweaks to epic changes

  • Work alongside the wider engineering team planning and developing new features

  • Participate in our 24/7 emergency on-call rota

  • Ensure no single points of failure are introduced so out-of-hours calls stay rare

item.title: Rails Pro Wanted
item.description:
Are you an amateur? Someone who enjoys talking code theory but rarely ships? Do you like to overcomplicate, and see pragmatic development principles as another theory to discuss, rather than work by? Do you need meetings and micromanagement to feel important and hide the fact youâre not producing anything valuable?

If you answered yes to any of the above, please stop reading now. Find yourself a nice startup in San Fran that has reached itâs series Z round of funding for a product no one wants and that is still in beta. Iâm sure they'll be happy spending someone elseâs money to pay you an exorbitant rate for producing little.

We're a small team building a big sugar dating site, we get shit done and donât take ourselves too seriously. Weâre looking for another Rails pro. Someone who likes taht we donât have meetings, and everyoneâs too busy shipping to look over your shoulder and make sure you're doing the same. You'll enjoy the freedom to express yourself and have a say in the design and function of what you build. 

Youâll love the fact there's nowhere to hide if youâre not producing, youâre a pro after all. We need you to have experience shipping code on user-facing sites. You will learn and teach in this position, just not the basics. 

Initially you'll join the team for a trial - perhaps as a part-time reprieve from the bureaucracy of your day job. Weâre bootstrapped and care about profit but have the means to reward you well if youâre creating value. Do the work and weâll enjoy many years of creation together. We have no interest in becoming a giant team thatâs hard to manage, so hopefully you're the last back end dev hire we ever need to make.

If you were mildly entertained, or want a job we would love to hear from you! Tell us about the user-facing work you've shipped, and why weâd be stupid not to hire you. Bonus points if youâve developed for mobile or social apps before.

Thanks

To apply: Send your proof of being able to do the work to apply@secretbenefits.com

item.title: Senior Salesforce Developer
item.description: As a Senior Software Developer in the roundCorner development team, you will be involved in the technical design and development of all aspects of the roundCorner product line. You will develop, enhance and maintain software in accordance with the Force.com best practices as specified by Salesforce.com.Your responsibilities will include designing, coding, debugging and performance analysis as well as being involved with customer deployments, partner product integrations and competitive benchmarking. You will work in a tight-knit team and will share challenges with your colleagues.This position requires someone who has great interpersonal skills to work with many different departments within the company including Support, Consulting, Product Management, and your fellow team members in Engineering. You will be developing high quality code that will be rolled out to thousands of customers. You are comfortable developing in Java or .Net, and ideally, Salesforceâs Apex language.The job involves working as a member of an agile team building new functionality or enhancing existing functionality in line with roundCornerâs development program. Knowledge of the SCRUM methodology would be an advantage as well as having developed packaged solutions sold to external customers.There may be the need for occasional offsite meetings or visits. This job will require ad-hoc flexibility in working hours in order to support and liaise with the companyâs US division, customers and technology partner Salesforce.com, as needed.What Youâll Do:â¢Knowledge and experience of complex enterprise applications and advanced Object Orientated (OO) patterns and architecture principles, such as database design and concurrent usersâ¢Developing high quality software within agreed timescalesâ¢Working with the Product Owner, Business Analysts and Technical Architect to develop software from a set of requirements using the SCRUM methodology.â¢Working collaboratively within a SCRUM teamâ¢Contributing to daily standup, story grooming, and sprint planning meetingsâ¢Reviewing User Help documentationâ¢Working within a framework of published standards and practices within the companyâ¢Providing technical advice and guidance to Business Analystsâ¢Support of the operational business through adoption of new technologies and development of ad hoc prototypes and Proofs of Concept (POC)â¢Seamless solving of planned and unanticipated issues arising during development phaseâ¢Supporting the SCRUM release planning and sprint planning process through analysis and estimation of development workâ¢Contributing to Automated Testingâ¢Assisting with Manual Testingâ¢Packaging for major and minor releasesâ¢Assisting the recruitment process as well as training and mentoring new starters into the teamâ¢Strict management of source code modifications at release timeâ¢Influence best practice process improvementsWhat Youâll Need:â¢Experience in development with Java or .Net, and ideally, Salesforceâs Apex language.â¢Demonstrable experience of developing enterprise applicationsâ¢Skills in analyzing and solving problemsâ¢Understanding of application architecture principlesâ¢Proficiency in OO programmingâ¢Ability to work both independently and as part of a teamâ¢The ability to communicate clearly about ideas & designs both verbally and in writingâ¢Understanding of data integration and web servicesâ¢Ability to work well within a teamâ¢Resourcefulness in getting over problems and establishing clarityâ¢Excellent English skills, oral and writtenâ¢Managing time and projectsâ¢Ability to communicate well with staff in customer-support and other departmentsâ¢Experience developing on Force.com

item.title: Salesforce Developer
item.description:
About Toptal


Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.


Position Description


We are looking for senior Salesforce developers to be responsible for managing all aspects of Salesforce.com (SFDC) usage needs, including configuration, customization, and implementation of all applications and 3rd party integrations. You will be collaborating with project managers and engineering teams to meet delivery timelines for Salesforce requirements across a variety of industry contexts. You will be expected to work with business stakeholders to understand functional requirements and build processes for continuous improvement of solutions.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects, ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s, with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Benefits:



  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.

  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.

  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.

  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.

  • Extremely competitive compensation.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, develop, test, document, and deploy high quality business solutions on SFDC based on business needs and platform best practices.

  • Implement improvements and build new functionality in SFDC applications.

  • Support technical team members and business stakeholders in fixing SFDC issues as they arise.

  • Handle SFDC administration needs, including creating new accounts, defining new custom objects, fields, and formulas, building and updating reports and dashboards, etc.

  • Build and support configuration tasks, including data cleaning and data import jobs, APEX code and triggers, SOQL queries, system workflows, etc.

  • Maintain high security standards for all data stored in Salesforce.com.

  • Research SFDC integration issues and work closely with technical stakeholders to find solutions.

  • Stay on top of Force.com technologies and trends and effectively communicate relevant insights to the rest of your team.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.


Requirements:



  • Extensive functional knowledge of Salesforce data structures and professional experience as an SFDC developer.

  • Strong understanding of how Salesforce can be leveraged to meet complex business and reporting requirements.

  • Strong experience with Visualforce, APEX programming, and Force.com APIs.

  • Experience with database software and Platform as a Service solutions.

  • A business-oriented, highly analytical mind with a knack for accounting for both complex business and technical considerations simultaneously.

  • Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written experience with technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Ability to assess ongoing processes critically and recommend creative, thoughtful operational improvements with an eye towards their technical ramifications.

  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.

  • Be open to receiving feedback.

item.title: Senior Ruby Developer
item.description:
As a Senior Ruby Developer at FindHotel, you will help to develop and improve our high-performance website FindHotel, scaling up web traffic from 2M+ visitors to 10M by the end of the year.


What you tell your friends you do


'I am a great Ruby developer who can make run code safely yet fast as lightning!'


What you will really be doing



  • Building a high-performance website, helping scale up web traffic from 2M+ visitors to 10M by the end of the year;

  • Developing our own APIs and deploy them as independent services;

  • Integrating our product with internal tools and APIs (e.g. event tracking, A/B testing) built either by us or other squads at FindHotel;

  • Building the right suite of monitoring and alerting system, in order to have both the helicopter view and the magnifying glass at hand whenever needed;

  • Improving the code base, architecture, infrastructure, and overall quality of our product, in order to deliver a great experience to each and every one of our users.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an experienced Ruby developer in a diverse team of talented experts, and you enjoy working on a product delivering quality code while meeting ambitious deadlines;

  • You choose the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. We're always open to re-evaluating choices that were made in the past: there is always a budget for good ideas;

  • You understand speed is a feature: you love benchmarking and experimenting with different technologies to figure out new ways of improving your code over time.


What we worked on last quarter



  • Laying the groundwork for a modern adaptive web application, based on React and Redux frontend which communicates with a decoupled Ruby On Rails backend.

  • We built a scalable infrastructure in the cloud, based on AWS, Docker, and Continuous Deployment, that serves on average 11M+ requests per day.


What a day in the office might look like


In the morning, after the daily stand-up, you pair program with a fellow developer to improve the performance of an API call which is not as fast as it could be. After lunch, you provide some feedback on the quality of a couple PRs from your teammates. Then you implement a new feature from the backlog or tackle an annoying technical debt issue that you've been keeping an eye on for a while.


The team


You will be working in the Product Squad with co-developers Luca & Fernando (Backend), Jop, Suzana & Ali (Frontend). Katia (UX designer) will help us shape the product, transforming the input from Omer & Orhan (Data Analysts) into beautiful and usable designs. Sam (Product Owner) will prioritize the roadmap and a QA Engineer will make sure we deliver high-quality software to our users.


Why join now?



  • We have successfully built the foundation of a great product, which will evolve in time and compete with the big players of the travel industry. By joining the team now, you will have the chance to have a strong impact on how we grow our tech stacks and the way approach work.

  • We are looking to grow traffic from 2M monthly visitors to 10M+ by the end of 2017. This is the perfect time to become part of the team working on the core behind our product, tackling exciting challenges around scalability and performance.

  • We are a company that is growing fast, hiring talent across many different areas of expertise (development, data science, data analysis, marketing, UX). Each team collaborates with the others on a lot of different tasks, making every day the day when you learn something new.

  • You will have fun writing code for existing and new applications, integrating them with internal and external systems, with room to explore new technologies and architectures!

item.title: Part-Time Designer For Ongoing Blog Work
item.description:
We're looking for a talented, productive and detail-obsessed designer to help us create amazing images, infographics and ebooks for our blogs.

You may have heard of us from our Journey to $500K blog or our Customer Support blog (in fact, weâd prefer if you have, or have at least read it before applying), or from seeing us in places like TheNextWeb, KISSmetrics, Buffer, Copyblogger, Hacker News or elsewhere around the web.

Hereâs what youâll accomplish at Groove:

- Deliver awesome design work, including but not limited to blog graphics, infographics and ebooks, each week.

- Work directly with our Head of Marketing to incorporate feedback.

This will start as a part-time position, around 10 hours per week.

Here are some things that describe you:

- Youâre a kind, upbeat person.

- You have the availability and ability to do great work under short deadlines (1-2 day turnaround on blog graphics, 1 week turnaround on infographics).

- Our core values (groovehq.com/about) -- these arenât just words that we put on a wall, these are the cornerstone of how we run our business -- resonate with you and align with what makes you tick.

- Youâre tech savvy and totally comfortable using software like Slack to coordinate with our team.

- You have experience working remotely and being super-productive with minimal supervision.

- Youâre a problem solver and enjoy figuring things out on your own.

- Youâve read our Journey to 500K and Customer Support blogs, so you know what kind of company we are and what kind of visuals we like to use.

To apply for this role:

Send the following to len at groovehq:

1) A link to your portfolio

2) Ideas on how you would improve any two graphics found on our blogs (NOT the header art, but graphics within the blog posts), either the support blog (http://www.groovehq.com/support) or our startup blog (http://www.groovehq.com/blog)

3) Your hourly rate

4) Your Friday night drink of choice

To apply: See above.

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
Bezpený chat pre lekárov, vyhadáva leteniek, i podpisovanie zmlúv na tablete. Za všetko toto a mnohé alšie sme zodpovední my.


Máš pocit, e banky sú v technologickom praveku? iadny stres. Pracujeme na tom, aby sme to fixli.


Vyberáme si technologicky nároné projekty, lebo milujeme výzvy.


Momentálne arujeme s týmito technológiami:



  • React.js + Babel + Redux na webe, Electron na desktope,

  • React Native pre iOS aj Android,

  • Node.js + Express, Python + Django alebo Clojure na serveri,

  • ke treba REST/GraphQL/Websockets,

  • PostgreSQL/Datomic ako databázy.


Ešte máš trochu obavy, ale si na nás zvedavý? Prí na niektorý z našich meetupov, kde diskutujeme o problémoch a nových technológiách. Ak nie si z Bratislavy, to vôbec nevadí. Nájdeš nás aj v Prahe, Brne a vo Viedni. Poul si u o ReactiveConf, druhej najväšej svetovej konferencii (nielen) o React.js? Správne! Aj v tom máme prsty.

item.title: Rails Developer
item.description:
GotSoccer is looking for a full time Rails developer to help build and maintain our web applications supporting both youth and professional soccer leagues around the world. 

Youâll actively participate in the development and maintenance of our software and will have lots of autonomy conceptualizing, building, and testing new features. 

You should be comfortable working on both the back-end and front-end of large web apps, have an eye for good UI/UX, and have experience collaborating with teammates, project managers, and project stakeholders to define, schedule, and shape a productâs roadmap. 

The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years experience working with production Ruby on Rails applications and is comfortable using most or all of the following:

  • Ruby on Rails
  • PostgreSQL
  • Javascript/jQuery
  • RSpec
  • Bootstrap
  • HAML
  • Coffeescript
  • Git 

Additionally, excellent English communication skills are required. You will be working as an independent contractor for up to 3 months while coordinating with our team, after which a salaried position is available. 

To apply: Send your resume to jobs@gotsoccer.com including 3 references.

item.title: Web Development Instructor
item.description:
We are looking for talented individuals who have a passion for teaching people how to code. Our students have a diverse background, from working professionals to fresh-out-of-college individuals who seek to transition into careers in web development positions.


Instructors lead classroom discussions, guide inquiry, emphasize the meta-skills and core concepts of software engineering, support students in their projects and challenges, and provide feedback to students and TAs.


You don't have to have a ton of experience instructing! You just have to be a lifelong learner, proven teacher or mentor and love to help people change their lives and succeed.


Teach with us in any of the following cities:

item.title: iOS Developer
item.description:
iOS Developer Job Description:
Joinpiggy.com, a company within the same investment portfolio as Kaagapay Solar, is looking for the highest caliber iOS developers to join its technical teamâs expansion.  

We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

What We Are Looking For

  • Proficient with Objective-C
  • Experience with iOS frameworks such as Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
  • Knowledge of other web technologies and UI/UX standards
  • Understanding of Appleâs design principles and interface guidelines
  • Knowledge of low-level C-based libraries is preferred
  • Experience with performance and memory tuning with tools such as Instruments and Shark, depending on project needs
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
  • Knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools {{such as Git, Mercurial or SVN}}
  • Familiarity with continuous integration

Job Functions:
  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform
  • Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features
  • Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs
  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization

Job Requirements:
  • Strong English language skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation.

Include in Application
  • Github profile
  • Links to iOS applications you have developed

How to Apply
You may apply to this position through our careers portal available at:

https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/0cfba2649197

To apply: You may apply to this position through our careers portal available at:https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/0cfba2649197

item.title: Codeable Happiness Hero
item.description:
Codeable Happiness Hero

Hey there! Thanks so much for taking time to get to know us. Hopefully weâll be getting to know you better too! 

Weâre searching for the next person who could be a great fit for our Codeable Happiness Team!

This new Happiness Hero would need to be available during the hours of 8am - 4pm EST.

The Codeable Happiness Team

Our Happiness team works closely with our experts, clients, and visitors to provide a superior level of service and support not found with any other outsourcing company. Weâre working hard to make a difference and change perceptions about WordPress outsourcing by actually caring about our clients and experts. :)

At the foundation of what we do, we brighten peopleâs day. And the faster we can reply and help in a fun and creative way, the better. Ultimately, we make people happy as often as possible, every day. 

Weâre a quickly growing start up at just 3 years old. But in those 3 years, weâve had over 51,000 projects posted and in the last 90 days have paid out over $1million to our experts.

We hold ourselves to high standards and in the last 28 days our users started 1,699 new conversations, of which our team replied to 1045 (61.5%) with a median first response time of 3 minutes. While this is good, we want to be better and respond even faster - which is where you come in!

What We Value and Who Weâre Looking For

We value honesty, integrity, clear communication, empathy, patience, and understanding. So naturally, weâre looking for someone who shares these same qualities and who can delight every person they come in contact with using a friendly and helpful tone.

Ideally, we want to find someone who is happy and positive, is a WordPress developer (frontend, backend or fullstack), and enjoys chatting with people.

99% of all communication with our users is done via text and takes place inside of Intercom, but sometimes a quick phone call is needed.

Where Youâll Work

Where ever makes you happiest as weâre a fully distributed team. Based on the hours we need your help, you most likely will be based in the East Coast, USA somewhere, but if youâre willing and able to work 8am-4pm EST Monday - Friday, you could live in Alaska and that would be cool too. Youâll be working alongside team members around the world including Denmark, Slovenia, UK, and the US.

Benefits of Working With Us

-Live and work from anywhere that makes you happiest and doing your best work

-Join us on team retreats at least 1x per year (usually WordCamp Europe). Our last retreat was to Vienna, Austria and before that Seville, Spain.

-Competitive salary with pay raise at 3 months and again at 1 year anniversaries.

-Paid vacation time off (starting at 2 weeks per year)

-Working alongside a brilliant passionate team in a startup environment

Still interested? Awesome! We want to hear from you!

If you feel weâd make an amazing fit together, weâd love for you to take time to reach out to us.

Tell us a bit about yourself and why you feel youâd make a terrific Happiness Hero. 

You can also include a CV or resume, but donât forget to tell us about yourself! 

Bonus points if you can share with us any screenshots of emails or chat logs showing you providing a great experience to the person on the other end of the chat. 

To apply: Send a resume to applications@codeable.io

item.title: Campaign Support Engineer
item.description:
MoveOn.org

CAMPAIGN SUPPORT ENGINEER

Regular and Exempt, Full-Time â¢ Starts ASAP â¢ Competitive Pay â¢ Excellent Benefits
Work from Anywhere in the US

Help us build the resistance!

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in 2017, MoveOn is investing deeply in supporting our organizing team to use technology that amplifies ordinary peopleâs voices in our democracy. We are hiring a passionate problem solver who will work broadly across many projects with campaign staff to run innovative campaigns using top-of-the-line political technology, digital campaigning tools and data analysis. Do you love working at the intersection of progressive organizing and technology? Join our team! Work alongside MoveOnâs core team of strategists, organizers, data scientists, and software engineers on technical projects that lift up progressive values, defend vulnerable communities, and build the resistance movement that will fight Trump.

The MoveOn team works and lives in communities around the country, providing employees tremendous flexibility to live and work anywhere in the continental United States. MoveOn staff are embedded in the communities that make up America, and we pursue the healthy development of community and social connections outside our work lives.

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly get up to speed and develop mastery in the online campaigning platform ActionKit. Candidate will have a supported onboarding and learning plan that includes ActionKit.
  • Work side by side with MoveOn team members on complex digital organizing tasks like creating targeted emails, surveys, donation forms, and live event recruitment pages.
  • Help MoveOn team members edit HTML on campaign webpages.
  • Write SQL and use data analysis tools to support team members with campaign reporting.
  • Train MoveOn team members on complex workflows that use online campaigning tools.
  • Contribute your ideas to organizational strategy discussions
  • Contribute your ideas to tech team discussions to enhance and improve our tools and tactics.

Required skills and experience:

  • Knowledge of SQL in a relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • Experience editing HTML and CSS, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • Comfortable with or willing to learn to use a linux command line interface.
  • A strong interest in learning and developing expertise in new technical tools, frameworks, and software.
  • Able to fluently communicate with both technical and campaign staff, and communicate technical information to a diverse audience
  • Determined and thorough- see projects through from idea to implementation to launch, supporting MoveOn team members through the whole process.
  • Curious, and a fearless learner and problem solver.
  • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely.

Location: Position may be based anywhere in the continental United States.

Classification: Regular and Exempt, Full-Time.  Every position at MoveOn begins with a 6-month introductory period (including our Executive Directors) which is intended to serve as a natural period of evaluation and reflection for both MoveOn and the employee to determine whether a successful employment relationship can be created.  Nothing in this classification section alters the at-will employment relationship between MoveOn and MoveOn employees.

Salary, and Benefits:  Competitive salary including benefits such as 100%-employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for all staff and their children; employer-paid premiums for life insurance for all staff; four weeks accrued paid vacation time per year; 12 weeks of paid maternity or paternity leave, 10 days accrued paid sick time; and reimbursement of office expenses.  

To apply: To Apply: Click here to submit your application, resume, and cover letter: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdBIhDTYywvWBsQeoAMgiGVR_KKqsUPqPzDYq95CrSwH0ONIA/viewformMoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

item.title: Senior Ruby Developer (Full Stack)
item.description:
Job description

We are looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to join our team. The position is full time and remote. Our office is based in London and youâll need to make an effort to overlap a large part of your day with 9-5 GMT hours.

As a Ruby Developer at Purepoint, your contributions will be used by hundreds of thousands of customers. You'll join a close-knit team of 7-10 other developers and you'll have an opportunity to shape the future of this particular project.

Strong knowledge of Ruby is required. Real world experience building and maintaining Ruby on Rails apps is a must - from UI to APIs. This project will involve being part of a team working on an application used by tens of thousands of customers every day.

Our typical project stack is Ruby, Rails, JavaScript and PostgreSQL. We prefer developers who are are language agnostic and embrace testing new approaches to solve problems.

Role responsibilities

  1. Work in an agile team, taking part in standups, and retrospectives (Via Google Hangouts)
  2. Understand the structure of existing applications and how to work with them
  3. Interact regularly with our clientâs technical team
  4. Use your knowledge of Ruby on Rails to build robust applications
  5. Review commits of other team members

What we look for

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and has experience working in a variety of different languages. We admire developers who take initiative, make their own decisions and implement them clearly. Front end knowledge is also a bonus.

As a Purepoint developer you will work in a small and close-knit group. Our mindset is focused on constant iteration and improvement.

Team & tools

As part of our team, we will give you all of the tools necessary to excel at your role. We use Jira, Trello, Slack, Github and Google Hangouts in our day-to-day business.

Our managerial structure is very flat. We put customer experience and satisfaction first and really believe in delivering a service that is cutting edge.

About Purepoint

Purepoint is a remote-first software development agency. We help businesses build better bespoke software. Clients range from rising startups to household brand names.

The projects we do are incredibly varied but they share one overarching theme â putting great minds together to build better software. Youâll have the opportunity to help businesses embrace the newest technology and bring better services to market.

If you like the idea of continuously improving, working at Purepoint is a great decision. We provide everything you need to excel at your role and weâll do our best to keep interruptions and meetings to a minimum.

What we offer

  • Competitive pay
  • Work remotely
  • Flexibility with your working hours
  • A minimal approach to meetings

Requirements

  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Min. 4 years Ruby experience is required
  • A strong understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience working with Bootstrap
  • Experience required working with APIs, Git, and complex server side design
  • Experience working in an agile software team environment

To apply: https://purepoint.recruitee.com/o/senior-ruby-developer

item.title: Tech Lead
item.description:
DESCRIPTION:

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

- 75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical strategy;
- 25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients. You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated successful product launches.

___

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the clientâs concerns as well as a colleagueâs concerns. You are always learning and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities.
 

___

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME 

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.


LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses. 

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh. 

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out http://why.clevertech.biz. 

To apply: https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/587cf23957e2b97032a5528d

item.title: Senior Android Developer
item.description:
The Senior Android Developer will work on a project for Sierra Leone together with other developers in the eHealth Africa Sierra Leone office and Berlin office. The responsibilities are to ensure a solid project foundation of the mobile application, modularize the application for easy reuse in other projects as well as preparing it for open sourcing. This highly responsible position involves using established work procedures to analyse, design, develop, implement and maintain the existing application as well as new parts of the application.


Keywords: Android, Java, Mobile


Duties and Responsibilities


Defines objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning system features and functionality


Works closely with developers and end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction


Collaborates with project manager and other software developers to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain the Android application


Provides thought-leadership regarding implementation best practices Assists in estimation and assessment of feasibility of features

item.title: QA specialist Telecommute, Full time
item.description:
We are seeking a Website QA Specialist with a background in Web/Mobile QA and an interest in online marketing. This role requires an exceptional eye for detail and the desire to join a company that builds best-in-class Websites and mobile apps. This is an ideal position for a detail-oriented individual with experience in manual and automated QA of Websites or web-based applications, including test plan creation, regression testing, data testing, functionality and usability testing, and bug reporting and tracking.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure quality of updates, including accuracy of specification, cross-browser compatibility, product/service descriptions, and link functionality
  • Experience with automation
  • Test Websites at all stages of development for usability, functionality and adherence to requirements, and suggest improvements
  • Develop and execute test plans for new Website releases and updates
  • Edit copy for spelling, grammar and style.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

  • Has 3 or more years of full-time experience in Website and Mobile QA, preferably working on multiple Websites or Web-based applications
  • Automatic testing system experience
  • Brings to the position outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting strict deadlines
  • Possesses excellent writing and editing skills for content and development, as well as proficiency adjusting style for a specific audience and situation

How should you apply for this job?

  • Only applications written in English are going to be processed!
  • Please state on the mail subject the job position you are applying for!
  • Please state on the mail subject the country you live in
  • Please state on the mail subject the country you live in
  • Please apply to: jobs@revenviews.com

Application process:

  • Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.
  • We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.
  • 1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!

What we offer:

  • Job location is in Cyberspace. Employee can work from a home office and be part of a multinational development team.
  • Communication with the all team members is done through Instant messenger, web cam, Skype, email and other collaboration tools.
  • Employee will work under an employment agreement in front of a registered offshore company.
  • Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country of residence.
  • Tax statements will be subject to local laws and would be performed on the employee's responsibility.
  • Salary will be paid once a month and transferred directly to employee's beneficiary bank account by wire transfers or by paypal.
  • Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)
Please apply to: jobs@revenviews.com

To apply: Please email your CV to jobs@revenviews.com

item.title: Project Manager
item.description:
Silverorange is an eleven-person design and development agency based in Canada. Weâre looking for a detail-obsessed communicator and problem solver to serve as digital project manager for our team, and make us a full dozen.

Our focus is on interesting and meaningful projects. Weâve worked with well known technology organizations like Duolingo and Mozilla, and with world-renowned doctors training other doctors through online education. The core of our team has been together for eighteen years, and weâve created a unique culture built as much on quality of life, openness, and a wonderful work environment as our commitment to building great user-focused systems.

Weâre looking for a project manager who will look at our existing tools and processes and then help us either refine our methods or introduce new ways to make us more productive. You will be empowered to continually evaluate and improve our process, thereby helping the entire team excel at their jobs.

This position is available immediately and we will work with you to get you started as soon as youâre available.

Responsibilities

  • Youâll be our enabler. We want a project manager who will get the most out of our team by enabling our developers, designers, and management to focus on their strengths and providing a solid map of where weâre going as a team.
  • Collaborating with our developers and designers as well as our clients to sustainably and effectively drive projects to completion.
  • Balancing the needs of concurrent projects that are each reliant on a different group of people on our team. Youâll be responsible for overseeing the progress of the projects and ensuring everyone has appropriate tasks.
  • Optimizing for collaboration and communication, and helping our team remain passionate about our work from project to project.
  • Leading the teamâs development process, whether itâs Scrum, Kanban, something in-between, or something else.
  • Being the point person for managing our tasks and clients using project management tools. We currently use a mix of Trello and Targetprocess for project tracking and Slack for communication.
  • Helping the team resolve issues as they come up, and raise them with clients and project owners as necessary.
  • Being the source of truth for the state of each teamâs projects, keeping track of project status and deadlines and working with all parties to adapt to changing goals when necessary.
  • Keeping our path to the future clear: as our bug and feature backlogs change, working with our clients to keep our upcoming tasks relevant.
  • Balancing deadlines and client needs with a supportive work environment and focus on quality of life.

Requirements

  • You are an enabler who thrives on finding ways to get the most out of our team and team members.
  • You have a passion for learning and self-improvement, both in terms of the tools and methodologies weâll use as a team, and personally.
  • You love team building and facilitation, including leading meetings, and problem resolution/mediation.
  • You can effectively manage time commitments and priorities across competing goals. The ability to shepherd the team to completing the goals is also a must.
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills and have significant experience communicating with a team and with clients.
  • You know how to effectively work with remote team members and business partners across time-zones. Most of our clients are in California and we have team members in Charlottetown, Montreal, Vancouver and Ecuador.
Weâre confident weâll be able to help you get up to speed on the technical end of the job, but ideally youâll identify with some of the following statements.
  • You care deeply about maintaining a sustainable software development process where Product, Design, Engineering, and you collaborate.
  • You have been a Project Manager in the software industry.
  • You have led projects involving technical operations and new software product/service development.
  • Youâve helped ship a digital product and know what it takes to get a project done with a team of developers.
  • Your strong knowledge of project management approaches to product delivery will help us avoid common pitfalls. We use a hybrid scrum/kanban process now, but are open to new ideas and always evolving.
  • You have experience joining and communicating with a tightly knit team of people, and dealing directly with external clients.

Remote working is a possibility

This position can be remote, though you are welcome to work from our lovely offices in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada. Being located within four hours of Atlantic Standard Time (UTC-4) is required. We prefer to hire from within Canada.

As it stands, 30% of our current team and 95% of our clients are remote (most are international), so youâll have to be comfortable working within and supporting a remote work environment regardless of your location.

If you are looking for the job to be remote, weâd want you to come and work from Charlottetown (on us) for your initial few weeks of work, and we attempt to have all employees spend some time throughout the year in Charlottetown working with the local team. So count on visiting Charlottetown semi-regularly.

Though you may be working remotely, youâll be an active member of a great small team, both here at silverorange and with our clients. Regular voice or video communication will help keep you in touch with the smart people youâll be working with.

Benefits, etc.

  • Flexible work hours.
  • 3 weeks of vacation, on top of 9 days of civic holidays and 3 weeks of company-wide shut down.
  • Health and dental coverage.
  • Yearly company-wide bonuses based on overall company success, plus ownership opportunities and dividends for long-term employees.
  • Salary ranging from CAD $50,000-78,000 per year.

How to Apply

Email us at slice@silverorange.com with the subject line Project Fitzroy, a brief overview of your qualifications, and an explanation of why youâd be great for the job. Tell us about an interesting project youâve managed or helped ship. We value individuality and variety, so make sure to tell us what youâre all about. If you have an online presence (blog, Twitter, Facebook), send it along.

People with different backgrounds and experiences make us stronger, and weâre always looking for ways to improve. Why not help us with that? Weâd love to hear from you.

silverorange, 84 Fitzroy Street
Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, Canada
C1A 1R7
slice@silverorange.com   +1 902 894 4533

To apply: Email us at slice@silverorange.com with the subject line Project Fitzroy.

item.title: UI/Front-End Developer (mid/senior level) - Europe only
item.description:
Real Audience is a Swedish tech company that works within the fields of video production and Artificial Intelligence / Big Data.

Now we are looking to strengthen our remote team with a front end developer. As we try to get the team to meet from time to time, we look for people that lives in Central or Eastern European countries.

Your main responsibility will be to contribute to the front end systems that our customers are using.

You should have a sense for:
  • Modern graphical design and usability (UI/UX)
  • HTML and CSS with extensions such as Sass and Less
  • RIA frameworks, like AngularJS
  • Working with agile methodology, such as Scrum
  • Common tools, such as Git
  • Working from home in a remote team

Ideally, you should:
  • Have amazing design skills
  • Have experience with Optimistic UI
  • Not be able to live without SCSS mixin
  • Have experience with HTML&CSS frameworks like Twitter Bootstrap
  • Have at least three years of programming background

Additionally, you:
  • Seek to understand the business strategy and needs of our customers
  • Inspire your colleagues with your thirst for mastering the things you work with
  • Are a passionate developer, proud of the quality of your work
  • Are an independent worker and self-starter, as the job is fully remote
  • Are able to communicate well in spoken and written English
  • Are willing to travel to Sweden, Poland or Norway for occasional in person meetings with the team
  • Live within the CEE-area (for example Poland, Ukraine, western Russia etc.) - time zones between UTC+1 and UTC+4

Bonus points for:
  • A stunning portfolio
  • An interesting Github profile, or proven track record of open source contributions
  • A university degree in technology, science or other relevant areas

We offer:
  • An opportunity for you to work with, and create, cutting edge technology within the area of machine learning and artificial intelligence
  • No technical debt
  • Stable company with a Scandinavian client base, with the intent to expand to the rest of the world
  • A great and experienced remote team
  • A permanent full time contract, with a fixed monthly payment (on invoice - range â¬2000 - â¬3000)

To apply: Please send your application together with CV and relevant links (portfolio, open source contributions, Github/Stack Overflow accounts, public projects, samples etc.) to Real Audience AB. Please also state clearly in which country you reside and will work from. Email address for applications: aXJlYWxseXdhbnR0b3dvcmt3aXRoeW91@realaudience.se

item.title: SUBJECT
item.description:
No prior experience required! Although this position is likely ideal for someone who thrives under performance-based salaries, such as sales/biz dev people.

Join our fun company with remote/at-home working options, semi-flexible hours,  group working trips to exciting places and work with an awesome bunch of people who love to work hard yet respect a work/life balance!

We sell life-changing courses and supplements to help men achieve their dating and intimacy goals. Our products and marketing are top notch, making them an easy sell.

Thatâs where you come in - we are looking for an âA Playerâ to recruit and manage affiliates (essentially creating sales partnerships), help them drive sales and take the company to the next level.

Some of what youâll be doing:

- Developing online recruitment strategies to bring in new affiliates

- Taking our existing affiliate leads and getting them to start selling our products to consumers (or sell larger volume of products)

- Managing affiliates by providing a fast, reliable point of contact

- Providing affiliates with strategies and resources to sell our products, including custom banner ads, landing pages, tracking links, technical help and more (mostly through Skype and email)

- Negotiating commission and other contractual details with affiliates to keep them happy and incentivized, while ensuring the company makes maximum profit

- Managing weekly affiliate payouts

- Keeping trying of affiliate fraud and affiliates with abnormally high refund rates

- Attending annual affiliate events in the US, Europe and Asia (roughly 4-6 per year) to recruit new affiliates through networking and word of mouth, including Affiliate Summit and Affiliate World conferences â flights and hotel paid for by the company. Youâre free to stay longer for an extended trip if you want!

- Planning and running our booth at affiliate events, making sure we generate new affiliate leads and take a strong step towards âclosing the dealâ to bring those affiliates on board

You have some or all of the following traits:

- Ambitious and a go-getter

- Love working on a performance-based salary (on top of a base salary) and have succeeded well with this payment structure in the past

- Willing to take time to thoroughly understand affiliateâs motivations, drives and desires

- Comfortable talking to people at networking events, asking for tips or connections and comfortable in a party environment (the âaffiliate marketingâ world has a lot of these)

- Persistence (it make take quite a bit of follow-up and help to get some affiliates to start selling and many will never become active, long-term affiliates)

- You must understand how to 1) find new affiliates, 2) get them to start selling, 3) help our existing affiliate sell more

- Comfortable competing with other affiliate managers in your same position

DETAILS ABOUT THIS POSITION:

Compensation: $40k - 50k+ base salary, along with tiered bonuses, bringing annual payout for a strong-performing candidate to $65-75k+

Hours: 10am â 6pm Eastern, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)

Location: Currently work from home (US and Canada strongly preferred). Monthly in-person work weeks. Company may acquire office space soon.

Our Team: Our core team is located in NYC. We are 20 strong, plus part-time employees.

To apply: No prior experience needed! To apply, please write an email to jobs@gothamclubmedia.com with the subject line âYour A-Player Affiliate Manager Is Here!â and include your answers to the following three questionsâ¦1. Why are you an ideal fit for this position? Please include specific examples of past experience and proof as to why youâre a high-performing candidate.2. Do you have any prior knowledge or experience with affiliate marketing?3. Why are you leaving (or have left) your current position?4. Do you have any specific interest in our company mission to help men reach their dating and intimacy goals? (If no, thatâs fine, it is definitely NOT a deal-breaker!)Please send your answers in no later than Monday, March 27th 2017.If you look like a good match, weâll move you on to âRound 2â of the interview process, where youâll get to learn more about the company and weâll get to learn more about what you think you can do!

item.title: WANTED
item.description:
Join our small, fast-growing company and help provide thousands of men with powerful, life-changing courses that improve their social, dating and sex life!

Weâre in need a full-time community manager who ideally has 4+ years of experience (weâre open minded if you have less and want to make a case) who can help grow our community of men.

Youâll be evaluated on specific engagement and growth metrics, as well as qualitative factors.


This Job Entails:

  • Keeping your pulse on the community needs, desires and complaints and reporting these back to the CEO
  • Launching, running, moderating and growing a forum
  • Launching, running, moderating and growing blog comments
  • Running, moderating and growing a Facebook group
  • Running, moderating and growing YouTube comments
  • Organizing events, including guest forum Q&Aâs and weekly webinars
  • Reaching out to community members to resolve community-related issues, complaints and conflicts and dealing with âproblem usersâ
  • Helping customer service resolve issues, both proactively and reactively, that present themselves inside the community
  • Identifying key community members and providing opportunities for them to participate on a higher engagement level (moderators, writers, etc)
  • Identifying and welcoming new members and providing opportunities to introduce and involve them in the community
  • Working with CEO to establish community guidelines and rules
  • Composing weekly community âmetrics and trendsâ reports
  • Helping to ensure our webinars and guest events drive sales (willingness to learn basics of selling on a webinar and marketing skills)
  • Hosting and MCâing events with special guests via Google Hangouts or other webinar services. This means you occasionally will speak to our community via live broadcasts
  • Experience hiring and managing moderators, people to respond to comments and questions, as well as new employees to help expand community efforts


Nice To Haveâs:

  • Experience launching, growing and moderating a forum
  • Experience launching, growing and moderating Facebook groups and/or pages
  • Experience launching a âcommentsâ section on a blog
  • Experience running polls, contests and other events to help boost community interest and engagement


NOTE: Some of our content talks about sex and contains adult content. If thatâs not ok with you, this may not be the ideal position for you.


Details about this position:

Compensation: $50k â 60k+

Hours: 10am â 6pm EST, Monday-Friday (semi-flexible)

Location: Can work from home. Weekly or monthly in-person meetings. The company may acquire office space soon (position will remain remote). Highly prefer someone in US / Canada.

Our Team: Weâre located in NYC and 22 strong, plus additional part-time employees.

Forward Submissions to jobs@gothamclubmedia.com

To apply: Reply to this post and put âA-Level Community Manager Ready To Join Your Cause!â as the subject line of the email. Attach your resume. Within the body of your email pleaseâ¦Explain your interest in the company (5 sentences max)What is your past experience that qualifies you as a community manager? (5 sentences max)What is your current position and why are you leaving (or have left) your current position? (5 sentences max)Would you want your role to grow or change in the next 2-5 years? If so, how? Forward Submissions to jobs@gothamclubmedia.com

item.title: Business Intelligence Developer
item.description:
• Fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills and deliver business critical apps



  • Rare chance to join our highly experienced team and work on cutting edge technology



  • 2 year fixed term opportunity based in Murdoch, WA – Flexible Working Available


The role:


We are seeking an experienced Microsoft business intelligence developer to join our team and help deliver and support a number of key business initiatives. We need a developer who is enthusiastic, motivated and proactive in their approach.   We’re also looking for a team player who requires minimal supervision, is conscientious in their work, forward thinking and can be relied on to get the job done.


 You will:



  •  Work directly with stakeholders to understand their requirements and devise innovative and effective solutions

  • Identify, evaluate and recommend potential solutions that will deliver superior business outcomes

  • Undertake an array of interesting and challenging projects using latest tools and technology

  • Drive adoption of Agile practices by participating in planning, estimating and prioritising

  • Develop using the full technology stack and take ownership of the end-to-end solution

  • Support operational systems and build a comprehensive knowledge base

  • Be part of an experienced and professional team in which you can share, learn and grow your expertise

item.title: Full Stack C# Web Developer
item.description:
• Work on the latest online engagement technology

  • Further your career with an international, innovative online company

  • Work with the largest US retailers

  • Great team from all over the world

  • Remote working arrangement


Powerfront is looking for Full Stack developers to support our engagement unique platform - INSIDE.


We use a complement of the latest HTML5 & MS Technologies like C#, .Net, SQL Server to build a new type of Customer Service Solution.


We are a dedicated, passionate and close knit team with technology running through our veins. We are reinventing the world of web Customer Engagement software; we are not developing small applications. We have developed software that transforms the way companies run their online business. You will use the latest technologies. Every day, you will be challenged. A career at Powerfront is your opportunity to become a leader in the future of the software industry.


Our Platform is used by Tier 1 Companies worldwide including Staples, Neiman Marcus, Toys”R”Us, Adidas, The Honest Company, Rooms To Go, GE Money and others. This is the caliber of companies you will be communicating with.


Responsibilities



  • Liaise with our Customers to provide technical support

  • Manage and liaise with our international development team to deliver bug fixes and feature requests originated from our Customers

  • Extend the current Powerfront INSIDE platform using the latest technologies.

  • Improve Integration with 3rd Party systems like Salesforce, Zendesk and other CRM/Chat solutions



Values we look for



  • Fully engaged with our Company and our Customers

  • Honesty, Caring, Self-Improvement, Confidence, Fun, Productivity and Toughness.

  • Showing an eagerness to grow and learn more about the business. This includes asking questions, reading, modeling others, and being open and responsive to feedback/areas of improvement.

  • Exhibit professionalism and commitment to role, the company and creation of the product.

  • Hard Worker not afraid of sometimes burning the candle at both ends

item.title: Javascript Developer
item.description: You can apply to this role via our careers page:https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/9ba898a361f8__Senior JavaScript Developer Job Description:__Joinpiggy.com is looking for the highest caliber JavaScript developers to join its technical teamâs expansion. The role will be remote based working in your local timezone during normal business hours.__What We Are Looking For__*Previous history working as a senior Javascript developer.*Extremely proficient in modern Javascript constructs including ES6, automation tools such as gulp or grunt, testing tools such as mocha or jasmine, and build tools such as webpack, browserify or babel, and the ability to demonstrate such knowledge.*At least 2 years experience using a popular Javascript framework such as AngularJS or React in a commercial environment.*Node/NPM experience*Experience building Chrome/Firefox browser extensions is ideal but not mandatory*Requires a person who can "figure it out" and a lover of challenges and puzzles. This is not your standard "Form needs validation" javascript job. Requires a lot of reverse engineering.__Job Functions:__*Build and update Piggyâs various browser extensions and the rulesets that allow our Apps to interact with various Merchant Websites.*Build and automate unit and integration test suites.*Build reusable code and libraries for future use.*Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.*Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.*Contribute to team development and initiatives.*Occasionally assist the UI Developer with enhanced Javascript functionality as needed.
