item.title: Product Manager
item.description: [Doubledot Media](https://www.doubledotmedia.com) is a New Zealand-based company creating online eCommerce tools for people looking to start their own online businesses. Weâre based in Christchurch, but over 90% of our team work remotely from various places around the world. (Living in the future FTW!)We have a Product Manager position responsible for managing and owning various products we have built.We want to hear from people who have a great eye for detail, passion for and intelligence with data and an up-to-the minute knowledge of the latest and greatest techniques in user experience design and development in eCommerce. You should be someone who relishes having major input on several different projects, delights in producing first-class user experiences and continually tries to make each new project better than the last.###Responsibilities include:* Designing product strategy through assessment of users, market trends and competitive opportunities.* Defining both long-term strategy and short-term plans to achieve the product vision and deliver business results.* Executing all product lifecycle processes from concept to launch.* Delivering innovation in features, usability and product performance.* Being the internal and external advocate for our products.* Developing comprehensive product feature plans and actions to achieve business goals.* Monitoring key performance metrics to ensure a high level of product performance.###Other important requirements for this role are:* Excellent written English and a friendly manner in writing. You should be able to build a rapport with customers, other staff and stakeholders.* Common sense and the ability to "read between the lines" to understand what customers are concerned about.* Meticulous attention to detail. Your spelling and grammar should be top notch.* Good time management skills. Since this can be a remote working position, you'll need to be organised, motivated and (dare we say) a "self-starter".###If you think you have the following, we want to hear from you:* Experience managing eCommerce website or software products from creation through to launch.* An excellent analytical brain and the ability to spot trends and come up with hypotheses that "normal" people wouldn't see.* The ability to translate broad product vision into clear and meaningful plans.* A strong user focus and empathy with customers.* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to converse with technical staff.* The ability to translate requests from non-technical staff into elegant and functioning websites.* Deep experience with Amazon, eBay, Shopify, Alibaba or similar products. * Skill with prototyping interfaces and webpage designs (sketching and wireframes).###Neat things about working with us:* Flexible hours (can discuss full-time, contract & remote options)* Work from home/anywhere (or from our Christchurch office)* Relaxed, ego-free, family-friendly work culture* [Other cool perks](https://www.doubledotmedia.com/jobs).

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer Developer
item.description: We are looking for a senior DevOps engineer/developer to join our growing team!The person in this role will eventually be responsible for managing our internal and client-facing infrastructure, supporting our active projects, and supporting the development team as-needed. Demonstrated experience in both AWS and Azure is desired, but if you happen to only have experience with one, letâs talk anyway. Ultimately, we are looking for someone who needs little-to-no technical training to be a functional contributor to the team.__The kinds of technologies you will be working with:__* AWS, Azure, Heroku* Puppet and Chef* SQL Server* Windows and Linux* Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Jenkins __The kinds of things youâll do:__* Backups, disaster recovery, systems administration* Migrations* Development environment management* Visualize and create infrastructure and solutions architecture diagrams for internal and external projects* Environment sizing and cost estimating* Work with small teams of developers as the DevOps expert __The things you need to have:__* 8+ years experience in IT DevOps, with 2+ years in a senior role managing an AWS/Azure environment* Significant AWS or Azure cloud experience* A development background and experience with Visual Studio, Git, and related technologies* Mastery of your own motivation. We are a highly-distributed workforce and we need folks who can manage their workload and schedules without significant oversight* An ability and willingness to align your work day to U.S. Eastern Standard Time (UTC/GMT -5) as might be needed You might not be the corporate type, and that's perfectly fine with us. We're a small consulting company that focuses on providing exceptional service and value to our clients while having fun in the process.Our clients bring us in to solve problems that they may not have the domain knowledge or expertise to solve on their own. We are a team-in-a-box, providing all the roles necessary to deliver the desired end solution on time, on budget, and on scope.Our employees are located throughout North America and Croatia, and everyone has the flexibility to work remotely (from home or a co-working space), as we feel this is a great way to help people have the career and lifestyle they want. We hire folks who have a positive attitude, a passion for technology, work well in high-stress situations, and get excited about solving hard problems.Visit www.coria.com to learn more about who we are and what we do!Coria has corporate entities in the United States and Croatia. We are a Results Only Work Environment and offer unlimited PTO to all our employees. We cover your mobile phone, home internet, and work equipment expenses. Full time employees in the U.S. will have health (we pay 100% of the premium for individual or family plans), vision, dental, disability (LTD/STD/AD&D), and life insurance. Full time employees in Croatia have health, accident, life, and pillar III optional pension insurance.If you are interested in talking to us about this position (or just to find out more about us for other openings we may have), please reach out to Andrew Boisvert at aboisvert@coria.com. Thank you!

item.title: Customer Support Advocate
item.description: ___Kyako is seeking a Customer Advocate to join our Customer Support team. We have offices in Gurgaon and London, but youâre welcome to work from anywhere with an internet connection!___Kayako is one of the leading customer service platforms, used by more than 30,000 organizations to deliver a better customer experience to millions of customers. We believe that customer support is more than just answering questions - we directly impact business goals through providing feedback to our product team and driving customer success. Our support team is one of the main reasons for our success and we want to be role models for our customers.We believe traditional help desk software prevents great customer experiences by depersonalizing customers and disempowering teams. Thatâs why we built Kayako, the unified customer service platform, to help teams work better together to deliver better, personalized and memorable experiences to their customers at scale.As the flag-bearer of the next level of customer experience in the industry, we are looking for someone who is not deterred by the road blocks and instead enjoys the challenge and keeps moving forward. Someone who doesnât believe in following the herd. Someone who is proactive and enthusiastic, passionate, super friendly, well-spoken and energetic. A good sense of humor is also always a plus.You'll love this role if you get your kicks by helping others. Weâre looking for someone who loves solving problems and creating long term customer relationships. This is a great opportunity if you care deeply, genuinely and passionately about customer support and about the role it plays in making a customer-centric team successful.__Responsibilities and goals youâll own:__* Respond to and resolve customer queries through chat, email and the community forum quickly and effectively.* Educate and empower our customers to get better at customer support through Kayako* Become an expert on Kayako features and capabilities* Drive our Voice of the Customer program to advocate for the customer and improve Kayako through incorporating user feedback* Escalate critical support issues to the appropriate internal channel* Help to develop the customer support profession through sharing knowledge, contributing to blog posts, experimenting with new innovations and discussing best practices.* Assist in creating first-class Help Center documentation* Increase customer satisfaction and build loyalty through providing amazing, personal customer support.__Who will love this job:__* You like making things easier for customers and colleagues. If thereâs a roadblock, you want to smooth it away.* You are energised by interacting with and helping people. You know that everyone has trouble sometimes, and seek to empower and educate our customers.* You love reading and learning about new ways of doing things. Thereâs always a better way.* Youâre a positive person and know how to look on the bright side.* You bring solutions to the table not just problems. (But you arenât afraid to point out where weâre going wrong).* Youâre comfortable with a little chaos and uncertainty. We move fast and sometimes decisions are made without all of the information.__Experience and requirements:__* Excellent verbal and written communication skills* Ability to solve problems logically and critically* 1+ years in online customer support, preferable supporting a SaaS product* Demonstrate effective time management and organizational skills* A strong understanding and working knowledge of the internet and technical concepts (eg. you understand the terms HTML, browser and cache)__Reasons why youâll love working at Kayako__* Stock options - we want everyone to be invested in the success of their work.* Unlimited PTO - take time off as you need it.* Pension - weâll contribute to your pension so you can plan for the future.* Private health insurance package - including a 50% discount gym membership, because we want to be and stay healthy.* Choose your own gear - we want you to have all the tools you need to do the work best.* Flexible working hours - we love spending time in the office together and think weâre at our best in-person, but weâre realistic and flexible about it.* Family friendly - we operate a childcare vouchers scheme for all our employees.* Monthly on-site massage - yes, we have someone come in once a month. No, itâs not weird.* Fully stocked fridge and pantry - keeping you going. Standard.* Weekly craft beers and wines - every Friday. No reason or explanation needed. And we wonât judge you if you wanted to start on Thursday, either.* Weekly fruit delivery - to compensate for the weekly beers.* Weekly team lunches - because we like food, and we love bonding over it.* Regular learning opportunities - from Lunch nâ Learns to opportunities to attend the best industry events, we want you to grow in every way possible.__Equal opportunities (it is boilerplate, but we believe it)__Kayako is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability or age.__About Kayako__We've brought customer service a long way. We started out with an ambitious goal: a better online customer support experience. Today, tens of thousands of businesses deliver better, personal customer service to millions of customers using Kayako. We are on a mission to completely revolutionize the way businesses support and build relationships with their customers. Why do we care? Because life's too short for bad customer service. Does that pique your interest? Drop us a line.

item.title: Senior Product Manager WordPress
item.description: GoDaddy's (NYSE: GDDY) mission is to radically shift the global economy toward life-fulfilling independent venturesâhelping our customers kick ass by giving them the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. With more than 14 million customers worldwide and more than 62 million domain names under management, GoDaddy gives small business owners the tools to name their idea, build a beautiful online presence, attract customers and manage their business.As a Product Manager for WordPress, you will join an agile, collaborative, customer-focused team of product, marketing, design, support and engineering leaders who share a passion for building and delivering the next-generation of WordPress experiences.You will gather and prioritize requirements, help define the vision, deliver a seamless product experience and collaborate on product innovation. Youâll also continually refine products with a data-driven, iterative, customer-focused approach to deliver WordPress experiences that customers love.Do you thrive on building amazing product experiences used by millions of customers globally? Do you enjoy making the complex as simple (and user-friendly) as possible? Do you want to help customers navigate the complexity of WordPress to build businesses as great as their ambitions? If this sounds like you and you're as passionate about helping small businesses leverage WordPress as we are, then we want to meet you.__Responsibilities__* Gain a deep understanding of how customers engage with WordPress across markets and devices to become a subject matter expert on our products and competition.* Define and prioritize product roadmaps for WordPress experiences by synthesizing customer insights, data, market trends, competitive intelligence and business strategy.* Analyze and manage key performance metrics, continually looking for optimization opportunities.* Deliver experiences that serve the unique needs of various verticals and regions.* Conduct customer research and usability studies to identify opportunities that improve the overall product experience.* Work closely with engineering, design and marketing teams to scope, define, and drive a strategic WordPress roadmap that aligns with business priorities and customer needs.* Define customer stories for new features and work side by side with the User Experience team to bring them to fruition for the team.* Be the champion for product & customer success KPIâs and continually seek paths to drive improvements. * Rapidly test and iterate hypothesis to improve metrics.* Represent GoDaddy at WordPress related community events like WordCamps, meetups, etc.__Requirements__* Experience using WordPress and a deep understanding of the WordPress community.* Remote applicants welcome, though you need to be available during US working hours.* Must be a world-class individual contributor, able to thrive in a fast paced, high-output, and time sensitive environment.* Must have the ability to lead other individual contributors without a reporting relationship. E.g. able to lead via influence in absence of authority.* Must be able to work as part of a remote, cross-functional team.* Experience building experiences for non-technical audiences, e.g. at a product company, at an agency, as an entrepreneur, etc.* Experience with collecting, interpreting and deriving insights from data.* Have a knack for creating simple and effective user experiences.* Excellent organizational, prioritization and communication skills with a high attention to detail.* Experience converting ambiguous ideas to product solutions relevant to small businesses and individuals.* Must have experience as a Product Owner and using Agile development methodologies.* Experience managing products or projects from concept to delivery.* Strong analytical abilities with a âtest & learnâ mindset.* Ability to translate complex business issues into SMART goals._GoDaddy is an Equal Opportunity Employer_

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description: At Zoomi Inc., weâve created the next generation of performance optimization technology, by bringing together the disciplines of machine learning, predictive analytics and adaptive learning. Weâre looking for a top-notch Data Scientist to join Zoomiâs global team and help us expand our suite of artificial intelligence algorithms for (human) learning.__In your role, you will:__* Use data mining to discover information hidden within large datasets* Build, optimize, and evaluate predictors using machine learning techniques* Coordinate with developers in transferring new algorithms to production* Present data analysis results to existing and prospective clients__More specifically youâll:__* Analyze datasets consisting of clickstream measurements and social discussions generated by learners, and course content created by instructors* Apply regression analysis to discover relationships between learning behavior and performance* Tailor discriminative and generative machine learning algorithms to the science of learning* Collaborate with the development team weekly, providing pseudocode and/or code of new methods that will be transferred to production systems* Join calls with clients as needed to discuss current areas of exploration specific to their datasets* Write technical reports, presentations, and white papers of results__Minimum qualifications include:__* Masterâs degree in Computer Science / Engineering, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or related, with a focus on machine learning and data mining topics, or* Bachelorâs degree with 5+ years of experience with data science on real datasets* Ability to identify relationships within large datasets that are not obviously related* Solid programming experience with Python, Matlab, or R, and with Java, C, or C++* Working knowledge of database technologies such as SQL* Strong passion and enthusiasm for learning technologies* Strong interpersonal skills__Additional, preferred qualifications include:__* Doctoral degree in Computer Science or related, with an emphasis on data science research* Knowledge and experience with distributed computing technologies (e.g., AWS, Hadoop, Spark)* Prior experience working with learning technologies and/or datasets from learning scenarios (such as in higher education, corporate training, etc.)* Product and business development experience__What we value:__Zoomi values passion, agility, quality, customers, innovation, trust, meritocracy and EQ. We are in search of people that are inventive, autonomous, motivated and comfortable with a little bit of ambiguity.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description: At Zoomi Inc., weâve created the next generation of performance optimization technology, by bringing together the disciplines of machine learning, predictive analytics and adaptive learning. Weâre looking for a Product Manager to join Zoomiâs global team.__What youâll do__The Product Manager will lead efforts to research, analyze, define, document and verify improvements to Zoomiâs core products. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with different teams spanning research, client implementation, sales, marketing, engineering, as well as external clients. The perfect candidate will have a background in a technical field, learn quickly, take on new challenges, and have some experience driving decisions from data.__More specifically youâll:__* Strive to deeply understand Zoomi users and the market, as well as Zoomiâs current product offering* Work with our leadership to define a forward-looking product strategy* Build, drive and manage a product roadmap against that strategy* Communicate product priorities across the organization* Work closely with clients educating and helping them solve their business problems* Prepare and present business proposals for the evaluation and selection of system enhancements and acquisition of new technologies* Decompose tasks and develop specifications along with Developers* Prepare strategy, pricing, & go to market materials* Maintain knowledge of current and emerging technologies and best practices to provide solution direction* Provide scheduled and on-demand status reports and updates* Assess, manage, resolve and escalate (if necessary) risks and issues* Make decisions based on information and input in a timely manner__What your resume should have__* Experience (3+ years) with software product analysis, ownership and requirements definition* Experience with or knowledge of data visualization practices* Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills* Excellent negotiation, communication and facilitation skills* Strong focus on user needs and usability* Preferred experience working on a distributed team, following the core agile principles for software development__What we value__Zoomi values passion, agility, quality, customers, innovation, trust, meritocracy and EQ. We are in search of people that are inventive, autonomous, motivated and comfortable with a little bit of ambiguity. Sloths and divas need not apply.

item.title: DevOps Lead AWS Cloud
item.description: __Who is Zoomi?__Zoomi is the only AI-informed learning analytics company. With Artificial Intelligence that uses more than 250 proprietary algorithms, Zoomi enhances knowledge transfer, improves engagement, and allows predictive and prescriptive insights into business outcomes.Zoomi is in the process of creating a highly professional engineering team that is accountable to each other, is respectful to all, and can enjoy our mutual love and interest in technology.__What youâll do__Zoomiâs platform is deployed in the Amazon Cloud (AWS). The DevOps Lead will be the point person for packaging, deployments, automation, monitoring, and test integration with the goal of moving our environment towards Continuous Integration. As the DevOps Lead, you will report to the SVP of R&D and be involved with all aspects of the platform; leading the DevOps team, selecting tools, working with the engineering and QA teams, and communicating goals and progress. This is a key position that will evolve in responsibility as Zoomi grows.__Responsibilities:__* Select and implement automation and CI tools in our AWS environment* Manage Zoomi platform* Lead a team that performs standard configuration, management, and maintenance tasks* Work cross functionally with Development and QA.* Lead a growing team of Automation Engineers* Participate in daily SCRUM product/project meetings* Participate in and support capacity planning and the development of long-term scalability and reliability goals for Zoomiâs platform* Participate in incident management and communications, including follow-up with problem resolution, post-mortem, and process improvement along with other leads* Recommend improvements to our environment to ensure performance, up-time, and incident avoidance.* Support application development teams throughout the project lifecycle* Perform server/database transaction and security audits leading to identification and mitigation of security threats to enterprise data. Recommend and implement changes where necessary.__What your resume should have:__* 2+ years demonstrated experience in an AWS cloud environment* 4+ years experience with Linux server systems* Experience with monitoring tools and technologies (you will help to research and select monitoring tools)* Network/systems management experience* Experience installing, configuring, and maintaining servers, networks, and clusters* Hands on coding experience using Python, shell scripting, and other languages relevant to automation tools.* Experience working with some configuration management, orchestration, and container technologies such as Terraform, SaltStack, Ansible, Docker, etc.__Youâll have a big leg up if:__* You have prior experience as a lead or manager* You have experience with AWS services, such as VPCâs, Security Groups, EMR, Load Balancers (ELB/ALB), IAM, databases (Aurora, Dynamo), S3, etcExperience deploying and migrating databases* Youâve used AWS Directory Service and have integrated with a third-party SSO provider.* You have relevant experience on other cloud-based multi-tier, big data platforms.__What we value:__Zoomi values teamwork, intelligence, creativeness, trustworthiness, accountability, professionalism, and a love for learning. At Zoomi we donât have a hierarchy; we have a team with different job descriptions. We value and reward positive contributions. Our work environment is one where we work hard, pull together towards common goals, and enjoy our successes as a team.Zoomi offers a competitive salary, health benefits, a 401(k), merit based equity, and the opportunity to contribute to a truly unique vision.Please use ENG1020 when applying.

item.title: Email Developer Contract
item.description: __Our Story__ Merkle is a global data-driven, technology-enabled performance marketing agency. For more than 25 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle, the nationâs largest privately-held agency, to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. By combining a complete range of marketing, technical, analytical and creative disciplines, Merkle works with clients to design, execute and evaluate connected CRM programs. __Role Purpose__ The Email Developer - Contract supports our email team on short-term client accounts ranging from 6-12 months. The Email Developer is responsible for preparation and deployment of HTML and text email content as well as the dynamic integration into a proprietary email delivery platform. __Key Responsibilities__* Dynamic content coding* Content change management* Link tracking and email deployment using proprietary email platform.* Basic send and deliverability monitoring* Upload HTML/Text content to email platform* Apply dynamic content rules and configure link tracking* Work with account production managers in coordinating and communicating content change requests and production schedule* Quality assurance of dynamic email* Verify dynamic content* Meet deadlines for content publication* Serve as an expert on email best practices and educating others__Key Skills and Experience__* 2 - 4 yearsâ experience* Strong technical skills including an expertise in HTML* Understanding of Web development tools / technologies such as CSS, Photoshop, Dreamweaver, and Javascript* Superior attention to detail* Ability to function in a high pressure/high ambiguity environment* Advanced organizational, time-management and work prioritization skills* Strong bias toward action and results-oriented activities* Passion for learning new skills, expanding experience* Strong interpersonal communication skills* Strong work ethic This job description is a summary of the essential functions of the job, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible job responsibilities, tasks, and duties. The responsibilities, tasks, and duties of the jobholder might differ from those outlined in the job description. Other duties, as assigned by the supervisor, might be part of the job.

item.title: Senior PHP Developer With Information Security Focus
item.description:
Wordfence is responsible for securing over 1 Million active WordPress websites. We are the most popular security product for WordPress publishers by a significant margin.


We are looking for a senior PHP developer to join our talented team. Applicants need the following:



  • At least 5 years of experience working as a developer with a solid and complete foundational knowledge of good software engineering practices and SDLC.

  • Ability to create bug free performant code, solving sometimes complex problems, that you self-test before handing to our QA team.

  • Ability to work with QA and other developers to hone the release until it is ready for deployment.

  • To be nimble, come up with creative solutions and have a mature approach to software engineering.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 

  • Experience with other languages besides PHP is required including a solid understanding of how to write scaleable and maintainable code. 

  • Attention to detail.


We are a small, fast moving and fast growing company with a loyal customer base who love our products and services. We pride ourselves on providing an excellent product with great customer service that helps secure small and large production websites. 


If you're passionate about engineering great software and would like to help secure the web, this is your dream job. We have a friendly, highly capable team with a sense of humor who move fast. Our team receives an excellent package including awesome benefits. We take our team's family time seriously and don't ask you to work long hours if we can avoid it (we almost always can). Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction - so you can live anywhere in the World as long as you have an Internet connection. 


Wordfence is high growth, but we are not a startup. The company is still controlled by the founders, we are profitable and have been for several years. So you will enjoy the rush of high growth, benefit from a stock options package, but you won't have to risk working for a company that is controlled by venture capitalists or may not be here tomorrow.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description: We're seeking a passionate Data Engineer to help us design and build our “big data” infrastructure, data aggregation and ingestion platform. This platform will power our proprietary pricing algorithm and data analysis. You will integrate data from various resources, and manage full data lifecycle (ETL). You will write complex queries on that data, making sure it is easily accessible, and works smoothly. Ultimately, you will be optimizing the performance of our company’s big data ecosystem.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
We have an immediate opening for a hungry, experienced Product Manager who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs & is fanatical about helping SMB businesses succeed.

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 7,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. Weâre passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers. We work closely with eCommerce partners like Amazon, Shopify, eBay, Square, Magento and WooCommerce to help eCommerce businesses thrive.

We offer TaxJar Reports, a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state, AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns, and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations.

As a Product Manager for Filing you will
  • Deeply understand the needs and desires of customers (and their designees) who file sales and use tax returns
  • Craft and own the vision for the best, most intuitive, most efficient sales and use tax filing system in the market
  • Work directly with states to identify specifications and constraints for their filing options
  • Work hand-in-hand with product development to define and prioritize the requirements they need to build and improve said service
  • Work with our tax experts, customer success, internal filing team to ensure we maintain our world class Net Promoter Score (yes, itâs currently above 70 for filing)
  • Coordinate with marketing on both inbound and outbound programs and communication

Requirements
This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the continental US only.

Skills & requirements we're looking for
  • 2-5 years of experience in SaaS product management, preferably in small business, payroll or taxes
  • Strong interpersonal skills; you will need to develop strong relationships with developers, customer success team members, state employees, and stressed-out customers
  • You have the perfect combination of patience and an intense bias for action
  • Prior experience dealing with US state departments of revenue a big plus
  • Superior attention to detail, with strong process and documentation skills
  • Clear, concise writer
  • Self-directed, self-motivated
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (chat, video, email, etc)

Youâll be a great fit on our team if you're
  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable & KPI driven
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (Weâre all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role, and not afraid to go big and potentially fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Weâre a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. Weâre always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

To apply: We get LOTS of resumes. If you want to be considered for this position, please treat this like a 1st interview. Please apply here: https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/432848/candidates/new

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Kroll is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join its esteemed Identity Theft and Breach Notification unit, providing cybersecurity solutions to a range of business clients and consumers. This position is responsible for designing and developing software applications and services within Kroll’s portfolio of cyber security products. The qualified candidate will work closely with our product development, technology, and operations teams to develop and support Kroll cybersecurity solutions. We are looking for a candidate currently working as a mid-level developer or having solid foundational experience ready to take the next step in their career. This position is a full-time opportunity. The preferred location is Nashville, TN, but we are open to this position being fully remote.


Responsibilities  



  • Contribute daily to an innovative, fast-paced agile development team to build leading-edge products for the cybersecurity market

  • Develop high-quality code that scales for enterprises and consumer clients

  • Protect Kroll’s technical edge by securing information, practicing need-to-know, maintaining company privacy, and adhering to secure coding practices

  • Communicate in an effective manner that promotes healthy relationships with both internal and external team members.

item.title: Software Developer (m/w) Ruby on Rails, JavaScript
item.description: **HAUSGOLD** digitalisiert den Verkaufsprozess von Immobilien fÃ¼r VerkÃ¤ufer, KÃ¤ufer und Makler mit dem Ziel mehr Transparenz und Effizienz zu schaffen. Unsere eigenentwickelte Software und eine professionelle Kundenbetreuung bilden zusammen mit unserem Netzwerk von mehreren tausend Maklern vor Ort eine einzigartige Basis fÃ¼r unser weiteres Wachstum.Wir sind seit rund 3 Jahren auf dem Markt aktiv mit einem Team von nunmehr 40 Mitarbeitern. Heute sind wir einer der fÃ¼hrenden spezialisierten Maklervermittlungen im deutschsprachigen Raum. Nun setzen wir unsere Expansion auf weiteren europÃ¤ischen MÃ¤rkten fort.Wir vergrÃ¶Ãern unser Development-Team und suchen zum nÃ¤chstmÃ¶glichen Zeitpunkt Dich als unseren **Software Developer (m/w) Ruby on Rails, JavaScript** in Hamburg (Germany) / Remote.**WELCHE AUFGABEN AUF DICH WARTEN:*** Produktentwicklung fÃ¼r Web und Mobile* Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung unserer Projekte* Technische Konzeption und Entwicklung neuer Projekte**DEINE QUALIFIKATIONEN:*** Du verfÃ¼gst Ã¼ber eine Ausbildung oder ein Studium im Bereich der Informatik oder hast einen vergleichbaren Abschluss* Du hast sehr gute Kenntnisse in Ruby on Rails* Du hast Erfahrung mit agiler Softwareentwicklung* Du hast Erfahrungen mit der Versionsverwaltung unter Git* Du nutzt REST-APIs und TDD/BDD* Konzentriertes und sorgfÃ¤ltiges Arbeiten sowie eine strukturierte und koordinierte Arbeitsweise runden Dein Profil ab**DarÃ¼ber hinaus sind folgende Kenntnisse von Vorteil:*** Bootstrap und Sass* Grundkenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung (AngularJS, React.js)* Erfahrung mit Responsive Design unter der Verwendung von HTML5 und CSS3 Im Ãbrigen handeln wir nach der Maxime, dass man nicht alles kÃ¶nnen muss, aber gerne lernen mÃ¶chte. **WAS WIR DIR BIETEN:*** Ein aufstrebendes Technologieprojekt mit professioneller Entwicklungsmethodik* Eine anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche TÃ¤tigkeit mit tÃ¤glich neuen Herausforderungen* Agile Softwareentwicklung* Flexible und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitszeitgestaltung* Die MÃ¶glichkeit im HomeOffice und remote zu arbeiten* Ein freundliches Arbeitsumfeld in einer der schÃ¶nsten StÃ¤dte Deutschlands* Frisches Obst und kostenlose GetrÃ¤nke* Sympathisches und agiles Team, mit dem es SpaÃ macht zusammen zu arbeiten* RegelmÃ¤Ãige Team-Events und die unternehmensÃ¼bergreifende Gelegenheit zum fachlichen Austausch* Du entscheidest selbst, mit welchem System Du am liebsten arbeiten mÃ¶chtest: Mac, Linux, Windows - Du wÃ¤hlst und wir organisieren Dir Deinen Rechner

item.title: Javascript Developer
item.description:
Senior JavaScript Developer Job Description:

Joinpiggy.com is looking for the highest caliber JavaScript developers to join its technical teamâs expansion.  The role will be remote based working in your local timezone during normal business hours.

What We Are Looking For

  • Previous history working as a senior Javascript developer.
  • Extremely proficient in modern Javascript constructs including ES6, automation tools such as gulp or grunt, testing tools such as mocha or jasmine, and build tools such as webpack, browserify or babel, and the ability to demonstrate such knowledge.
  • At least 2 years experience using a popular Javascript framework such as AngularJS or React in a commercial environment.
  • Node/NPM experience
  • Experience building Chrome/Firefox browser extensions is ideal but not mandatory
  • Requires a person who can "figure it out" and a lover of challenges and puzzles. This is not your standard "Form needs validation" javascript job. Requires a lot of reverse engineering.
Job Functions:

  • Build and update Piggyâs various browser extensions and the rulesets that allow our Apps to interact with various Merchant Websites.
  • Build and automate unit and integration test suites.
  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use.
  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
  • Contribute to team development and initiatives.
  • Occasionally assist the UI Developer with enhanced Javascript functionality as needed.

Job Requirements:

  • Strong English language skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation.

Include in Cover Letter

Include in your cover letter answers to the following questions:

  • Github profile

To apply: https://piggy.breezy.hr/p/9ba898a361f8

At Analytics Fire we are a small, distributed team working on a range of interesting projects -- some that might fit you: currently a scalable IoT platform for utility grade solar power plants, a sales and design tool for residential solar, a voice activated robot arm, and a financial transaction platform. We’re looking for a fun, interesting, and hardcore dev to join our small team of disparate experts.


This is a remote position. We’re flexible about location and hours, so long as your normal working hours overlap at least partially with normal business hours for the Pacific time zone.


We’re a really great match for a senior dev who wants to work hard on interesting projects, while also having flexibility around time and geography.

item.title: PROJECT LEAD SMALL TEAM OF EXPERTS 100% FLEXIBLE HOURS
item.description:
Are you a natural leader? Does it seem like you always end up running things, whether you have the formal authority to or not?


Do you dream of having the authority you need to make critical decisions affecting the outcome of the projects you and your team are working on?


Do you have 3-5 years experience as a full stack developer working on challenging problems, ideally in a fast paced startup environment?


If you answered yes to all of these questions, please reach out and connect with us! We’re a small team of technical experts looking for a project engineer to lead a development team working on clean energy related software projects. As project engineer, you will own a combination of “hands-on” coding and client facing project management responsibilities. You will interact directly with clients as well as work closely with a small team of senior engineers that will look to you in order to ensure that their technical efforts are unblocked and aligned with the needs of the project.


This is a remote position. We are flexible about location and hours, but your normal working hours need to overlap heavily with normal business hours for the Pacific time zone.


We’re a really great match for a natural leader who wants to work hard on interesting projects, but also have flexibility around time and geography.

item.title: Web Application QA Analyst Engineer
item.description:
Virtual, work-from-home position. Work anywhere in the U.S. Must be a U.S. resident



We are growing! Become part of an IT team of 12 developers, business analysts, project managers, etc who support a company of 80 team members with industry-leading web applications in areas of continuing education, candidate screening, and much more.



ABOUT THE POSITION


We are seeking an extremely detailed and personable Web Application QA Analyst/Engineer to conduct and manage the testing of our web applications.



  • Full-time, salaried position

  • Regular hours are Mon-Fri 8a-5p Eastern or Central time

  • Work from your home office

  • Company-provided MacBook Pro and internet service stipend

  • Must be located in the United States and legally eligible to work in the US.

  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting (which is a lot of fun), and may be required a handful of times for team or project meetings



Responsibilities



  • Test web and mobile application releases on a day-to-day and project-by-project basis.

  • Develop and execute comprehensive testing plans for each project release.

  • Develop/implement automated test strategy and scripts.

  • Attend regular status meetings and deliver updates on testing progress.

  • Assist stakeholders in keeping application specifications accurate and up to date.

  • Work with IT Developers to improve automated testing where possible.

  • Work with project sponsors and product owners to improve daily testing regimens to ensure the websites are functioning at an optimal level.

  • Analyze documented defects to identify root cause and impact on related functions or product features.

  • Identify and mitigate risks / issues related to testing.

  • Suggest improvements, best practices, and new approaches to testing workflow (your voice will be heard).



We prefer a great/interested/excited tester with less experience to an unmotivated or unengaged tester with tons of experience.



TO APPLY


In your cover letter please include a description of the last couple of projects you’ve QA’d and your specific role in those projects, a link to your favorite movie clip on YouTube, and your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.



ABOUT ALLIED HEALTH MEDIA


We are fast-paced, nimble, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions. For more information visit www.alliedhealthmedia.com.

item.title: WordPress Support & Happiness Engineer
item.description:
AdThrive.com helps serious bloggers make more money with theads on their site by acting as their trusted expert guide in the wild-west likeworld of online advertising. This means helping them figure out which adplacements to use, how to develop an ad strategy, and then actually installingthat strategy for them. Through our work, weâre help the best creators andcontributors on the web, people who have a passion their craft (cooking,decorating, parenting, finance, investing) get to write about their passion andbe paid to live their dream. We help bloggers leave their full-time jobs andstay home with their kids. We help struggling families pay their bills and findhope. We support the people who are creating the internet!
 
As an AdThrive Wordpress Support & Happiness Engineer,youâre the kind of person who is passionate about helping people. It shapesyour worldview. Perhaps youâre already active in helping people online throughthe WordPress.com or WordPress.org forums, or contribute to other online communitieslike GitHub, StackOverflow, StudioPress, etc. The thought of helping familiesearn enough money for one parent to stay home or to cover their mortgage givesyou goosebumps.
 
We arelooking for people with the right mix of compassion, writing skills, andtechnical knowledge to connect with creative publishers and get the job donefor them.  We do this through listening to their needs, understandingtheir goals, and then guiding them to the best outcome through the use of theadvertising strategies we have mastered over time. Weâre looking forfast-learning, creative, technically minded team members with a heart to servethe best content creators on the web.

Day in the Life:
  • Crafting thoughtful, personal responses to client questionsin our support system (Zendesk)
  • Troubleshooting and fixing problems on client websites(mostly WordPress)
  • Analyzing ad layouts and earnings
  • Making recommendations for improvements in ad layouts
  • Onboarding new clients by installing ads on their sites
  • Being an active member of a distributed team via tools likeSlack, G Suite, Zoom, Zendesk, Appear.in and more
  • Understanding the needs of online publishers and craftingunique solutions to best serve their goals
  • Building on our community of support, knowledge,documentation, and resources to help our team serve our publishers
  • Working to understand a new development in thecommunity/industry, overcoming new obstacles, and embracing a fast-pacedvirtual work environment

Youâll do well if you have:
  • Patience, grace, a sense of humor, and some moderate GIFsharing abilities
  • Excellent writing and communication skills
  • Working knowledge of WordPress, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
  • A knack for taking technical language and making itunderstandable
  • A passion for solving tough problems and proposing elegantsolutions
  • A desire to make everything you touch better
  • Genuine desire to help others solve problems and succeed
  • High level of comfort working in a fast paced environment

Qualifications:
  • 2+ years of backend WordPress experience using the followinglanguages: PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Experience editing custom WordPress themes and plugins
  • Experience with common plugins such as W3 Total Cache andWooCommerce
  • Strong understanding of Google Analytics
  • Strong Written Communication (web-based copy, preferred)
  • Fluent understanding of online ecosystems (server and clientside structure, hosting, CDNâs, pagespeed tests, front-end site optimization)
  • Commitment to AdThriveâs Mission Statement
 
There is limitless opportunity here for the person who makesthemselves valuable. We're a young company and growing fast, so strong leadersand strong performers will have opportunity to grow and see increasingresponsibility.
 

To apply: Please follow below link to apply:http://cafemedia.applytojob.com/apply/FJrU10c5uD/WordPress-Support-Happiness-EngineerWe regret that we are unable to respond to each resume. Only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. CafeMedia is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Data Pipeline Engineer
item.description:
Why Join?
Clicktripz is among a rare set of winners in the tech space that has grown organically by generating positive cash flow. They are a highly profitable company that continues to double revenues every year. Clicktipz has never raised outside capital. Since there are are no outside investors, there is no board of directors to appease or cater to. No need to allocate time and resources towards raising operating capital. Clicktripz focuses 100% of their energy in making their company and solutions better. Join for the fun; speed and flexibility that accompany an entrepreneurial startup environment.


If you are looking to punch a time card, this is not the right fit for you. Clicktripz lives in a fluid environment that is in a constant state of evolution and adaptation. They seek self-starters with massive brains to join their high performing beta crew where collaboration, curiosity and growth are constant.


Your Mission:



  • Manage the configuration, deployment, and maintenance of our ETL service stack.

  • Ensure our data pipeline scales out to support throughput to the tune of billions of records per day with minimal end-to-end latency.

  • Coordinate with the Analytics and Data Science teams to define and add new record types to the system.

  • Adhere to industry best-practices for unit testing, end-to-end testing, continuous integration, and security to name a few.

  • Monitor the state-of-health of the system, and jump in to diagnose the root-cause of errors when they occur.

item.title: HDL Developer
item.company: CERN European Organization for Nuclear Research
item.description:
Functions

As HDL Developer you will:

  • Take responsibility for the design, evolution and support of the HDL code (mostly VHDL) in various key components of the accelerator control system.
  • Identify areas for improvement and propose solutions, including the development of new HDL and auxiliary software components, and the adoption of new technologies.
  • Collaborate with controls and data acquisition teams around CERN and support them, for the integration of standard BE-CO-HT hardware and HDL solutions into complete systems.
  • Take a leading role in all activities related to quality assurance for HDL components in the section, such as tools, design flow, testing, documentation, packaging and distribution.
  • Participate in the operational support of all the deployed solutions in the domain of distributed controls and data acquisition hardware.
  • Document and present your work as appropriate.


Qualification required

Master's degree in the field of electronics, or equivalent.

Experience and competencies

The experience required for this post is:

  • Demonstrated experience in and extensive knowledge of programmable logic design using Hardware Description Languages, VHDL in particular.
  • Demonstrated experience in automated testing and verification of complex HDL components.
  • Experience in design and development of Printed Circuit Boards, including component selection, schematics entry and layout would be an advantage;
  • Experience in radiation-tolerant design of electronics and techniques to measure and increase reliability would be an advantage.


The technical competencies required for this post are:

  • Design of electronics based on field programmable logic-based devices (FPGA): knowledge of the Xilinx design tools would be an advantage.
  • Digital circuit design, modelling and simulation.
  • Programming/software development: experience in software development in C and Python. knowledge of embedded Linux and device driver development would be an advantage.


The language competencies required are:

  • Spoken and written English: ability to understand and speak English in professional contexts.
  • Abilty to draw-up technical specifications and scientific reports and to make oral presentations.
  • The knowledge of the French language or the willingness to acquire this rapidly would be an advantage.


Eligibility conditions

Employing a diverse and international workforce is a CERN core value and central to our success. We welcome applications from all Member States irrespective of gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or personal situation.

This vacancy will be filled as soon as possible, and applications should normally reach us no later than 02.04.2017.

By applying here, you allow CERN to consider your application for any position it considers relevant with respect to your profile. Please ensure you update your profile regularly with any relevant information and that you inform the recruitment service if you wish your file to be removed from the database.

Note on Employment Conditions

We offer a limited-duration contract for a period of 5 years. Limited-duration contracts shall terminate by default on their date of expiry. Subject to certain conditions, holders of limited-duration contracts may apply for an indefinite position.

This position requires:

  • Stand-by duty, when required by the needs of the Organization.
  • Work during nights, Sundays and official holidays, when required by the needs of the Organization.
