item.title: PHP Developer 100
item.description:
This is a 100% remote position. We prefer to hire people from Europe and Asia because of team collaboration, all of our current dev team is in Asia or Europe and so it is unlikely (although not impossible) that we will hire in north or south america.


You will be working from home with mostly flexible hours although you will need to attend the team meeting which is at approximately 8:30am GMT and to work for 3 hours after this time for team collaboration (This is 3:30am to 6:30am New York time, so you can see that’s the reason we are not likely to hire in north, central or south america).


You will be working in a team of around 10 other developers. You will be working on complex bugs and feature improvements for the software. The software is Time Tracking software for remote teams.


You will work with databases with millions of records and hundreds of thousands requests per day. You are going to get involved into continuous integration processes, different branching models for version control and strict coding standards.

item.title: Community Manager/Social Media Strategist
item.description:
At YNAB, we build the worldâs best budgeting software. We have an amazing product, and from day one, weâve grown (and continue to grow) thanks to loyal YNABers who canât shut up about budgeting. They are our people and we love them, every last one of the nerdy bunch.

So much so, that weâre looking for a full-time, marketing-minded Community Manager to help us feed, wrangle, engage, and grow the beast. You will manage and grow our existing communities (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.), help us create and distribute content, identify and build relationships with influencers, and be a key player in growing our up and coming referral program.

You are creativeâyouâve never met a brainstorm you didnât likeâin fact, your team can always count on you to have something up both sleeves and in at least one back pocket. You are good with wordsâa strong writer who wields your sense of humor at every appropriate turn. You have years of experience as a community manager,  developing, executing, and measuring full-scale, cross-channel social media campaigns and you have the thick skin to prove it (although a portfolio would also be nice).

You understand how community works and tear up, just a little bit, thinking about igniting the YNAB base. In fact,... oh, wow, yeah, did we lose you for a second there? Whatâs that? You just got distracted thinking about all the possibilities? YNAB meet-ups across the country? An annual YNAB conference? Your mind is blown. Perfectâyou might be the one.

Thatâs a taste of what youâll be working on, but first, you need to know if youâll even like working with us. (Although, we think you will.)

A Bit About Us

We build the best budgeting software around, YNAB or âYou Need a Budgetâ if you have a lot of extra time on your hands. For more than a decade, people have been buying YNAB and then telling their friends what a difference it has made in their lives. (Google us, or read some of our reviews on the app store, and youâll see what we mean.) We love building something that has a huge positive impact on peopleâs lives.

Weâre profitable, bootstrapped, and growing. YNAB started in 2004 and we havenât taken any outside fundingâweâre in it for the long haul.

We have one overarching requirement when it comes to joining our team: our Cultural Manifesto has to really click with you. If youâre nodding emphatically while reading it, youâll probably fit right in, in which case, we canât wait to hear from you!
First, letâs talk about life at YNAB and then weâll go into detail about what weâre looking for.

How Youâll Work at YNAB

We work really hard to make working at YNAB an amazing experience. We have a team full of truly exceptional peopleâthe kind youâll be excited to work with. Hereâs how we operate:

Live Where You Want
Weâre a distributed team, so you can live and work wherever you want. Proximity doesnât influence productivity. As I write this, Taylor (our CTO) is in, London or Brazil, or maybe back in Austin? Not all of us travel so extensively, but the fact that he does is totally okay because weâre all adults. Just make sure you have a reliable internet connection.

No Crazy Hours
We rarely work more than 40 hours per week. There have been a few occasions where things got a little crazy and people had to log some extra hours. But then they took some extra time off, so it all balances out. We work hard and smart but weâre in this for the long haul, no need to go crazy on the hours.

Take Vacation (Seriously)
We want you to take vacation. In fact, we have a minimum vacation policy of three weeks per year (plus two extra weeks for Christmas break). Itâs important to get out and do something. Weâll look forward to seeing pictures of your vacation in our internal chat room, creatively named #office_wall.

The YNAB Meetup
We get the teams together once a year to catch up on spreadsheets and powerpoints in a Best Western conference room. Just kidding. This year it was a gigantic cabin in the mountains. The time before that it was in Costa Rica.  We do really fun things, but the highlight is always just hanging out together and having a blast.

Up Your Game
Weâre serious about helping you improve your craft. We budget for it (hey-o!).. Think conferences, Lynda subscriptions, dedicated time away from work to learn something new... itâs really up to you and your manager. But we love to see our people growing.  

If Youâre International...
Youâll be set up as a contractor. Employee or contractor, itâs all the same to us. Youâre part of the team. (We are spread all over the world: Switzerland, Scotland, Brazil, Canada, and all over the United States.) For this particular position, we are only considering candidates located +/- two hours from North American Pacific Time.

If Youâre Statesideâ¦
Youâll be a W2 employee with fantastic health, dental, and vision insurance, where we cover 100% of the premium for you and your family. (No need to check your vision, you read that right, 100%. Although if you did need to check your vision, no big deal, weâve got you covered!)

We also have Traditional and Roth 401k options. YNAB contributes three percent whether you choose to throw any money in there or not. It vests immediately. (Are you a personal finance junkie like Jesse? He set up YNABâs 401k to have the lowest fee structure possible, where all plan costs are paid by YNAB, not your retirement nest egg. The investment funds available are fantastic, passively-managed, ultra low-cost index funds. Youâre not a PF junkie? No worries, we have more than enough to go around.)

Other Tidbits
  • Once you start, we DEMAND (in a friendly, ALL CAPS IS YELLING way) that you fill out your âBucket Listâ spreadsheet with 50 items. (Thatâs harder than it sounds!)
  • The bucket list helps in deciding what we should give you for your birthday and Christmas: No gift cards here. We tried that. Super boring.
  • We have a bonus plan based on profitability. Youâll be in on that from day one. YNAB wins, you win. That kind of thing.
  • Weâre all adults. Thereâs no need to punch a clock, or ask for permission to take off early one afternoon to go see the doctor (health insurance premium 100% covered!). We look at what youâre accomplishing, not how long you sit (have you tried standing?) in front of a computer.
  • We want you firing on all cylinders so weâll set you up with a shiny new computer and replace it every three years.
  • Did I mention we make a huge, positive difference in peopleâs lives? You may not think that matters much, but then a few months down the road youâll realize itâs made your job really, really enjoyable. Donât underestimate this one!

If this sounds like your ideal environment, read on because now I want to talk about you. You will play a big part in helping YNAB become a household name and helping hundreds of thousands of people get control of their money. You will change lives. Iâll only say that six more times.

Now, back to you, our new Community Manager...

Before âcontent marketingâ and âsocial mediaâ were buzzwords, YNABâs marketing efforts were anchored in content and community. And weâre doubling down.

Part cheerleader, part analyst, part coach, part den mom, and part early adopter, the Community Manager will own and manage our community across social media channels. (And in the future? Who knows! Our community is your oyster!) Youâll need to hit the ground running, and by running we mean, developing and executing campaign strategies, creating and distributing content of all kinds, and engaging daily with our existing communities (FB, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.) to facilitate growth.

As a member of the small-but-mighty marketing team, youâll be asked to stretch up and down, depending on the day, and help develop and document new processes and systems as we scale. If there is an opportunity to automate and simplify, youâre all over it. We love you for that. But at the same time, youâre opportunistic about the pursuit of strategic connections and relationships with potential influencers, partners, and the media in real-time. You give away free t-shirts like a boss.

With an ear to the ground, and a knack for storytelling, this position will play a big role in developing the Referral Program and fueling its growth as an unstoppable word-of-mouth machine, a community in its own right.

We donât have a YNAB User Conference right now, but if we ever do, you better believe the Community Manager will play a key role in designing that baby and bringing it to life.

Your Day-to-Day will look something like:  
  • Management of Existing Communities: Apply your deep knowledge of best practices to take our existing channels (FB, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.) to the next level in terms of influence and growth.
  • Growth into New Channels: Help evaluate the growth opportunities for YNAB among new channels and where relevant, launch a presence and cultivate community.
  • Customer Engagement: Building relationships, answering support questions, delighting customers, being hilarious, pursuing awesome customer stories, and representing YNAB with aplomb across all social channels.
  • Content Wrangler: Planning, writing, publishing, re-purposing, and publishing again.
  • Building The Referral Program: Help to lead and grow our loyalty efforts (a soon-to-be-launched Referral Program).
  • Influencer Outreach: Helping to source, vet, and build relationships with potential influencers and partners.

Requirements (these are real, actual requirements):
  • You have at least 3-5 years of experience in community management for an established brand.
  • You possess a deep knowledge of best practices across channels (FB, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.) and are passionate about keeping up with digital media trends.
  • You are a strong, versatile writer and natural storyteller. You can nail the YNAB voice out of the gate.
  • You are hilarious and kind.
  • Your portfolio of experience (and success!) building and growing communities will blow our minds.
  • You understand how to dig into the data and emerge with actionable insights that result in better-performing content and increased conversions.
  • You are an idea generator with follow-throughâfull of ideas, and always coming up with new, random, hair-brained strategies. Your boss is always saying, âThatâs crazy! But it just might work!â
  • You arenât intimidated to work remotely and manage your time exceptionally well.
  • You are incredibly organized, flexible, and collaborative.
  • You never met a deadline you didnât love.
  • You are self-motivated and driven by nature, maybe even a little competitive.
  • You have the ability to stay laser-focused on the big picture, without losing sight of every. last. detail.
  • You are wildly productive and independent, but a team-player at heart.
  • You arenât afraid to experiment, even if it means chalking mistakes up to learning from time to time.
  • You do well with vague directions but arenât afraid to ask questions.

Bonus Points:
  • You already use and love YNAB.
  • You have previous experience managing a referral or customer loyalty program.
  • You live on or around the West Coast. Weâll double down for California, Washington, or Utah.

How to Apply
Apply at the link below. The deadline for applications is 11:59PM on March 5th, 2017. Firm. Itâs a real deadline. In that application, you will:

  • Write a cover letter (attach PDF) to sell us on why we canât live without you, and your thoughts on why or why not #YNAB should be on #SnapChat. While youâre at it, throw in a #nailedit for good measure.
  • At the end of your cover letter, share the top three ideas youâd want to pursue if you were hired for the position.
  • Attach a resume (PDF) and examples (or links) of previous campaigns youâve managed and your specific role/responsibility.

P.S.  If youâre not interested in or available for this position, but know someone who is, we would really appreciate it if you passed this along!

To apply: Apply here: https://ynab.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0msnoThe deadline for applications is 11:59PM on March 5th, 2017. Firm. Itâs a real deadline.

item.title: Senior Software Developer
item.description: Full Time: Senior Software Developer at GitHub in US-Remote

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Summary


Wikimedia is looking for an experienced and collaborative Product Manager to drive improvements to Wikipedia that enable our communities to achieve our Vision: a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.


Product Managers at Wikimedia work with engineers, designers, researchers and communities of users to build features, products and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to have a high level of positive impact, worldwide.



Responsibilities


The Wikimedia Commons project is the world’s largest repository of freely licensed educational media. The Wikimedia Foundation has embarked on a project to partner with the Commons community to integrate machine-readable data into this project to make the content more accessible to the world. This role will initially focus on working with community and movement partners to develop user-facing tools for uploading and classifying media, as well as using the data to improve the multimedia search and browsing experiences.    Upon completion, this individual will be responsible for how multimedia content is viewed on Wikipedia and Commons.

item.title: PHP Application Optimizer / Web Developer - WordPress Focus
item.description:
A2 Hosting, Inc. is a premier Linux hosting company with clients around the world. We are currently seeking someone with experience working on application stacks for performance optimization across a variety of hosting platforms. We pride ourselves on offering the fastest hosting and this role plays a key role in helping us maintain that reputation!

This position is a member of our internal Web Development Team. This team is composed of 6 developers focused on building and maintaining the web-based systems of A2 Hosting. Our team is built and operates around the Agile/Scrum methodology. We are proud of the fact that we pair program, do full-team code reviews, and continually expand our understanding and implementation of good coding practices. If you are interested in a collaborative, team-oriented approach, the A2 Hosting team is where you belong!

The Application Optimizer is in charge of making websites fast. While the bulk of this position will be focused around WordPress, other CMS's and platforms are also part of the job (such as Drupal, Magento, Joomla). The Application Optimizer should be able to take a CMS, dig deep into the guts of it, and come out with a strategy to optimize it to run exceptionally fast on our hosting platform. This position has the distinct opportunity to innovate heavily within our environment. 

The perfect candidate thinks about the performance of the web holistically, from the server stack all the way through to the browser. This position is 100% remote. Even our local employees typically work from home about 80% of the time.

Employment: Full-time, Exempt

Responsibilities:
  • Custom configure application stacks for deployment
  • Customize plugins for performance enhancement and security
  • Perform QA testing
  • Write both internal and external documentation

Skills:
Must have:
  • Familiar with applications including Wordpress, Drupal, Magento, Prestashop, Joomla
  • Familiar with common 3rd party application plugins (WP W3 Total Cache, etc.)
  • Advanced experience scripting in Bash, PHP
  • Ability to work with Varnish, Nginx, Apache, MySQL, Redis, Memcached
  • Experience or desire to learn Varnish VCL rules
  • Familiar with Apache JMeter and Bench for performance testing

Nice to have:
  • Experience with cPanel/WHM/Softaculous
  • Familiarity with Ruby, node.js
  • Basic Sys Admin knowledge
  • A candidate that is already entrenched in the WordPress community

What we offer:
  • Work from home!
  • Employer-subsidized health insurance, vision & dental insurance
  • 401k with company match
  • Short & long term disability
  • Company-paid life insurance
  • Paid vacation and holiday time
  • Company events - previous events included Summer BBQ, holiday party, whirlyball, bowling

Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume for consideration.
** US applicants only at this time. **

To apply: http://a2hosting.applytojob.com/apply/I9KvWs/PHP-Application-Optimizer-Web-Developer?source=We+Work+Remotely

item.title: Product Designer New York NY
item.description: Harvest is hiring a Product Designer in New York, NY or Remote

item.title: Data Platform Software Engineer
item.description:
Sonatype has drawn from the global pool of software development talent, with engineering expertise in the UK, Europe, Canada and the US.  Our product development teams lead the ongoing evolution of multiple market leading products -- Nexus Repository and Nexus Lifecycle -- used by hundreds of thousands of developers, application security professionals and legal staff across the world.



No one is going to tell you when to get up in the morning.  No one is going to dole out a bunch of small tasks for you to do each day.  Members of Sonatype's software development organization have to have the internal drive and initiative to make the product vision a reality.  Flow should be the predominant state of mind.

item.title: Senior DevOps
item.description:
Senior DevOps Engineer / Developer

We are looking for a senior DevOps engineer/developer to join our growing team!

The person in this role will eventually be responsible for managing our internal and client-facing infrastructure, supporting our active projects, and supporting the development team as-needed. Demonstrated experience in both AWS and Azure is desired, but if you happen to only have experience with one, letâs talk anyway. Ultimately, we are looking for someone who needs little-to-no technical training to be a functional contributor to the team.

The kinds of technologies you will be working with:
  • AWS, Azure, Heroku
  • Puppet and Chef
  • SQL Server
  • Windows and Linux
  • Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, Jenkins

The kinds of things youâll do:
  • Backups, disaster recovery, systems administration
  • Migrations
  • Development environment management
  • Visualize and create infrastructure and solutions architecture diagrams for internal and external projects
  • Environment sizing and cost estimating
  • Work with small teams of developers as the DevOps expert

The things you need to have:
  • 8+ years experience in IT DevOps, with 2+ years in a senior role managing an AWS/Azure environment
  • Significant AWS or Azure cloud experience
  • A development background and experience with Visual Studio, Git, and related technologies
  • Mastery of your own motivation. We are a highly-distributed workforce and we need folks who can manage their workload and schedules without significant oversight
  • An ability and willingness to align your work day to U.S. Eastern Standard Time (UTC/GMT -5) as might be needed

You might not be the corporate type, and that's perfectly fine with us. We're a small consulting company that focuses on providing exceptional service and value to our clients while having fun in the process.

Our clients bring us in to solve problems that they may not have the domain knowledge or expertise to solve on their own. We are a team-in-a-box, providing all the roles necessary to deliver the desired end solution on time, on budget, and on scope.

Our employees are located throughout North America and Croatia, and everyone has the flexibility to work remotely (from home or a co-working space), as we feel this is a great way to help people have the career and lifestyle they want. We hire folks who have a positive attitude, a passion for technology, work well in high-stress situations, and get excited about solving hard problems.

Visit www.coria.com to learn more about who we are and what we do!

Coria has corporate entities in the United States and Croatia.  We are a Results Only Work Environment and offer unlimited PTO to all our employees. We cover your mobile phone, home internet, and work equipment expenses. Full time employees in the U.S. will have health (we pay 100% of the premium for individual or family plans), vision, dental, disability (LTD/STD/AD&D), and life insurance. Full time employees in Croatia have health, accident, life, pillar III optional pension insurance, and are eligible for up to HRK 2.500,00 annually in non-taxable income.  

If you are interested in talking to us about this position (or just to find out more about us for other openings we may have), please reach out to Andrew Boisvert at aboisvert@coria.com.

Thank you!

To apply: Please submit an application here: https://coria.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=16

item.title: iOS Developer
item.description:
Meta Craft is looking to add an experienced iOS developer to its team.

Our growing team is composed of remote software development enthusiasts with a keen eye for UI, always focusing on the delivery of a better product for our clients, which are geographically distributed.

You should be passionate about the apps you worked on and always trying to figure out a better way to improve them.

Here are a few points that we want to see in you:
- More than 3 years of iOS/macOS development experience
- Strong knowledge of Objective-C and Swift
- Be excellent at explaining your thought process and decisions
- Fluent english speaker
- A strong knowledge in programming fundamentals (CS degree not required)

Why would you want to work with us?

- A relaxed environment regarding work schedules and geographic location
- Work with seasoned professionals from whom you might learn a thing or two
- Solve different problems for our many clients
- A fair salary (gym memberships don't pay your rent)

To apply: To apply, email your resume to careers@meta-craft.com with the subject âiOS Developerâ and a brief summary of relevant work.Tell us why you're a good fit for the job and include your resume and GitHub.

item.title: PHP/JavaScript Engineer
item.description:
We're looking for an engineer to join our team of 4 talented devs working on MailPoet, a newsletter solution for WordPress used by over 300,000 websites.

Who We Are

We're a 5-year old, completely bootstrapped, profitable, 8 person company. Our freemium WordPress newsletter plugin is used by over 300,000 websites, of which thousands are customers.

Our product-centric team consists of 4 developers, 3 support staff & 1 product chief. We're spread over 7 countries.

Youâll have access to all our key metrics, including revenues.

Where Weâre Heading and How

Weâve just launched a complete rewrite of our solution, and now we're strapping our own sending service on top of it. Pretty ambitious and challenging.

The team works asynchronously, primarily exchanging on Slack and occasionally having a conference call. Meetings are replaced with weekly âstatus updateâ posts. For the most part we work autonomously and are trusted to get the work done.

We primarily use PHP, MySQL, Idiorm and React.js to build MailPoet. Changes are shared through GitHub and are always reviewed by other team members. A continuous integration service helps us automatically run tests and other safety checks.

Benefits

  • We're 100% remote;
  • Weâre focused on deliverables;
  • Pretty flexible in terms of working hours;
  • Our work and personal lives need to be balanced sanely (max 40 hours per week);
  • 5 weeks per year of paid vacation we all get;
  • We make it a point to learn constantly;
  • We travel to conferences;
  • Join us for our annual team retreat;
  • Compensation is calculated on an internal salary grid which take into account several parameters. Expect between 42k and 52k USD.

Skills and Requirements

  • Good object oriented design skills;
  • Ability to write clean and understandable code;
  • Ability to write automated tests;
  • Solid understanding of PHP;
  • Good understanding of Vanilla JS. Experience with React is a bonus, but not required. We can help pick it up;
  • Experience with HTML & CSS;
  • Familiar with WordPress and its ecosystem;
  • Basic understanding of working with Git.

To apply: We don't outsource and we don't work with agencies.We accept only candidates from countries in European and American (East Coast) time zones.Send an email to jobs@mailpoet.com and tell us about your two favorite projects. Send us links to your profiles online (twitter, GitHub, etc.). Please do not attach your CV.We get a lot of emails and can't reply to everyone, sorry!

item.title: Cassandra DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Streamhub is a London based SaaS video analytics startup. We provide big data analytics services for media companies helping them target, grow and monetise loyal video audiences. Our clients are spread worldwide in Europe, Asia, Japan and Australia.

If you enjoy online video, massive volumes of audience data and want to challenge complex business problems at scale, then you could be a great fit. We are based in London Tech City and you can find more details about our work here http://www.streamhub.co.uk

Job description:
We are looking to scale out our Cassandra-based infrastructure quickly that runs on AWS instances using ephemeral storage.
The tasks will be focused around the improvement of its automation, efficiency, backup, security and deployment into multi-zones.

It will be a part-time remote position where you will be asked to work with us circa 2 days per week.
Depending on the results after the first few weeks, this may evolve into a longer term engagement.

Required Skills

  1. Expert in Cassandra
  2. Experience in Opscenter and Ansible scripts
  3. Expert in AWS big data applications
  4. Experience with Cloudfront

Pre-requisites
  • You are proficient in writing and speaking in English
  • You are available remotely for a good portion of UK working hours (9am - 6pm) to have much overlap
  • Must be able to provide references from recent employees

Package:
$350 per day for a 1-2 month engagement; 2 days per week; or packed into a shorter time.

To apply: To apply please send a brief but concise summary of your Cassandra / AWS experience together with your CV and Github or Linkedin profile. Thanks! (and no agents whatsoever pls) Email: hiring@streamhub.co.uk

item.title: Education Engineer Technical Trainer
item.description:
We are looking to grow our Education team with an experienced Trainer to provide training and workshops to users and clients in Central and Northern Europe. The right candidate is happy working on their own initiative, and does not require micro-management. Most of the team works remotely, and we are happy to consider you wherever you live. Our main offices in Europe are in Amsterdam and London. Do you want to see the world? Do you want to meet lots of new people and teach engineers how to use Elasticsearch? Come join us at Elastic!


Responsibilities:



  • Becoming an expert in Elastic products, keeping up to date on changes/releases, and relaying that knowledge in the form of content development, training instruction, educational material, meetups, and conferences

  • Learning, creating and presenting compelling courses in extremely technical concepts clearly and concisely to large audiences in a way that fully engages our customers

  • Able to travel globally up to 75%

  • Collaborate with development teams and engineering to create and update existing course materials and documentation

  • Creating new courses, liaising with instructors and other subject matter experts

  • Having ability to work on your own initiative with fanatical attention to detail

  • Knowledge of curriculum design methodologies

item.title: Senior Front-end Developer
item.description:
We are fast growing startup, building an awesome product. We are looking for senior front-end developers to help shape and take part in the process.

What we are building?
Conferize is on a path to create the universal event solution, uniting the world of events. We help event organizers build their community, website and mobile experience to increase the quality and attendance of their events. We want to make any event maker or organizer able to get online providing all the digital tools and services needed. And we want to make it easy, low priced and exciting, to liberate focus on the main reason they create events in the first place: Helping people meet and share ideas.

How we work
At Conferize we strive to cultivate a multicultural environment where work, socializing and personal development go hand in hand. We invest in people who are driven and motivated and believe in changing the status quo. We love creative thinkers and selfstarters, who never wait to be told what to do.

We believe in a flat bottom-up organization of work where culture trumps policy. We have little-to-no âmiddle layerâ, as our team work semi-autonomously and leadership is semi-internalized. Weâre 100 % product-driven, operating with a zero bug policy and exceptional product design; how things look, how they work and how theyâre built.

Like us youâre ambitious and professional, yet nice to be around. You have excellent standards for how you communicate and collaborate. Weâll give you everything you need to do your absolute best, most creative and challenging work â with the least amount of frustration. Oh, and we never outsource development and we donât work with arbitrary deadlines, because we believe both lead to bad solutions.

Our main office is in Copenhagen and we work with flexible hours. Working remotely is an option if youâre in no more than 1 hour from our main time zone (Central European Time).

We believe in fewer great people than many average.

General requirements
  • Excellent English communication skills.
  • High degree of motivation and engagement.
  • Collaborative, upfront, positive attitude.
  • Effective, responsible and self-driven team players.
  • Pragmatic but with a high attention to detail.
  • You are located in Copenhagen or within maximum 1 hour timezone difference.
  • All positions are full time (37 hours pr. week).
 
Special requirements for remote workers
  • You must have high speed Internet and a quality video camera (720p+) and a good microphone for Google Hangouts.
  • You must be able to travel to Copenhagen, Denmark (at our expense) team building get-togethers.
  • You must be online throughout your work day, especially during core business hours 10 am to 3 pm CET, using Slack for communication with the distributed team.
 
Specific requirements
The ideal front-end developer candidate is a pragmatic generalist, has great communication skills and is able to juggle multiple tasks. We are currently using AngularJS, but youâll be responsible for helping transition to a new isomorphic front-end experience based upon React and Redux with a Ruby on Rails backend.
  • At least 3 years of Javascript professional experience.
  • At least 1 year of AngularJS, React or similar experience.
  • Proficient understanding of CSS.
  • You care about writing semantic well formed code and paying attention to standards and good practices.
  • Proficient understanding of Git.

Bonus skills
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails or similar frameworks.
  • Experience with MongoDB and/or PostgreSQL.
 

What we offer
  • To be part of an adventure. With a great team of highly motivated and engaged individuals, who are also great team players. We are on an exciting journey towards something big.
  • Option to work with the latest technologies, building a cutting edge product and user experience.
  • Real participation and team work. You are not getting a list of stuff to do; you are part of the process of both deciding and doing. Your opinion is valued.
  • Competitive salary/equity.
  • Option to work remotely, or joining us in our awesome workspace in Copenhagen, in the heart of the cityâs thriving startup scene.

To apply: Email Martin Moen Wulffeld (mw@conferize.com) with your application and an up-to-date C.V. (a LinkedIn profile will be fine) before Thursday March 23 2017. If you have a GitHub account (or similar) let us know as well. We expect you to be able to show samples of your previous work. Any questions? Just ask.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
item.description:
We are fast growing startup, building an awesome product. We are looking for full stack Ruby on Rails developers to help shape and take part in the process.

What we are building?
Conferize is on a path to create the universal event solution, uniting the world of events. We help event organizers build their community, website and mobile experience to increase the quality and attendance of their events. We want to make any event maker or organizer able to get online providing all the digital tools and services needed. And we want to make it easy, low priced and exciting, to liberate focus on the main reason they create events in the first place: Helping people meet and share ideas.

How we work
At Conferize we strive to cultivate a multicultural environment where work, socializing and personal development go hand in hand. We invest in people who are driven and motivated and believe in changing the status quo. We love creative thinkers and selfstarters, who never wait to be told what to do.

We believe in a flat bottom-up organization of work where culture trumps policy. We have little-to-no âmiddle layerâ, as our team work semi-autonomously and leadership is semi-internalized. Weâre 100 % product-driven, operating with a zero bug policy and exceptional product design; how things look, how they work and how theyâre built.

Like us youâre ambitious and professional, yet nice to be around. You have excellent standards for how you communicate and collaborate. Weâll give you everything you need to do your absolute best, most creative and challenging work â with the least amount of frustration. Oh, and we never outsource development and we donât work with arbitrary deadlines, because we believe both lead to bad solutions.

Our main office is in Copenhagen and we work with flexible hours. Working remotely is an option if youâre in no more than 1 hour from our main time zone (Central European Time).

We believe in fewer great people than many average.

General requirements
  • Excellent English communication skills.
  • High degree of motivation and engagement.
  • Collaborative, upfront, positive attitude.
  • Effective, responsible and self-driven team players.
  • Pragmatic but with a high attention to detail.
  • You are located in Copenhagen or within maximum 1 hour timezone difference.
  • All positions are full time (37 hours pr. week).
 
Special requirements for remote workers
  • You must have high speed Internet and a quality video camera (720p+) and a good microphone for Google Hangouts.
  • You must be able to travel to Copenhagen, Denmark (at our expense) team building get-togethers.
  • You must be online throughout your work day, especially during core business hours 10 am to 3 pm CET, using Slack for communication with the distributed team.

Specific requirements
The ideal Ruby on Rails candidate is a pragmatic generalist, has great communication skills and is able to juggle multiple tasks. We would love a fast learner but are right now looking for someone who can hit the ground running. Our stack is currently a mix of Ruby on Rails, Golang, React, Redux, MongoDB, PostgreSQL.
  • At least 5 years of proven Ruby on Rails experience. Either professional, personal projects or open source.
  • Strong understanding of both SQL and NoSQL (MongoDB) database fundamentals.
  • Basic JavaScript / CSS experience.
  • Good understanding of UNIX and shell scripting. You know your way around Linux.
  • You prefer solid long-term solutions rather than quick fixes and hacks.
 
What we offer
  • To be part of an adventure. With a great team of highly motivated and engaged individuals, who are also great team players. We are on an exciting journey towards something big.
  • Option to work with the latest technologies, building a cutting edge product and user experience.
  • Real participation and team work. You are not getting a list of stuff to do; you are part of the process of both deciding and doing. Your opinion is valued.
  • Competitive salary/equity.
  • Option to work remotely, or joining us in our awesome workspace in Copenhagen, in the heart of the cityâs thriving startup scene.

To apply: Sounds interesting? Email Martin Moen Wulffeld (mw@conferize.com) with your application and an up-to-date C.V. (a LinkedIn profile will be fine) before Thursday March 23 2017. If you have a GitHub account (or similar) let us know as well. We expect you to be able to show samples of your previous work.

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description: __About Blue Apron__Headquartered in NYC with fulfillment centers in New Jersey, California and Texas, Blue Apronâs mission is to make incredible home cooking accessible to everyoneâfrom the novice cook just getting started to the experienced chef. We send millions of meals to customers with all the pre-measured and perfectly proportioned ingredients they need to prepare delicious and healthy meals at home. We introduce our members to new ingredients, flavors, and cooking techniques with seasonally-inspired recipes that are always delicious, fun and easy to prepare. We make fresher, healthier food available at better prices by rethinking the grocery supply chain from the table all the way back to the farm. __What we're looking for:__Weâre looking for an engineer to help us maintain and scale the cloud infrastructure for a rapidly growing e-commerce start-up. Youâll have the ability to make decisions balancing immediate short-term need against whatâs best for the long-term. Our headquarters is located in Manhattan but we're open to considering remote candidates.__About the role:__* Manage the infrastructure for our public-facing website as well as the internal systems we build for various teams across the company* Consider performance, scalability, and reliability when making decisions* Think about the bigger picture and how best to structure and scale our infrastructure for existing and future applications* Implement configuration and automation tools to simplify the process of deploying and upgrading software across our infrastructure* Our stack: AWS, nginx, unicorn, Rails, PostgreSQL, Redis, Memcached, Solr__Benefits:__* Competitive salary and equity* Health, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance* Health and Commuter FSAs* Flexible vacation policy* MacBook Pro or Air* A large, open workspace in NYCâs Flatiron neighborhood* A kitchen full of fresh fruit and snacks__Requirements:__* Experience with high-traffic production web applications* Clear, concise communication and are capable of designing and implementing solutions to complex problems* Exposure to Amazon Web Services and how the suite of products can be used to build a scalable, resilient infrastructure* Proficient with configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef, or Ansible * Ability to handle the unexpected. When disaster strikes, you're equipped with the tools and knowledge required to react and mitigate the issue* Experience implementing, monitoring, and alerting systems to detect and solve problems before they become critical.* Scripting experience (Ruby a plus)* Experience working with Rails applications and Capistrano a plus* You're able to participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation

item.title: Senior UX Product Designer
item.description: __About SurveyMonkey__SurveyMonkey is the world's leading provider of web-based survey solutions, and weâre looking to transform the way people make decisions. We're a smart, passionate group of people who work hard to deliver the best survey experiences on the planet, period. We believe everyone deserves easy access to the information and insights they need to make great decisions.We're also proud to admit that despite our incredible growth over the past 17 years, we refuse to grow up. We stay curious. We believe in good olâ roll-up-your-sleeves scrappiness. Everyone plays an impactful role, because weâre here to make a difference. And when we say good ideas can come from anyone, we mean it.SurveyMonkey is trusted by millions of customers, including 99% of the Fortune 500, as well as other businesses, academic institutions and organizations of all shapes and sizes. We collect over 3 million survey responses daily from people in all countries around the world.__Our Team__Our 8-person team is responsible for a key part of SurveyMonkeyâs business strategy: itâs our job to build SurveyMonkeyâs portfolio of SaaS business solutions and make them great. Itâs challenging, exciting, and rewarding.We have a unique and successful content-creation product (TechValidate), a brand-new product for measuring customer happiness (SurveyMonkey CX), and more on the drawing board (all built on Ruby on Rails, btw). We also create the marketing websites for our products. Working on our team feels like being part of a startup (without the 80-hour weeks) but backed by the resources of a larger profitable company.Our team is geographically distributed (5 in the Bay Area, 3 elsewhere), and this is a remote-friendly position.We strive for excellence in our work, but with all the opportunities on our plate, product and UX design have become bottlenecks. Thatâs where you come in.__The Opportunity__Weâre looking for a talented senior UX/product designer who enjoys working on small teams. If you have experience designing SaaS applications, like working closely with developers, and relish designing how a product should work just as much as you enjoy designing what it looks like, we should talk.'As mentioned above, we have an exciting roadmap for our two existing products, but we also have another product on the drawing board for 2017. Depending on your interest and abilities, you'll be able to either contribute across our product line, or focus on one of our products as the lead designer and de-facto product manager. There are no dedicated product managers on our team â we all contribute to defining what our products are and how they will work. As a designer, you will have an outsized influence in this process. More specifically, you will:* Collaborate closely with our Director of Design, engineers, and stakeholders in an iterative and feedback-driven process.* Design beautiful and engaging user interfaces according to user needs, business requirements and technical constraints.* Develop wireframes, mockups, and prototypes* Write UI copy* Potentially manage and mentor junior designers* Potentially contribute to our CSS frameworkThis position has the opportunity to work remote -- those of us who are in the Bay Area work in the office one day per week, but we also have team members who are fully remote.__Requirements:__* A minimum of 4 years experience as a professional designer* Experience designing desktop and mobile SaaS interfaces* Experience in front-end development (HTML, CSS, basic JavaScript). You donât have to implement in this role, but you should be technically grounded.* A eye for detail and a real passion for great usability and aesthetics.* Youâre not overly attached to your own designs â you are open to feedback from all team members to find the best solution.* A strong portfolio featuring relevant work examples* You know Sketch like the back of your hand* Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills __How We Work__Some of our team is fully remote, but those of us who are in the SF bay area meet once a week at the TechValidate office in Emeryville. If you are also in the SF bay area, you can work out of the office as frequently as you like. At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and equity compensation._SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer._

item.title: Principal Software Engineer
item.description:
Chegg’s writing tools are used by over a million students each day to further their learning.  We build software to help these students compile research, create bibliographies, and ensure all sources are correctly cited in completed papers.  We offer these tools for free through ad-supported accounts as well as through paid monthly subscriptions.


As a Principal Software Engineer focused on front-end performance you will work with a team of software engineers to create the best possible experiences for students.  Do you thrive on analyzing every millisecond in the Chrome Timeline and optimizing code to get content to the screen as quickly as possible?  Do you yearn to then measure the result of these optimizations at the request-level across millions of page views each day?  In this role, you will partner with multiple product teams and impact over 65 million students.


We’ve built a programmatic advertising solution that leverages header bidding to get highly-relevant ads  in front of our users and enable students to use our products free of charge.  Your challenge is to help us do this as efficiently as possible. Data is at the heart of our work and we have a real-time system that streams data from every user interaction into an ELK stack at a rate of 1TB/day.  We work closely with our team of data scientists to analyze this data, build models, and A/B test heavily.


In this role, your responsibilities will be:



  • Automating ongoing analysis of our products’ browser performance

  • Develop & refine Javascript/CSS/DOM optimizations in our front-end codebase

  • Engage with other product teams to drive future strategy and best practices around front-end performance

  • Explore and experiment with new technologies/approaches as they become available


Our Stack



  • ES2015, babel.js, webpack, closure compiler, yarn

  • github, TravisCI, browserstack

  • Custom data collection system built on OpenResty/Nginx, streamed into Fluentd, Kinesis & ElasticSearch

item.title: Education Engineer
item.description:
We are currently seeking Education Engineers to join Elasticsearch. The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering technical training to our customers as well as helping to create and maintain our curriculum of training courses, which cover Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana.


If you are an experienced engineer who has seen the good and bad of software development, enjoy helping mentor and share your learned knowledge with others in an engaging manner, and love Elasticsearch and its ecosystem, then please apply and meet our team.


The right candidate is happy working on your own initiative, and does not require micro-management. Most of the team works remotely, and we are happy to consider you wherever you live. Our main offices in Europe are in Amsterdam and London. Do you want to see the world? Do you want to meet lots of new people and teach engineers how to use Elasticsearch? Come join us at Elastic!


Responsibilities



  • Becoming an expert in Elastic products, keeping up to date on changes/releases, and relaying that knowledge in the form of content development, training instruction, educational material, meetups, and conferences

  • Learning, creating and presenting compelling courses in extremely technical concepts clearly and concisely to large audiences in a way that fully engages our customers

  • Able to travel globally 50%

  • Collaborate with development teams and engineering to create and update existing course materials and documentation

  • Creating new courses, liaising with instructors and other subject matter experts

  • Having ability to work on your own initiative with fanatical attention to detail

  • Knowledge of curriculum design methodologies

item.title: Mobile App Architect
item.description:
Are you ready to make $60,000 USD while working for a fortune 500 company all from the comfort of your home? If you are eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world, then this role is for you. Work for Crossover and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. If you think it sounds too good to be true then take a closer look


What to Expect as a Mobile Applications Architect at Crossover

Crossover is looking for Mobile Architects that are ready to work closely with other developers, software engineers and production groups to design, develop, test, implement and maintain our evolving front-end applications, systems and tools. They participate in development and preparation of, but not limited to, procedural, program and user documentation. This position also includes supporting live products during games and events, planning innovation implementation, development while designing/developing software applications that provide best-in-class user experience and providing support for all front-end, online mobile product initiatives.

Finally, as the Mobile Applications Architect, you will set the example and serve as a technical reference to evaluate others technical level and work quality while understanding and explaining the latest technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

item.title: Scala Developer
item.description:
Narrative is building the first global data marketplace.  It has often been said that data is the new currency.  Unfortunately, maximizing the value of data is often easier said than done.  On one side, transacting via individual point to point integrations carries a lot of overhead in both business development and technical integration efforts.  On the other, going through big aggregators introduces opacity in the pricing and provenance of the data.  At Narrative, we help our customers get value from their data by building a central auction platform to reduce the friction and tooling to increase the transparency in this process.

We are a small, early stage team looking for great developers who want to jump in and take major systems and user-facing features from design to launch.  We are currently based in New York, but looking to expand our development team into a distributed one.  Here's where we are now:

  • We are operating in Amazon Web Services.  Our services are mainly deployed on EC2 provisioned with Terraform. 
  • We also heavily use other technology on AWS such as DynamoDB, S3, and RDS.
  • Our backend includes a data ingestion web service and supporting Kafka consumers, written mostly in Scala with small bits of Java here and there.
  • We have a basic frontend that is written in Typescript with Angular2.
  • Other services we use include: GitHub, CircleCI, DataDog.

Here are some examples of projects that we would like some help with:

  • Interactive report UIs for the frontend.  Think something like this, but for data and transactions.
  • Data analytics pipelines to drive the interactive report UIs.  For example: reports for yield forecasting and deal pre-qualification.
  • Automation of special staging environments for testing auctions with simulated traffic.
  • Implementing additional infrastructure to support auctions for more types of data.
  • Improving the latency of our auction process.

The ideal candidate should:

  • Be able to work across all aspects of back end systems, from application code to SQL to systems administration.
  • Be comfortable in a common back end language such as Java or C# -- or even better, their functional equivalents, Scala / F#.
  • Have experience operating in a cloud environment like Amazon Web Services, Google Compute Engine, or similar.

You donât need to be an expert in all of our stack, but we are looking for someone with strong technical skills who is eager to pick up new technologies as necessary.  Previous experience with remote work and small teams is also preferred.

To apply: Send an email to alex@narrative.io

item.title: Passionate Cloud Engineer(s)
item.description:
You are passionate about open source technology, public cloud, devops and modern application architectures and workflows? Then you might be the person weâre looking for!

We are searching for a cloud engineer to join our distributed team. You will be building reliable cloud platforms, support them and advise our customers developers on the best way forward. Youâll have the opportunity to play with the cloud and open source technology.

To apply: Interested? Check out the full position and apply using the following link: http://skyscrapers.eu/blog/passionate-cloud-engineer/

item.title: Senior C/C++ Linux Developer Machine Learning platform. EU position, Telecommute
item.description:
We are looking for highly motivated experienced individual with a pleasant personality and good organizational skills to work as a C/C++ Linux developer.
CVEDIA provides cloud-based public or private access to any image dataset. Browsable interface allows you to visually inspect and explore. Create and edit datasets through state-of-the-art tools that lets you work directly with satellite imagery, web-based photo repositories or your own material. Metadata tools efficiently add labels, crops or paths to any image. Support for exotic metadata like Triplet selection and Activation maps through our web-based drawing tools. Check it at out @ cvedia.com

Required Qualifications:

C/C++

Linux

Preferred, but not mandatory:

Machine Learning Experience

Neural Networks Experience

Image Recognition

How should you apply for this job?

Please provide your github repository

Only applicants from European time zone will be processed.

We will not reply to 3rd party software/employees agencies

Please state on the mail subject the job position and the state you reside.

Please understand that this job capacity is for a full position.

Application process:

Application usually will be screened the same day we receive it.

We will reply to you no later than two business days to set-up a short interview.

1-3 weeks after the interview you could be hired!

What we offer:

Job location is in Cyberspace.

Communication with the all team members is done through Skype

Employee will be receiving all of his social rights as stated in the law of his country.

Salary will be paid once a month with a wire transfer

Job capacity: Monday - Friday (8 hours daily)  

Please provide your github repository

Please send your CV with your github repository to jobs@cvedia.com

To apply: Send your CV to jobs@cvedia.com

item.title: Matchmaker
item.description:
Make a Living Out of Finding Love!

What is Tawkify?
Tawkify is the fresh, smart and sexy matchmaking startup dedicated to putting fun and romance back into dating. We hire exceptionally kind, smart people who believe in Happily Ever After and want to help our clients find it. 

Why join the Tawkify team?: 
  • Be your own boss
  • Create your own hours and work remotely
  • Make a positive impact
  • No limits to earning potential

Job requirements: 
  • Strong communication skills & emotional intelligence
  • Ability to execute on a timeline
  • Multi-tasking: Administrative, Organizational, Creative Skills
  • Ability to manage expectations of diverse personalities
  • Extensive networks & desire to network
  • Self-motivated, self-starters only
  • Desire to grow with company

What makes a great matchmaker?
Our matchmakers come from diverse backgrounds â lawyers, consultants, life coaches, entrepreneurs, teachers, and writers. Weâve found the most effective matchmakers share the following qualities:
  • Professionalism. You hold yourself to a higher standard. You are task-driven, attentive, collaborative, and accountable.
  • Empathy. You have charisma. Youâre a great listener. You have no trouble connecting with people. You build trust and rapport instantly.
  • Passion. Our matchmakers are more invested in their clientsâ relationship well-being than the clients themselves. We believe your best career option gives you the ability to do what you love and love what youâre doing.
  • Network. You have the knack and the resourcefulness to navigate between social circles and grow your sphere of influence.

What to expect?
Youâll scour your city to find and screen quality, eligible matches for our clients. Our intuitive matchmakers handpick each candidate based on our âVIPâ approach to compatibility: Values, Individual lifestyle and Personal preferences.

All matches take place via curated blind dates that youâll creatively design to ban first-date butterflies and encourage connection. Each time, you provide useful feedback to both parties to help refine the search and optimize for that ideal match.

To apply: http://tawkify.com/apply?utm_source=weworkremotely&utm_campaign=allothermatchmaker

item.title: EdTech Startup Seeks Software Engineer

Homer is looking for an exceptional back end Software Engineer to join our energetic, growing team. You will have a profound impact on a company that touches the lives of children, parents, and teachers across the globe with one of the most celebrated reading and learn-to-read platforms in the industry.


As the Software Engineer, you will be a key member of our engineering team, building the back end services and infrastructure essential to our growing business.


Homer is a venture-backed, high-growth business that offers competitive compensation including equity and full benefits in a creative, flexible environment that invests in professional development.

item.title: Open Source Intern
item.description:
Bitovi is simplifying JavaScript development. We build amazing open source tools for anyone in the JavaScript community to use. We use those same tools to consult clients who build some of the largest and most profitable websites on the Internet.

WE WANT YOU
Weâre looking for a junior developer or designer who identifies with our mission, is passionate about open source, and wants to be involved in the open source community.

Whatever your background, weâre looking for someone who has the following attributes:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Can write HTML and CSS (JavaScript is a plus)
  • Enjoys working in a tight-knit team
  • Not afraid of the command line (even if you don't use it much)
  • Strong desire to learn and help grow an open source community

Specifically, you do not need any of the following:

  • A degree at a university
  • Previous experience as a developer or designer

If youâve recently graduated from a development boot camp, this may be the perfect internship for you.

THE JOB
Youâll work closely with our developer relations lead and open source team to:

  • Improve our websites
  • Manage our social media accounts
  • Promote our events
  • Organize open source contributions
  • Write technical content
  • Create sample applications and presentation materials
  • Research new front-end technologies

This job provides you the opportunity to make a big impact in a small and growing company while developing your marketing and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript skills.

At Bitovi, you wonât be another cog in a corporate machine. Youâll gain valuable hands-on experience with maintaining and growing an open source community under the mentorship of our developer relations lead.  Youâll also have the opportunity to attend internal Bitovi Trainings focused on JavaScript application design, front-end architecture, and our open source stack of tools giving you first-hand access to experts in the field on a daily basis.

Other Details & Benefits
  • Paid Internship
  • Full-time
  • 3 Months (13 weeks)
  • Benefits: Health, dental, & vision insurance (60% Bitovi paid, 40% employee paid)
  • Paid Holidays + 4 days of paid time off
  • Gym membership reimbursement up to $100/month
  • Working from home with flexible hours
  • Access to internal Trainings
  • Invitation to company-wide retreats if the internship period falls over the dates the events are held

To apply: Write a resume and a thoughtful cover letter that shows us that youâre the kind of person weâve described above.Focus on your past work and experience, and point us to some recent work (or your github account). If you have any specific salary requirements or other conditions, make sure to include those as well.Use the following link to Apply: http://bitovi.applytojob.com/apply/8cXdNyPXo4/Open-Source-Intern?source=weworkremotely.com

item.title: Senior Angular Node Developers
item.description:
At Recordsure we pride ourselves on our development professionalism, using as many modern practices & tools as suit the things we need to build.

Agile practices are our norm, whilst we organise ourselves on Jira, Atlassian and GitHub, keeping in constant daily contact with one-another on Skype.

We love delivering, innovating & collaborating and support each other in our individual learnings and group challenges.

You will work remotely for us, probably from your home in Eastern Europe or the APAC region, and we will do everything possible to make you feel part of the team... including a trip to London once or twice a year.


You will be expected to work 8 hours per weekday. To ensure effective communication with the rest of the team, and also to take part in required agile ceremonies and meetings, your working day must include the hours 10:00 to 14:00 GMT, including during British Summer Time.


About the job


You’ll be joining our front-end team, working primarily with Angular.js on our web portal application. Strong experience is required in this area along with its underpinnings: JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.


The web portal enables users to access and search records, listen to recordings, perform administration tasks, configure and view reports, view dashboard metrics, and see the results of our speech, semantic analysis and other machine learning system outputs. Some of the features you’ll be building will be straightforward CRUD, while others will involve rich and highly bespoke functionality.


We also have a server side component written in Node.js for performing administrative functions relating to organisations, users, authentication, etc. You must have at least an intermediate level of Node.js experience. We’ll provide you with the support necessary to build your experience to an advanced level if necessary.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
item.description:
As a Software Engineer at SystemOne, you will build the services that power our web and mobile apps as well as our public API. You will also develop the React/React Native front-ends that utilize our APIs. You will be a key member of the team, making technical decisions that will shape the company's future. We're looking for people who love to code as well as work with other developers to build meaningful products.

Day-to-day responsibilities include:
  • Building the next version of our API
  • Building intuitive, highly efficient and performant interfaces for the next version of our medical device application
  • Optimizing back-end services for performance and scale
  • Integrating with medical devices and software products around the world
  • Working alongside our Chief Product Engineer on core engineering challenges
We are looking for people with:
  • A product-first approach to building software. You care about the real world functionality of your programming.
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience building, deploying, and maintaining apps at scale
  • Experience with Node and Express
  • Experience with SQL and/or MongoDB
  • Experience with modern javascript tools/frameworks like react, webpack, and babel
  • Experience with REST and HTTP/HTTPS protocols
  • Deep understanding of user-interface and user-experience concepts and design
  • Deep experience with JavaScript
  • A passion for working as part of a team
  • DevOps skills are a plus

Tech

Front-End
  • Javascript ES6
  • React
  • Redux
  • Material UI

Back-End
  • node.js
  • hapi
  • knex
  • MySQL

DevOps
  • AWS

To apply: sbaumgartner@systemone.id

item.title: Senior WordPress PHP Developer Who Enjoys Building Beautiful Solutions
item.description:
Digital Pulp is looking for a passionate and talented PHP Developer with WordPress superpowers to create exemplary interactive brand experiences for our clients. We are seeking someone that has had a significant development role on a large scale WordPress project from conception to implementation.


You can assess and solve complex visual or functional issues with WordPress as they arise, and work within the WordPress guidelines to come up with better solutions when necessary. You have battled with the WP REST API and Advanced Custom Fields plugin and won, and can bring to life our meticulously designed visual layouts and elegant user interactions within the world of WordPress.


This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who would like to be part of an experienced in-house dev team at one of New York's most well respected digital agencies. This position can be here in our office or remote. It can also be remote full-time, or part-time remote and part-time in the office. Or it could be 1/12th time in the office and 11/12th time remote like Troy. Or you could make up your own distribution of time spent working from the office vs home. Or maybe your home is an office and in that case 100% from your office should be fine, too.

item.title: .NET Software Engineer
item.description:
Join a great team of software developers working on advanced healthcare applications and end-user analytic tools. Our products improve the quality of medical care worldwide, and we are looking for talented and committed people to help us realize that goal. Working at ASCEND will give you the chance to not only work on challenging applications but also make a difference in people’s lives.


You will be involved in all phases of product development including preparation of technical specifications, the creation of design mockups and prototypes, and active participation in design, code, and test reviews. This position involves a high level of responsibility; the work will be challenging and the results extremely rewarding. We are looking for excellent people to join an excellent team.

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
Background

Faria Education Group specialises in building and operating software systems for use in international education. The main products are ManageBac and OpenApply . The 20- strong technical team behind these products are spread between Taiwan, United States and Ukraine. We have additional technical staff in the United Kingdom, Germany, and Canada.

The Interop division within Faria Education Group is tasked with integrating key partner systems and services with ManageBac. This is an area where we project substantial growth in the next 2-5 years and we are growing our staff accordingly. Integration relies on a variety of APIs and SSO connections, both written by FEG and supplied by external partners.

Currently we are a Ruby shop, though you may have the chance to explore additional technologies as our systems mature. We use a variety of other software in production including Rails, Redis, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Memcached, and more.


Role Description

This is a mid-level, full-time, remote development position. We expect you to be able to contribute to the development of high-quality software solutions with some guidance. You should already be familiar with web development using Ruby on Rails, and have experience using and creating API solutions. You will need to work with APIs at a variety of maturity levels.


Responsibilities

  • Integrate partner products and services with our own products through use of partner APIs.
  • Support partners in their use of Faria APIs.
  • Troubleshoot API and SSO issues, suggest and implement solutions.
  • Work effectively as part of a remote team.


Communication

Because this is a remote position, effective communication is essential:

  • Communicate with other parts of Faria Education Group including product teams, QA, design, support and marketing.
  • Proper remote presence & etiquette through Slack, BaseCamp, GitHub and other systems.
  • Adherence to operating procedures with timely followups to avoid surprises and dropped work.
  • You will report to the Principal Developer for Interop, who is a direct report to the VP of Engineering.


Location

This is a 100% remote job. The ideal candidate will be in the GMT-5 timezone (Eastern time) or prepared to have daily availability during GMT-5 business hours. Because of the global nature of our business, you should also be prepared for conference calls outside of business hours. Potential emergency situations can call for support at any hour, though we work hard to minimize those situations. Candidates within six hours driving time of Boston are preferred.


*Please note: Due to a high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.*


Benefits


  • Salary negotiable, expected range $60K-$90K/year
  • Company-supplied laptop (Retina MacBook Pro or other)
  • Health insurance
  • Books ('unlimited within reason') and conference attendance budget. We expect you to have a plan for professional development.
  • Remote-first environment

item.title: Experienced Python Developer
item.description:
We are looking for a Python Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic for our digital health platform, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from customer-facing mobile applications. Your work will support data-driven decisions and insights gleaned from our patient population data store, deliver a personalized patient experience, and will impact the lives of real-world patients dealing with chronic health conditions.


The ideal candidate: 



  • Highly experienced in server-side programming, with multiple successful projects demonstrating proficiency.

  • Able to take high level requirements and break them down into a project with tasks and milestones

  • Self-managing, self-motivated, able to meet objectives with minimal day to day management

  • Aptitude for test-driven-design

item.title: Senior Data Engineer F m
item.description:
Note: Although this is a 100% remote-only position, we are seeking candidates within a European timezone. 


We're looking for our first employee and give you the opportunity to be part of a very exciting journey. 


You are a Senior Data Engineer (f/m) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our lean and focused company. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast growing remote startup in a key position.
