item.title: Javascript Developer (React+Redux || HapiJS)
item.description:
What we are looking for

A great javascript developer to join our excellent distributed development team. We are a full stack team, working on modern javascript frameworks and we are specifically looking for someone with experience of React+Redux or HapiJS (or even both).

Who we are

We are small team of 5 remote developers building a great product. But, its not just us, we also have QA, DevOps, WebDev and DataSci teams all working on the same product.

The product is BEN, the Branded Entertainment Network, we connect global brands to consumers through the power of popular entertainment. From the world-leading product integration platform (BEN) to the global leader for rights clearances and representation (Greenlight), Branded Entertainment Network helps elevate projects, amplify brands, and captivate audiences.  Our wider team is located globally in the US (LA, NY, Seattle and Provo), in Europe (London) as well as working remotely. Branded Entertainment Network is owned by Bill Gates.

Our show reel video on the homepage shows off what we do https://ben.productplacement.com/ go take a look, you've probably seen some of our product placements.

Our product gives brands and media buyers access to the premium film, TV, influencer and celebrity placement opportunities, managing all the workflow, match making and reporting on a single platform.

What you would do

Your role would be to help design, build and implement the BEN platform as part of the application development team. Exactly which part of the stack you will work on will depend on you and your skills.

Our target stack is ReactJS+HapiJS, but we are still migrating some parts out of our older Angular+Express backend. Any experience you have there would be an advantage.

We follow the AirBnB Javascript style, have enforced lint checking, automatic testing and deployments, two person code reviews, gitflow branching and everyone (including the managers) writes code.

Weâre a fully remote team, so having experience managing yourself is important. We are centered around two time zones, London and Los Angeles, with a daily stand ups at 9am in each cities timezone. As long as your able to work to one of those zones and have worked remotely before we would be happy to have you!

Interested? Sound like a team you would like to be part of? Would you like to know more?

Some questions for you
  
General
  • Whatâs links of yours should we read? GitHub? Blog? LinkedIn?
  • What editor / IDE do you use and why?
  • Have you worked remotely before? What are the advantages/drawbacks for you?
  • Whatâs the latest interesting Javascript thing you've discovered?
  • What new (non javascript) technology excites you?
  • Do you have any side project, open source project or something you are passionate about in your spare time?
  • What is your desired monthly salary?
  • What would you like to know about us? Ask us a question (or several!)
  
Front end
  • What was the best React/Redux project you worked on?
  • What form solutions have you used for react/redux and what did you like / dislike about them ?
  • Have you ever migrated an app from Angular to React? How did it go?
  • Have you used Atomic design or Storybook?
  
Backend
  • What was the best HapiJS project you worked on?
  • What do you think Hapi's best feature is?
  • Do you have a favourite Hapi module?

Its a lot of questions, I know. We don't expect you to be able to answer them all (but great if you can!). Its very important to us to make sure we are right for each other and we are really invested and interested in getting to know you.

Strictly individual applicants only please. No agency or recruitment agents.

To apply: Answer the questions in the advert and email me alex.mcfadyen@bengroup.com

item.title: Javascript Developer (React+Redux && || HapiJS)
item.description:
What we are looking for

A great javascript developer to join our excellent distributed development team. We are a full stack team, working on modern javascript frameworks and we are specifically looking for someone with experience of React+Redux and/or HapiJS.

Who we are

We are small team of 5 remote developers building a great product. But, its not just us, we also have QA, DevOps, WebDev and DataSci teams all working on the same product.

The product is BEN, the Branded Entertainment Network, we connect global brands to consumers through the power of popular entertainment. From the world-leading product integration platform (BEN) to the global leader for rights clearances and representation (Greenlight), Branded Entertainment Network helps elevate projects, amplify brands, and captivate audiences.  Our wider team is located globally in the US (LA, NY, Seattle and Provo), in Europe (London) as well as working remotely. Branded Entertainment Network is owned by Bill Gates.

Our show reel video on the homepage shows off what we do https://ben.productplacement.com/ go take a look, you've probably seen some of our product placements.

Our product gives brands and media buyers access to the premium film, TV, influencer and celebrity placement opportunities, managing all the workflow, match making and reporting on a single platform.

What you would do

Your role would be to help design, build and implement the BEN platform as part of the application development team. Exactly which part of the stack you will work on will depend on you and your skills.

Our target stack is ReactJS+HapiJS, but we are still migrating some parts out of our older Angular+Express backend. Any experience you have there would be an advantage.

We follow the AirBnB Javascript style, have enforced lint checking, automatic testing and deployments, two person code reviews, gitflow branching and everyone (including the managers) writes code.

Weâre a fully remote team, so having experience managing yourself is important. We are centered around two time zones, London and Los Angeles, with a daily stand ups at 9am in each cities timezone. As long as your able to work to one of those zones and have worked remotely before we would be happy to have you!

Interested? Sound like a team you would like to be part of? Would you like to know more?

Some questions for you
  
General
  • Whatâs links of yours should we read? GitHub? Blog? LinkedIn?
  • What editor / IDE do you use and why?
  • Have you worked remotely before? What are the advantages/drawbacks for you?
  • Whatâs the latest interesting Javascript thing you've discovered?
  • What new (non javascript) technology excites you?
  • Do you have any side project, open source project or something you are passionate about in your spare time?
  • What is your desired monthly salary?
  • What would you like to know about us? Ask us a question (or several!)
  
Front end
  • What was the best React/Redux project you worked on?
  • What form solutions have you used for react/redux and what did you like / dislike about them ?
  • Have you ever migrated an app from Angular to React? How did it go?
  • Have you used Atomic design or Storybook?
  
Backend
  • What was the best HapiJS project you worked on?
  • What do you think Hapi's best feature is?
  • Do you have a favourite Hapi module?

Its a lot of questions, I know. We don't expect you to be able to answer them all (but great if you can!). Its very important to us to make sure we are right for each other and we are really invested and interested in getting to know you.

To apply: Answer the questions in the advert and email me alex.mcfadyen@bengroup.com

item.title: Well-Rounded Jr/Mid-Level Developer
item.description:
Hi! Weâre an ecommerce platform in our 10th year, looking for a well-rounded junior/mid-level developer/generalist.

Weâre a small team (~8 people), and many of us wear quite a few hats. If youâre wanting to just do one thing all the time, this position isnât for you. If you enjoy learning new things and stretching yourself, doing some back-end, front-end, support, writing documentation, and maybe some marketing dev or ops projects (depending on your skills and interest), read on.

How will we know if youâre a good fit?

  • You have solid HTML, CSS & JS skills. Ability to use the web inspector to figure out whatâs broken, why, and how to fix it. You donât need to be able to build a webapp from scratch, but you should be able to build a nice and clean website. (Note that we donât build sites. But you should consider it bare minimum to be able to build a custom site, both by hardcoding or using your static approach of choice, and by using your preferred CMS.) Send some examples of code youâve written recently that youâre proud of.
  • You can do serverside code in at least one language at an intermediate level. Weâre mostly PHP, but have some systems in Node, and if youâre solid at another language and want to learn, thatâs fine. As above, you donât have to have built a complex system from scratch, but you need to be able to work with APIs, write new code in an existing system, and generally just do more than copy/paste from SO.
  • You can communicate with clarity and patience (in English), both internally and to our users. As a fully remote team, clear communication is our lifeblood.
  • You can figure things out and write great documentation, tutorials, getting started walkthroughs, and more. Bonus points if you can handle some basic video creation. Samples of your writing (blog posts are ok if you donât have technical writing available) if youâd like.
  • Youâre ok spending a few hours a day doing support. As a small team, we all pitch in to cover support, and because of the technical nature of our service, weâre generally supporting other devs. We pride ourselves in how well we treat our users, and we get fantastic feedback. If youâre not keen to contribute, thatâs cool, itâs not for everybody; but this position isnât for you.
  • You know you can work remotely during US hours. This is a biggie. Many people think they want to work remotely, then they (or their partners) realize they just canât sit at home all day in their basement. If you arenât sure, please donât apply. Our team is small and we have extremely low turnover, and thereâs a lot of domain-specific knowledge, so we canât spend months getting you up to speed only for you to discover youâre going stir-crazy and really need to be in an office. Nothing wrong with offices. We just donât have one :)

Again, please only apply if you really love helping people and solving problems, and wonât get burnt out doing that remotely. Also, please include an image of a kitten (or any feline) in your response :)

A Note About Your Location & Timezone

For this role, weâre looking for somebody in the Americas (North, Central, or South), but ideally weâre looking for somebody who can normally be around until 6pm Pacific or regularly clock a few hours in the evening, as thatâll ensure you have overlap with the US folks in Central Time as well as our Australian dev.

All are encouraged to apply, regardless of age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion, sexual orientation, or other aspects of who you are.

Sound good? Hereâs a bit about us and how we work:

  • Weâre a fully remote team, so having experience managing yourself is key.
  • 35 hours/week, 7 hours/day, at least 5 of which fall in US business hours. More hours/week is fine. We value flexibility, family, and work-life balance, but we need this commitment.
  • We value honesty, learning, cooperation, and a healthy work/life balance. You can ask our team as you interview about how we put those values into practice, but they arenât empty words for us.
  • Weâre very flexible about hours so long as work is getting done.
  • Weâre a small team spread across the US, Russia, Pakistan, and Australia. We occasionally do in-person meetups as well. Because of the complexities of a remote team, the exact nature of our relationship will depend on where youâre located.

A Bit More About Foxy.io

We make it easy for developers to add the ability to accept any payment within any environment, for any product, from any customer, on any device. At itâs simplest, itâs a hosted payment page with âadd to cartâ buttons, but built for complex and custom integrations.

Weâre PCI Level 1 Service provider. Weâre self-funded and profitable. And we enjoy what we do (most of the time :). We started in 2007, and have served thousands of merchants all over the world, from tiny micro-businesses to Global Fortune 500 enterprises.

How To Apply:
  1. Re-read the above to make sure you think youâre a good fit.
  2. Send your rÃ©sumÃ© or comparable details.
  3. Include any extra info youâd like us to know. We spend the bulk of our waking days working together. Weâre not looking for new best friends, but we want to know weâll enjoy working together.
  4. Include your desired hourly or salary.
  5. Be prepared to complete a few reasonably quick tasks so we can get a sense of how you approach real-world problem solving. (We value your time, and donât expect the first to take more than ~30 minutes.)

To apply: See the above "How To Apply" section, and email us at jobs@foxycart.com

item.title: Campaign Support Engineer
item.description:
MoveOn.org

CAMPAIGN SUPPORT ENGINEER

Regular and Exempt, Full-Time â¢ Starts ASAP â¢ Competitive Pay â¢ Excellent Benefits
Work from Anywhere in the US

Help us build the resistance!

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in 2017, MoveOn is investing deeply in supporting our organizing team to use technology that amplifies ordinary peopleâs voices in our democracy. We are hiring a passionate problem solver who will work broadly across many projects with campaign staff to run innovative campaigns using top-of-the-line political technology, digital campaigning tools and data analysis. Do you love working at the intersection of progressive organizing and technology? Join our team! Work alongside MoveOnâs core team of strategists, organizers, data scientists, and software engineers on technical projects that lift up progressive values, defend vulnerable communities, and build the resistance movement that will fight Trump.

The MoveOn team works and lives in communities around the country, providing employees tremendous flexibility to live and work anywhere in the continental United States. MoveOn staff are embedded in the communities that make up America, and we pursue the healthy development of community and social connections outside our work lives.

Responsibilities:

  • Quickly get up to speed and develop mastery in the online campaigning platform ActionKit. Candidate will have a supported onboarding and learning plan that includes ActionKit.
  • Work side by side with MoveOn team members on complex digital organizing tasks like creating targeted emails, surveys, donation forms, and live event recruitment pages.
  • Help MoveOn team members edit HTML on campaign webpages.
  • Write SQL and use data analysis tools to support team members with campaign reporting.
  • Train MoveOn team members on complex workflows that use online campaigning tools.
  • Contribute your ideas to organizational strategy discussions
  • Contribute your ideas to tech team discussions to enhance and improve our tools and tactics.

Required skills and experience:

  • Knowledge of SQL in a relational database like MySQL or PostgreSQL, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • Experience editing HTML and CSS, or a desire to quickly learn.
  • Comfortable with or willing to learn to use a linux command line interface.
  • A strong interest in learning and developing expertise in new technical tools, frameworks, and software.
  • Able to fluently communicate with both technical and campaign staff, and communicate technical information to a diverse audience
  • Determined and thorough- see projects through from idea to implementation to launch, supporting MoveOn team members through the whole process.
  • Curious, and a fearless learner and problem solver.
  • Ability to be effective in an organization whose team members all work remotely.

Location: Position may be based anywhere in the continental United States.

Classification: Regular and Exempt, Full-Time.  Every position at MoveOn begins with a 6-month introductory period (including our Executive Directors) which is intended to serve as a natural period of evaluation and reflection for both MoveOn and the employee to determine whether a successful employment relationship can be created.  Nothing in this classification section alters the at-will employment relationship between MoveOn and MoveOn employees.

Salary, and Benefits:  Competitive salary including benefits such as 100%-employer-paid premiums for medical, dental, and vision insurance for all staff and their children; employer-paid premiums for life insurance for all staff; four weeks accrued paid vacation time per year; 12 weeks of paid maternity or paternity leave, 10 days accrued paid sick time; and reimbursement of office expenses.  

To apply: To Apply: Click here to submit your application, resume, and cover letter. MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

item.title: Front End Javascript Engineer
item.description:
DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Front End Javascript Engineer to join our global team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

In this role you will have significant front end responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by using modern design patterns, and cutting edge development thinking including isomorphic code, stateless components, and functional concepts.

---

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code. You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth. You can expect to work on Angular, React with Redux, and Webpack. You might also have a chance to use React Native, Electron, Bootstrap and D3. 

---

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses. 

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh. 

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team?  Check out http://why.clevertech.biz. 

To apply: https://hire.clevertech.biz/job/572b5431c4bfa6ce4fc43c10

item.title: Senior Front end Engineer
item.description:
Actyx is rethinking manufacturing. We are driving a new manufacturing paradigm based on the Internet of Things, advanced big-data analytics, adaptive user-assistance systems and intelligent machines and robots. We are working hand-in-hand with manufactures to develop the operating system of the factory of the future. We solve hard technical problems, constantly working toward our vision of smart, adaptive, sustainable and efficient manufacturing.


Building software solutions for the manufacturing domain is extremely challenging, in terms of usability, robustness, scalability, security and more. Our applications must be managed from the cloud, but still run when the internet is down. Our applications must be highly configurable, but easy to use. Our applications must be built-for-mobile, but also work on standard workstations. Our Applications must be performant in low-bandwidth environments, but still encrypt everything. To achieve this we are looking for talented and ambitious frontend engineers; are you up to the challenge?

item.title: Senior / Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Full Stack Developer
6 Month Contract to Hire
Isotope Eleven, Inc
Headquarters: Birmingham, AL, USA
http://www.isotope11.com

Birmingham based software development firm is growing and looking for experienced Full Stack Software Developer.

WHO WE ARE
IsotopeEleven, Inc. is a Birmingham, Alabama USA based Software Development Firm established in 2005. Since then, we have worked with a broad spectrum of clients ranging from Federal and State Agencies, to businesses of all sizes including Fortune 500 companies. We were recently named Technology Company of the Year 2015 by the Birmingham Business Alliance. We've worked on projects in almost all verticals including healthcare, construction, financial, insurance, travel - just to name a few. Our main focus is project-based custom software development. We also offer other services including staff augmentation, project architecture, code review, training, maintenance of legacy apps and general consulting. We consist of a group of seasoned developers that are dedicated to the success of our projects and the best interests of our clients.

HOW WE WORK
There are no fancy job titles or levels of management, we all just get things done. We work as a team however you also need to be able to work semi-autonomously. We are a remote work based company, however, this position may require some travel. We use tools such a slack, google hangouts, trello and others to help us interact throughout the day as if we were all under the same roof.

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR / OUR CULTURE
Our developers write clean, logical, high-quality code using test-driven development and Agile practices. You donât have to be experienced with Agile and TDD to join us, but you must be willing to learn. 
  • The Ability to Self-Manage: Our developers usually work one or two projects at a time, and mostly with no direct daily or hourly management. We must be focused, self-directed, and good at managing our work.
  • A Consultant Mindset: Our goal is to create solutions that will provide the maximum value for the clientâs investment. To accomplish this, our developers must have consultant mindset that lets us delve into the business context and closely manage our time, our usersâ needs, and our clientâs budget.
  • Curiosity & Love of Learning: Because we try to find the best tool for every situation, our developers are fast learners who can quickly ramp into a new toolset or language. You might move from developing a web app in Ruby to creating an internal application in Javascript to building a mobile app in Objective-C or Java.
  • A Passion for Development: Most of us consider it a great thing to be getting paid for something we even do in our spare time. We are passionate about doing really good work (we Give a Sh*t, and we constantly work to refine our practices and chosen profession.
  • Strong Communication Skills: As consultants on small teams, we work very closely with clients and their usersâlearning, exploring, teaching, problem solving, calming fears, discussing budgets, and making smart compromises. Thatâs a whole lot of talking and writing, which means we must be clear, transparent communicators who can understand their audience, give them the right level of detail, and help them make smart, informed decisions.
  • The Ability to be a Good Team Member: Our developers work side-by-side with designers, clients, and other developers, discussing our work and managing a constant flow of feedback. We put the needs of the product over their own egos.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
  • 5+ Years experience with Ruby and Rails
  • Experience using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS and Python
  • Experience using jQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis, Linux, Nginx, Elasticsearch, and Amazon Web Services - the more the better
  • Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Selenium
  • Familiarity with distributed revision control systems such as Git
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently - accountable for your own actions and able to act with both urgency and integrity
  • Although we are a remote based development firm, as we are Federal Contractor, our developers must be United States citizens and must submit to a background check confidentially processed by our third party
IN SUMMARY:
You should be absolutely passionate about building great software. You should take pride in your work and be excited to share it with our clients.

WHAT WEâRE OFFERING:
An opportunity to work with an incredible group of people who love what they do. This is a full-time, 6 month contract with the intention of hiring post contract. We are offering an hourly compensation of between $35-45/hour depending on experience level and paid bi-weekly.

3800 Colonnade Parkway, Suite 140
Birmingham, AL 35243
Phone: 205-742-9671
Email: info@isotope11.com
Website: www.isotope11.com

To apply: To apply please send CV and any other important imformation to: info@isotope11.com

item.title: Unity Developer (C#)
item.description:
Kible is a learning design technology startup that is looking for an experienced Unity developer to assist with developing our app.

Applicant should have at least two years of professional project based experienced with Unity, and C# in a Unity context, and any additional interaction design or technical artist skills on top of that would be ideal. CS degree preferred but not necessary.

You'll be working on an app that has for the most part been designed with static and animated reference wireframes, although interface design will have to be reworked for the actual app, which I, Jason, will be able to assist with and direct as the managing experience designer.

Working on the Kible app will require an understanding of how to develop the following in Unity:

  • Employ Unity's realtime 3D engine such that up to thousands of instances of simple geometry can be in play without crashing.
  • Enable the user interaction of said instances derived from a set inventory of parent geometry that can be modified by the developers later.
  • The cataloguing of said instances of geometry, e.g. how many of each instance the user is playing with in their current scheme.
  • Implement several multitouch commands and user camera navigation of 3D space, ranging from single finger input up to four, five, or even six finger input (pan, orbit, zoom, gimbal, bank, etc).
  • Transitioning from 2D menu interfaces to 3D environments.
  • Basic superimposed geometry over camera feed augmented reality.
  • Knowledge of how to best build a Unity project for iOS and Android and how to responsively develop interface menus to scale appropriately for various device resolutions.

While not crucial upfront, depending on the applicant's skill level and experience, the project will also eventually require the following to be done in Unity:

  • Enabling the creation of user profiles and managing user inventories.
  • Setting up a vendor system for both in-game digital acquisitions and mail ordered tangible purchases.
  • Integration with other social channels such that users can directly send snapshots or videos taken from within the app and post elsewhere.

Kible is a startup founded in 2016, and is excited to begin a working relationship with a Unity developer as we move towards the larger visions of our venture. My name is Jason, I am the sole founder and am looking forward to reading from you.

To apply: Send a brief statement of interest and Linkedin profile URL to me, Jason, at jbrain@gsd.harvard.edu
item.tags: game dev, dev, c plus plus

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
As a senior software engineer, you will bring solutions that change the lives of millions of users. Here at Tokopedia, you will work with a small team and can switch team or projects depending on business needs. We need people who are willing to learn and always eager to tackle exciting problems at a huge scale.


Responsibilities:



  • Hands on with code in either of GoLang, C, C++, Node.js, Ruby, Python. Multi-programming-lingual. The more the merrier.

  • Comfortable working in a *nix environment & using cli.

  • Eager to learn new tools, techniques, languages, and technologies.

  • Passionate about making a difference to the world.

  • Be able to contribute to system architecture and design.

  • Be able to debug non-trivial application code.

  • Be able to write clear, concise source-code documentation, unit and integration tests.

  • Be able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience.

  • Be able to communicate and coordinate within a team.

  • Build a features, systems

  • Solve technical problems

  • Create scalable back-end

item.title: Laravel PHP Engineer Do Good. Do Well. Have Fun Doing It
item.description:
LiteracyPro creates software to make the world a better place. We are leaders in the custom web application space for government agencies. Our data collection and reporting software helps agencies help millions of disadvantaged people improve their opportunities to get jobs with sustainable, living wages for themselves and their families. Enjoy being part of a fun group of bright, passionate folks, in a great working environment, with superb salary & benefits while helping those who help others.


We’re looking for an extraordinary PAAS, full-stack, Laravel/PHP engineer to help us grow our new, cloud-based application. This enterprise application – known as “CommunityPro Suite” – was released last Spring and is getting rave reviews. Our Company is poised for explosive growth in the coming months due to national demand, and we’re looking for a talented engineer with the smarts, passion and people skills to code and be part of moving the engineering team forward. You’d be an important player in the engineering effort as we continue expanding the product according to our roadmap.


CommunityPro Suite is a growing Laravel web application that enables huge state and local agencies to securely match, consolidate and share data between themselves in real time. The purpose of the software is to reduce organizational friction by helping local agencies help people achieve economic self-sufficiency. The end goal is to play an important role in creating healthy, vibrant communities.


Please no staffing agencies or contractors.

item.title: Content Researcher Developer Labs
item.description:
What is Cloud Academy?

At Cloud Academy, were builders. Learning new technology is just as exciting for us as building it. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and empowering students, developers, engineers and companies to build and grow products with robust and constantly updated cloud skills. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide.

We have been very successful in building our platform to support thousands of learners every day in 150+ countries worldwide. Our growing Product Team is now looking for a Content Researcher and Developer, Labs to create new Labs for our Labs Technology group. This role is a hybrid between a Content Creator and a Technical Writer and we are looking for someone with experience and passion in both.

The ideal person has an understanding of cloud technologies and is passionate to teach what they have learned to others. You will be working with a SaaS product on a team of 3 to 6 people to build online labs.

This position is remote or based in San Francisco. You will work with our Content team based in San Francisco and our engineering team based in Switzerland.


Benefits


  • Competitive compensation
  • Yearly bonus based on your achievements
  • Stock options
  • Full benefits, including medical, dental and vision
  • Yearly budget for conferences/courses for your personal development
  • A very exciting environment with unlimited snacks and drinks
  • Your personal workstation (up to $2000)
  • Public transportation subsidy


We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

item.title: JavaScript Developer and Consultant
item.description:
ABOUT BITOVI:
Bitovi helps companies create better web applications.  
We have a track record of designing and building high-profile and amazing web applications through our active Consulting practice.  Our apps are built with tests, full docs and a deployment process in place.  We created the open source tools powering the applications we build.

Bitovi has been a pioneer in producing advanced JavaScript frameworks and tools for almost a decade. We develop and maintain several open source products such as CanJS, DoneJS, and StealJS to name a few.  we are interested in product innovation and opportunities.
Our team is comprised of about 40ish developers and designers located around the US and Canada.. This is a remote, full-time position.  Due to travel requirements, at this time we are seeking candidates in the US or Canada who are willing and able to travel.

WHAT WEâRE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for highly qualified individuals with:

  • a good understanding of Computer Science
  • a solid background in Modern Front End Development, including JavaScript frameworks
  • professional experience developing enterprise applications
  • A CS degree, or equivalent knowledge is required

We welcome diversity and non-traditional paths into the developer profession, and advocate strongly for hiring the right person as opposed to the right combination of tech keywords.

THE JOB:
Youâll work with clients creating applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies.

Youâll work closely with our Open Source team, helping us to advance, improve, and evolve our Open Source toolset.

Youâll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the JavaScript community in your own way.

We support the technical growth and development of our employees. We have an open and engaging community of skilled developers with whom you can collaborate and learn together.

Bitovi developers:
  • Present at conferences
  • Give trainings
  • Plan and run meetups
  • Create and maintain open source projects
  • Write articles

A LITTLE BIT MORE:

Weâre looking for passionate JavaScript developers who identify with our mission.

We want someone who enjoys identifying the hard parts of application development and simplifying them, talking about software architecture, and teaching others. We also want someone who can lead others and be an integral part of a team.

Specifically, the following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:

  • Has an eagerness to learn and execute in the âthe right wayâ
  • Is open minded about development best practices
  • Has some experience with back-end systems and databases
  • Doesnât mind a bit of travel, averaging one week every month
  • Enjoys working on client projects and interacting with clients
  • Some experience contributing to or using open source projects

BENEFITS:
Bitovians get a slate of great benefits. Bitovi offers:

  • Competitive salary and yearly bonuses
  • Bi-annual company retreats to places like Las Vegas, New Orleans, and Amelia Island, Florida
  • 401(k) plan with matching
  • 4 weeks of paid vacation
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • LTD and Life Insurance
  • Gym membership reimbursement
  • Maternity & Paternity leave
  • Working from home with flexible hours

To apply: Write a resume and a thoughtful cover letter that shows us that youâre the kind of person weâve described above. Share something you've built or worked on and let us know what you are most proud of related to it. All applications should be submitted using the following link:http://20130208084208_hirikecryt4flqmf.applytojob.com/apply/wUsD7sqsgP/JavaScript-Developer?source=weworkremotely.com *Please note that we are not interested in working with Recruiters or Hiring firms at this time.*

item.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack
item.description:
ABOUT US
At Close.io weâre building the sales communication platform of the future. Weâve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are hiring engineers to help us unify the world's sales calls and emails into one beautiful workflow.

Our tech stack includes Python/Flask, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Puppet, & AWS with the frontend as a single-page web app in JavaScript, React, Backbone.js, HTML5, & CSS/LESS.

We â¤ open source â using dozens of open source projects with contributions to many of them, and released some of our own: https://github.com/closeio

ABOUT YOU
We're looking for great developers to join our core team who have a strong understanding of web technologies and want to help design, implement, launch, and scale major systems and user-facing features.

YOU SHOULD...
  • have 8+ years experience design, implement, launch, and scale major systems and user-facing features.
  • have demonstrated experience in several of the technologies we are using, but you donât need to be an expert in all of them. Weâre looking for someone who is already comfortable across various layers of the web stack and eager to learn additional technologies as necessary.
  • enjoy designing, scaling, and optimizing systems to make them super fast, while still being nicely maintainable.
  • care a lot about product and user experience and take responsibility for thinking like a user. Weâre looking for people who donât rely on a designer or product manager to figure UX stuff out for them.
  • be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team.

BONUS POINT IF YOU...
  • significant open source work in Python or JavaScript
  • have great product sense or an eye for designing beautiful and usable UIs
  • experience with VoIP telephony

WHY WORK WITH US? 
  • Build a truly successful SaaS company with a stellar team where you can have a huge impact.
  • Above market salary, healthcare, dental, and retirement benefits package
  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world! Just be willing to do a bit of traveling twice a year for some face-to-face time with the whole team.

To apply: https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/f7a2313f-33eb-4e7b-9c5b-b8cbcc55fab9/apply?lever-source=WWR

item.title: Systems Reliability Engineer - Americas
item.description:
At Canonical it is our mission to make open source software available to people
everywhere. We believe the best way to fuel innovation is to give the innovators
the technology they need. As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) for the
Information Services (IS) team you'll play a key role in driving this mission
andhelping to define the future of free software.

SREs work closely with development teams to build and maintain the extraordinary
infrastructure required to run all of Canonical and Ubuntuâs systems and services.
The scope of our responsibility combined with the overall size of our environment
means that our SREs face new challenges every day. From developing automated
processes for faster, more reliable deployments to building large and scalable
cloudenvironments, every day at Canonical is an opportunity to learn something new
and collaborate with some of the most talented technical minds in the industry.

IS supports and maintains all of Canonicalâs production services and IS team
members use real-life operational experiences to contribute to product
improvements. As an SRE youâll be in a unique position that will allow you to
provide critical feedback to developers by writing code, submitting bugs, and
working with others within the company to ensure that Canonical products are as
good as they can be. You will also be able to develop and submit fixes and
enhancements directly.

LOCATION

This role requires that you be physically located in North or South America.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 * You have prior experience working in a large highly available environment
 * You are willing to be flexible and adaptable with the ability to learn
   new things quickly.
 * You have strong development skills (Python, Go, Ruby, etc.) with
   experience writing code.
 * You are heavily focused on automation preferably with experience in
   building and maintaining self-service tools.
 * You have authoritative understanding and experience with the
   administration of infrastructure services such as DNS, DHCP, SSH,
   Apache/Nginx, HAProxy, Squid/Varnish, PostgreSQL/MySQL etc.
 * You have practical knowledge of IP networking and routing
 * You have a strong security focus including knowledge of network,
   operating system and application level practices
 * You have familiarity with software development and code review practices,
   including use of DVCS (e.g. git or bzr)
 * You have experience deploying, administering and maintaining services in
   a cloud computing environment
 * You are able to communicate clearly in English, especially using email
   and IRC
 * You have a college degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent
   experience.
 * You are are self-driven and able to troubleshoot, ask others when
   appropriate and find answers
 * You are motivated, organised, and willing and able to work well remotely
   within a distributed team
 * You are able to participate in our weekend on call rotation approximately
   1 weekend every 18 weeks

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 * You have prior experience administering OpenStack
 * You have familiarity with Juju and MAAS
 * You have familiarity with Ubuntu or Debian
 * You have prior experience with configuration management tools (Puppet,
   Chef, CFEngine, etc.)
 * You have prior experience maintaining and configuring routers and
   firewalls (Cisco, iptables)

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer.

To apply: Fill out an application here: https://ldd.tbe.taleo.net/ldd03/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CANONICAL&cws=1&rid=1232

item.title: Systems Reliability Engineer
item.description:
At Canonical it is our mission to make open source software available to people
everywhere. We believe the best way to fuel innovation is to give the innovators
the technology they need. As a Systems Reliability Engineer (SRE) for the
Information Services (IS) team you'll play a key role in driving this mission and
helping to define the future of free software.

SREs work closely with development teams to build and maintain the extraordinary
infrastructure required to run all of Canonical and Ubuntuâs systems and services.
The scope of our responsibility combined with the overall size of our environment
means that our SREs face new challenges every day. From developing automated
processes for faster, more reliable deployments to building large and scalable cloud
environments, every day at Canonical is an opportunity to learn something new and
collaborate with some of the most talented technical minds in the industry.

IS supports and maintains all of Canonicalâs production services and IS team
members use real-life operational experiences to contribute to product improvements.
As an SRE youâll be in a unique position that will allow you to provide critical feedback
to developers by writing code, submitting bugs, and working with others within the
company to ensure that Canonical products are as good as they can be. You will also
be able to develop and submit fixes and enhancements directly.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES

SREs rotate through three roles:
1. Maintaining all core services, networks, and infrastructure (including public and private clouds). The ability to work under pressure and demonstrate sound problem solving skills
in a fast-paced and complex environment are key here.
2. Working directly with a variety of development teams within Canonical in a devops role
to test, deploy, monitor and maintain services running on our production clouds. This will
require an overlap of development and administration skills, as you help write and review
code you will then use to deploy and maintain services using Canonical's cloud products.
3. Larger project work, currently focused on large scale cloud deployments and overall
process improvements. This role gives SREs the ability to utilize development and
architecting skills in a focused manner that is unique to Canonical.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • You have prior experience working in a large highly available environment
  • You are willing to be flexible and adaptable with the ability to learn new things quickly.
  • You have strong development skills (Python, Go, Ruby, etc.) with experience writing code.
  • You are heavily focused on automation preferably with experience in building and maintaining self-service tools.
  • You have authoritative understanding and experience with the administration of infrastructure services such as DNS, DHCP, SSH, Apache/Nginx, HAProxy, Squid/Varnish, PostgreSQL/MySQL etc.
  • You have practical knowledge of IP networking and routing
  • You have a strong security focus including knowledge of network, operating system and application level practices
  • You have familiarity with software development and code review practices, including use of DVCS (e.g. git or bzr)
  • You have experience deploying, administering and maintaining services in a cloud computing environment
  • You are able to communicate clearly in English, especially using email and IRC
  • You have a college degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent experience.
  • You are are self-driven and able to troubleshoot, ask others when
  • appropriate and find answers
  • You are motivated, organised, and willing and able to work well remotely within a distributed team
  • You are able to participate in our weekend on call rotation approximately 1 weekend every 18 weeks

DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • You have prior experience administering OpenStack
  • You have familiarity with Juju and MAAS
  • You have familiarity with Ubuntu or Debian
  • You have prior experience with configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, CFEngine, etc.)
  • You have prior experience maintaining and configuring routers and firewalls (Cisco, iptables)

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer.

To apply: Fill out an application here: https://ldd.tbe.taleo.net/ldd03/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=CANONICAL&cws=1&rid=1232

item.title: Social Media & Content Marketing Specialist
item.description:
We have an immediate opening for a hungry, Social Media and Content Marketing specialist who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs & is fanatical about helping SMB businesses succeed.

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 7,000 businesses. We exist to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. Weâre passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers. We work closely with eCommerce partners like Amazon, Shopify, eBay, Square, Magento and WooCommerce to help eCommerce businesses thrive.

We offer TaxJar Reports, a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations.

As a Social Media & Content Marketing Specialist you will:
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with eCommerce influencers, industry experts and strategic TaxJar partners
  • Research and identify new audiences for TaxJar and market our extensive library of sales tax content
  • Take ownership of and grow TaxJarâs existing social media channels; research and suggest new social media opportunities
  • Provide first tier social media customer support
  • Pitch sales tax content to online publications and media outlets
  • Develop content strategies that can scale across the web and social media properties
  • Own, manage and grow TaxJarâs affiliate program
  • Record and track performance metrics

Requirements
This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the continental US only.

Skills & requirements we're looking for
  • Excellent written and verbal communicator
  • Experienced in social media strategy, tactics and trends (with an emphasis on B2B social media)
  • Graphic design/visual communication experience a definite plus
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Agile, humble, and a team player with a desire to win
  • Passion for ecommerce & helping business owners thrive

Youâll be a great fit on our team if you're
  • A pro at communicating
  • Well-experienced working remotely
  • Accountable & KPI driven
  • Never tired of learning
  • Looking for a culture that prioritizes shipping products and going to market quickly
  • Confident in your skills and a solid team player (Weâre all peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role, and not afraid to go big and potentially fail
  • Excited to be part of the company leading innovation in the sales tax space

Weâre a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. Weâre always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

To apply: We get lots of resumes. If you want to be considered for this position, please treat this like a 1st interview. Please apply here: https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/432503/candidates/new

item.title: PHP Java Web Developers
item.description:
Job specifications are intended to present a descriptive list of the range of duties performed by employees. Specifications are not intended to reflect all duties performed within the job.



SUMMARY


GeoNorth is looking for creative, motivated Web Developers who enjoy solving problems and learning new skills, all levels. We are a small team supporting a big organization, and so must leverage the latest, cutting-edge tools, frameworks, and methodologies.  If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you'll love this opportunity!  Multiple positions available.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following.



  • Work with Government and Department of Defense clients to create sites based on their vision, needs, and content.

  • Assist with requirements gathering, information architecture, and UI/UX.

  • Migrate clients off of legacy static sites and into new CMS sites.

  • Assist legacy clients in maintaining their current static sites.

  • Support website deployment efforts.

  • Must possess a great work ethic and be able to work directly with end-users, key stakeholders and sponsors in a collaborative environment.


NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Other duties as assigned.



Required Skills


REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS


Education and Experience


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.


8570 IAT Level 2 certification, e.g. Security+



The Junior Developer shall demonstrate six (6) months of specialized experience in web development and six (6) months of general IT experience.



The Mid-level Developer shall demonstrate three (3) years of specialized experience in web development and five (5) years of general IT experience.


The Senior-level Developer shall demonstrate seven (7) years of specialized experience in web development and ten (10) years of general IT experience.



Critical Skills, Knowledge and Abilities


Security+ certification or the ability to earn it within 90 days of hire


Excellent knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


Experience in PHP and/or Java


The ability to learn new things quickly


Comfortable working independently and in a team environment



Differentiating Skills


Experience with web frameworks like jQuery, Bootstrap, Knockout, SASS, etc.


Experience with distributed source control systems (preferably Git)


Ansible


Basic systems administration skills for Windows and Linux to include: Remote Desktop, SSH, SFTP, restarting services


UI/UX design, wireframes, information architecture


CMS development/administration experience


Graphics design skills, Photoshop expertise


Experience designing/developing Section 508 compliant websites


Aptitude for requirements gathering. Able to communicate complex technical concepts to company stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner


Experience with Agile development processes, methodologies, and tools


Understanding of Test Driven Development Aptitude



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Performance of essential and ancillary functions requires maintenance of physical conditioning adequate for bending, stooping, and sitting; walking or standing for prolonged periods. Most work requires sitting in a comfortable position with frequent opportunity to move about. Must be able to lift 60 lbs. Requires near visual acuity to review written documentation; ability to hear and understand speech at normal room levels and on the telephone; manual dexterity to operate a telephone and keyboard; and ability to lift horizontally and vertically.


WORK ENVIRONMENT


Most work will be performed in environmentally controlled areas. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate but can be high.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES


None


Additional Qualifying Factors


Must be able to able to gain access to US military installations, after undergoing background check. Reliable transportation to/from work a necessity, and travel will be required.  As a condition of employment, candidates for posted positions must pass a pre-employment drug screening, as well as have acceptable reference and background check results.



Native preference applies.



The Tatitlek Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer


Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veterans status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or any other status protected by law

item.title: Front end Developer
item.description: Help independent creators make a living doing what they love! Every day, thousands of customers use Creative Market to buy ready-to-use design content (fonts, graphics, templates, website themes, 3d models, etc) directly from top designers around the world. Join the team to help us continue our meteoric growth, and your work will be used by millions of people every month. As a front-end product engineer, you'll work on a team of talented individuals working closely together to shipping the best possible product.

item.title: Software Developer
item.description:
You'll be working in a tight-knit team from day one, collaborating with everyone around you to deliver value on a daily basis. You'll own functionality from start to finish, from helping product owners flesh out new features all the way to running your code in production.


Our teams are organised by product, and each one has its own distinct process that developed by the people involved. Each team is small, cross-functional and dynamic, so you'll be able to influence the process to make sure it works well for you as well as everyone else. Currently there's a mix of practices and tools for each team, but they include:


-an Agile mentality, including a large amount of customer collaboration
-Scrum and Kanban for keeping track of our work
-eXtreme Programming, including test-driven development and pair programming
-a DevOps mindset: developers own and support their code all the way to production
-continuous deployment pipelines to staging and production
-logging and monitoring as first-class citizens
-learning as a virtue in its own right

item.title: Senior Developer - Full-Stack with Node
item.description:
We're looking for an experienced web developer to join our remote development team.
We need someone with significant NodeJS and MongoDB experience and front-end frameworks specifically Backbone.
You will work with the Lead developer and Product Manager in maintaining and extending features of our product as well as helping us architect/migrate to v2 of our product, which will use a RESTful API using StrongLoop and hosted on AWS.  Currently we use Parse Server and host on AWS via Heroku.

REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 7 years coding experience and at least 4 years in Node and front-end frameworks
  • Someone very comfortable and efficient at working remotely (we use Trello, Slack and Pivotal Tracker)
  • Peer code reviews
  • Producing high quality maintainable code
  • Agile (Kanban) software development

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Salary
  • Equity - we want everyone to share in the success and it's worthy to note we have a seasoned founding team that have previously made successful exits from other startups and built highly profitable companies
  • Work almost whenever you want and wherever you want, whilst aiming for 35 working hours a week. Most of us work most weekdays.
  • Take time off almost whenever you want - be courteous so that your time off is not disruptive to other team members and try to be fair to yourself and the company. We want our team members to avoid burnout, we want them to be happy. We want them to love their work and love their life!

To apply: Apply on: https://jibble.workable.com/

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer

Versal is an interactive publishing platform for online learning free and open to anyone with knowledge and the desire to share it. Our products are ideal for individuals, institutions and organizations who want to create online courses, lessons, tutorials and many other kinds of interactive, educational content.

We are currently looking for a senior front-end engineer with strong javascript skills to work on our core applications and public APIs. You'll work closely with our product, design, and backend teams to implement user-facing features. As a senior member of the team, you'll assist in making architectural decisions, growing our team, and mentoring junior engineers.

item.title: Designer
item.description: __How We Work__There is no Bandcamp office. Our team is sprinkled throughout the world, with arms, cells, pods, what-have-yous in San Francisco, Brooklyn, Montreal, British Columbia, the British Isles, Los Angeles, the Carolinas, Pittsburgh, Vermont, Mexico City and Berlin. We get together all day and night on Slack, design and document everything on a wiki, do a short daily hangout that is exactly like the start of Hill Street Blues, and meet in person a few times a year for strategizing, working head-to-head, and laser bowling. If you do not have a strong social structure outside of work then employment at Bandcamp will likely lead to heart disease and an early death.----__Designer__Bandcamp is seeking a mind-bogglingly talented individual for our design team to help us create new products and features, improve existing ones and make our site and mobile apps shining beacons of wonder for all who gaze upon them. You will design. You will code. You will have a positive impact on the lives of hundreds of thousands of artists and their millions of fans each and every day. You will feel good. You will feel as good as I do right now.* You are a user-experience/interaction designer and visual designer.* You will be able to take your ideas from sketches to mockups to production-ready HTML/CSS.* You understand that design is how a product looks and how it works.* You love digging into a problem, discovering the underlying issues, crafting solutions and measuring the results.* Your work exhibits a refined, clean, contemporary visual aesthetic.* You know about typography and how to best use it across mediums.* You canât understand why a job posting would list HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Sketch, Principle, Photoshop, Illustrator and Dreamweaver as requirements when thatâs already obvious. We are joking about Dreamweaver.* You have an irrepressible joie de vivre that permeates your work and elevates it from good to great.* You have a natural curiosity that drives you to learn and investigate.* You are skilled at giving and receiving design criticism and appreciate its importance as part of the design process.* You have conducted user tests and used the findings to address design issues.* You are an excellent writer and communicator who enjoys sharing your thoughts and work with your peers.* You have done some amazing work to date and are certain your best work is still ahead of you.* Bonus: You have experience in animation, illustration, print, video and/or photography.* Your portfolio reflects all of the above.* You live in any part of the world, but your work schedule overlaps with GMT-7 at least four hours each day.Recent and soon-to-become graduates warmly encouraged to apply. Seasoned practitioners with pliable wills in no way discouraged.

item.title: Meteor React Developer with interested Blockchains Ethereum
Sales Development Representative / Sales Analyst
item.description:
We are seeking disciplined and creative hunters who want to join a rapidly growing, dynamic sales team!  

We are looking for candidates from North America only.

With the epic rise of social media, everyone has a newfound â but very strong â public voice. Bonfire helps people sell apparel to their community while we do all the heavy lifting of payment processing, customer service & fulfillment.

@Bonfire:

  • Weâre a young, agile startup growing by leaps and bounds. Do you want to play an integral role in helping Bonfire scale at warp speed?
  • We donât have many rules. Growth happens when you push buttons & experiment.
  • Startups are really hard. Large corporations are kinda boring.  Are you interested in joining a sales team of extremely passionate people working to make a difference?
  • The Bonfire family is contagious. Who you hire makes it easy.
  • We are building something special and itâs not a secret. Not everyone knows yet.
  • We like smart people.

Hereâs what you'll be doing:

As a sales development representative at Bonfire you will be conducting high volume prospecting to generate and qualify leads for the account management team.  

  • You will work closely and collaboratively with sales and marketing to design, develop, and implement appropriate prospect communication plans.  
  • You will brainstorm, plan, execute, and measure new customer segments to pursue
  • You will draft segment specific emails with creative messaging to drive high response rates and lead generation for our account managers
  • You will research target verticals/accounts/individuals, using various tools like Google Analytics, LinkedIn, Email Hunter, Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to uncover and determine the right contacts.
  • You will follow up with interested prospects via phone and email to qualify, nurture, and move them closer to launching fundraising campaigns with Bonfire
  • Performance reporting on effectiveness of campaigns with recommendations on how to improve
  • Manage your lead pipeline and ensuring our CRM has all of the appropriate data
  • Achieve daily goals - outbound outreach effort metrics, lead pass metrics, campaign launch metrics

Must Haves:

  • Highest level of integrity
  • Previous successful sales development experience OR a strong interest in a sales development/analytics career
  • Mastery level understanding of modern split testing techniques
  • Competitive with a highly self-driven sense of motivation
  • A keenly developed competitive nature
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Commitment to lifelong learning
  • The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced challenging environment
  • The desire to meet and exceed measurable performance goals
  • Naturally curious and passionate
  • The technical aptitude to master our sales development tools
  • A fanatical attention to detail

Youâre in good company (with a good company). We offer:

  • Competitive compensation with excellent insurance benefits
  • Macbook Pro + Monitor + Apple Keyboard
  • Unlimited paid vacation
  • An amazing workplace culture
  • An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies and tools, and to challenge yourself (and have a lot of fun)
  • The chance to make a real impact in the companyâs growth and history
  • An opportunity to help make a difference in thousands of peopleâs lives

More about Bonfire:
Bonfire is a team of passionate people working to make a difference by building strong creative communities to enable brands, causes, and individuals to raise awareness and grow their business. We have a shared focused on our mission to strengthen and inspire communities. Through art, technology, authenticity and human connection, we obsess over delivering the best way to sell custom apparel on the planet. We are committed to making great products, creating incredible e-commerce experiences, and having fun in the process. Be a part of Bonfire!

To apply: Send an email to jobs@bonfire.com

item.title: Holacracy-Powered BrickFTP Seeks Senior Front End Developer To Take Responsibility For Our Web App Frontends And Other Roles. (React.Js primarily, classic Ruby on Rails experience a plus)
item.description:
Hi there.  We're Action Verb and we build Infrastructure-as-a-Service products.  We've been around for almost 10 years, operate profitably, and will probably make the Inc 5000 list this year.

We offer two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated CMS system.  Our IaaS services have over 1,800 paying business customers.

We're small, happy, and we avoid the Silicon Valley startup culture that encourages growth over sustainability.  We treat each full time team member like family.  We have 9 full time staff now (plus 3 part time) and we're looking to add a full time front end engineer to our team.

As a company, we are one of the early adopters of Holacracy, a new style of running an organization in a self-organizing manner that draws inspiration from agile software development and lean manufacturing processes.  

Rather than hiring people for exactly one job description, we instead look to find well rounded team members with skills in software engineering, design, marketing, sales, and our other needs who are interested in filling multiple roles within the organization.

As a self-organizing team, our people have multiple roles and our role descriptions are regularly updated via small iterations.  The roles you take on are intended to change over time as your interests change and our needs change.

âMost startups believe in iteration of their products. Now they need to apply the same thinking to their organizations.â  
â Adam Pisoni, Yammer co-founder & CTO

At Action Verb, you don't have a boss.  Your work is executed autonomously, without micromanagement.

But Holacracy is not unstructured: you'll have a clear understanding of your current roles and responsibilities, as well as a set of rules and processes for changing those roles and responsibilities in real time.

Our team members work from home and choose their own hours, allowing them to make time for family, recreation, vacations, or anything that is important to them.

Our team members also work hard, are constantly learning, and accomplish a ton for the company in the time that they are working.  That's why we consistently pay above-market rates for talent and are generous with raises and bonuses.

We believe that building great products requires great infrastructure.  We have Continuous Integration, a full staging environment, and almost 100% test coverage.  We built our own application deployment system.  We self-manage our server stack on Amazon EC2 and custom hardware.

We believe in using the right tool for the job.  Our core applications are built in Ruby, JavaScript, Java, C++, and PHP.  We use Rails, React, Chef, Qt, Jenkins, Github, Honeybadger, CircleCI, Maven, AWS, MySQL, Redis, Memcached, Haml, Sass, and many other exciting open source systems.

We run Linux (Ubuntu) on our servers, but we support Linux and MacOS as development environments.

We believe that the best engineers tend to be polyglots with lots of experience.  Weâre looking for someone who can bring the following things to the table:

  • Solid web development frontend skills in Javascript, HTML, and CSS, including ES5, JSX, Sass, and React.js.
  • Experience building and delivering React.js applications that have seen actual production usage.
  • Familiarity with building classic Ruby on Rails UIs (server-side rendered views) is a strong plus.
  • A sense of good UX principles (though you will not necessarily be expected to design.  We have an amazing designer on staff.)
  • Firm understanding of how to write secure frontend code and an awareness of common web application security vulnerabilities.
  • Testing and the ability to write unit tests/specs (we use React testing frameworks)
  • Ability to prioritize and make decisions without needing to be micromanaged
  • History developing actual SaaS applications that have seen production usage with real customers.
  • Truly interested in giving our customers a great experience and able to communicate directly with customers and prospects

We believe that open-source only works if companies give back.  If you work on any open-source projects during the course of your work at Action Verb, you are encouraged to submit your improvements as a pull request back to the upstream project.  And if you build something from scratch while working here thatâs generic and not related to our core products, we want you to release that on GitHub too.  Weâll also pay your travel costs to any conference where you can get a speaking gig.

We believe that our products will never be finished.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience.  We constantly reach out to our customers to learn about new ways that we can help them get their job done.

Tell us about what you believe.  Please use the form on this page to send in your application now.  We only read cover letters in our first screening round, so make sure yours counts.  Specifically, we'd like you to address the following topics:

  • What is your level of experience with Holacracy?  Had you heard about it prior to this posting?  Do you have any questions about it?
  • What is your level of experience with a remote team?
  • What would be your ideal focus areas and roles within the company?  (Please understand that our current needs require a frontend engineer with React experience, but we have over 50 named roles that you can also devote some time to, everything from planning our in-person meetings to overseeing Customer Security.)

To apply: Applications are only accepted at the following link:http://actionverb.applytojob.com/apply/IwjSeIR7FO/HolacracyPowered-BrickFTP-Seeks-Senior-Front-End-Developer-To-Take-Responsibility-For-Our-Web-App-Frontends-And-Other-Roles-ReactJs-Primarily-Classic-Ruby-On-Rails-Experience-A-Plus

item.title: PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, jQuery, SASS, Gulp, Git
item.description:
Looking for a mid-level web developer to work, remotely from home, with our development team on front-end web development for many of our eCommerce web stores, landing pages, and blogs. If hired, you'd work with the design and development team to develop web stores for eCommerce clients.

Development responsibilities would include:

  • slicing/converting PSDs into HTML and CSS
  • skinning websites built into either common ecommerce and content platforms (Magento, osCommerce, Volusion, Shopify, LightSpeed, SEOShp, Wordpress, etc.) or into our proprietary eCommerce/content management system.
  • build custom front end functionality into these web stores when required
  • test and review your work (Self QA)
  • communicate with clients to make sure the what you're implementing meets their expectations
  • identify when a clients request is outside the bounds of the original project scope

You'll be responsible for the front-end development and maintenance of our web properties. The ideal candidate for this position will have experience developing websites in one or more ecommerce platforms and one or more content management systems. Quick learner, ability to communicate with the less-than computer literate and a love of all things web. We'd like to hear from you if you believe you fit this description, and you meet the all requirements.

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience working in HTML, CSS, PHP, jQuery and MySQL
  • Experience with SCSS
  • Experience working in Git
  • Familiar with NPM and Gulp (for preprocessing)
  • Familiarity with Photoshop
  • Ability to communicate effectively with others, including non-programmers
  • Self starter, organized and good with multi-tasking when necessary
  • An understanding of best SEO practices
  • Access to high-speed internet and a private space to work from (remotely)
  • Must be located in North America (US or Canada, CA preferred) and be fluent in English

If you have a portfolio of previous jobs you've worked on, please provide a link. If you only worked on a portion of a project, please identify specifically what you did. Please provide one (1) personal reference and two (2) professional references. Please only contact us if you're prepared to complete two skills tests, which can take anywhere from 1 to 3 hours, depending on your skill level/knowledge. Also include your desired hourly rate.

Job Type: Contract

Required experience:

working in HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL: 5 years

Required language:

English

To apply: Send resume, portfolio, desired hourly rate and your location (country) to programming@advision-ecommerce.com

item.title: Full Stack Developer in Esports Startup
item.description: Full Job Description Available Here:https://jobs.alongside.com/details/full-stack-developer-in-esports-startup/19264?utm_source=remoteokThe esports space is booming, and we're in the middle of it, working with some of the largest teams in the world to help them create better rosters, and work more efficiently with their sponsors. Also, we're funded by some of the largest VCs in the world, and others that are the largest in Canada. We build SaaS apps, and you'll be leading the development of one of our offerings. You'll have a complete static mockup along with front end assets, including a UI/UX team to help you make changes on the fly. This means we don't need you to worry about design & UI/UX. You'll have a very experienced DevOps team to help you with deployment. You'll also work with a product manager who can help you translate mockup into functioning code.You'll build a tool that interfaces with some of the world's largest social networks. You'll be consuming many social APIs (including our own!), and use the resulting content to make the lives of esports teams better.Our team is remote and experienced. We need you to be OK with the first attribute, and come loaded with the second. We love to play PC games during (solo) and outside of (group) working hours. Finally, you will not be micro managed. If you need that level of management, you're not the right fit.Responsibilities:Build and maintain a SaaS product used by the largest esports teams in the world.Work with product management team to refine the product spec, and translate those specs into actual code.Work with the UI/UX lead to translate static mockup into working front end code.Implement custom analytics to help you understand how user cohorts are using the product you've developed, and then optimize for user experience accordingly.Qualifications:2+ years of experience working in tech startups. 3+ years of experience as a developer. The roller coaster is something you're comfortable with.Able to build a SaaS app from the ground up with minimal supervision using a modern web framework (Django, Express, etc.)Hands-on experience in web services (REST, OAuth etc.), API Development, and gateways/proxies.Intermediate knowledge and experience with MySQLStrong knowledge of client-side JS frameworks (Vue.js, React) and front-end tooling (Webpack, Gulp)Skills:- Frameworks- APIs- esports- MySQL- JavaScriptAdditional Information:Work with people who have done this before, including world class VCs.A competitive startup salaryStock options - a part of this company can be yoursIf you apply for the job, mention any Twitch emotes somewhere in your application so we know you actually read this. If you don't, we'll just throw your app away (kappa).
