You should be well versed in current product innovations, messaging apps, social media, UI/UX, design, rapid prototyping and release, user adoption, and user testing, and be able to navigate or do a cost/benefits analysis of various technical solutions, coding languages, devops, and architecture-based decisions.

You will help conceptualize, develop, build and/or manage our tech product strategy, taking our goal-oriented tech strategy through each phase of development with a team. You will oversee product development with the goal of meeting campaign metrics of reach, efficacy, and fundraising, which will include the assessment, research, development of specifications, directing design, and implementation of product plans.

You should be able to think on your feet, be organized, optimize project plans and work load, manage/delegate the different pieces of projects and user growth. You should have smart, powerful ideas to share to reach product goals. You ideally understand online organizing and user growth strategies and can bring that into your work defining the product as well as gaining users in the real world. Weâd especially enjoy someone who has a wide interest in pulling off technological tactics and strategy and using whatever resources are at their disposal.


IF YOU ARE A PRODUCT DIRECTOR + CODER:

You should be an agile programmer / hacker that can make things work and work well for millions of users at the same time while also being able to make smaller apps that work quickly and smoothly. If you can understand the scope of a problem and devise solid tech solutions on your own, youâre the person we want to talk to.

You donât need to be an expert designer or have illustration skills. If you can both faithfully implement othersâ designs and make good decisions about layout, typography, and color when needed, thatâs what weâre looking for. Itâs also important that you can build high quality user interaction with intuitive prompts, clear buttons, etc, spotting and fixing UI problems as you go. Weâre looking for somebody who can bottom-line the creation of mobile platform, but who is also always using their full brain, putting themselves in a user or a readerâs shoes.

Youâll be building things like:
  • Tools and apps that get used over and over by our organization and others.
  • Internet wide infrastructure for large, decentralized actions across a coalition of websites
  • Solutions that achieve our goals by leveraging and customizing existing services (CRM, publishing tools, etc).
  • Flawless HTML/CSS and clear, modern design that supports the message.

Requirements:
  • Experience building applications with a modern web framework like Django, Rails, or Node.js
  • Client-side javascript skills
  • Ability to develop iOS / Android applications (learning as you go is okay)
  • Experience managing large databases
  • Experience in HTML/CSS with awareness of common cross-browser problems
  • Proven ability to do clean and classy design
  • Ability to make good UI/UX decisions and spot problems


THINGS THAT YOU MIGHT LIKE ABOUT THIS JOB:
  • Itâs telecommute work with a 100% remote team
  • The work will be highly varied, like freelancing on a variety of projects
  • You can choose the framework and tools we use to get stuff done.
  • We can give you a contractor budget to reduce/eliminate mundane work. Responsibility for the final result is what matters.
  • Be a hero to many. The âyeah, I made thatâ small talk in bars is fun.


BONUS POINTS FOR:
  • Having conceived and launched your own product
  • Ability to build and manage teams
  • Strong participation in communities like Reddit or HN
  • Lots of remote / freelance experience solving problems on tight deadlines

MEGA BONUS POINTS FOR:
  • Having started a successful open source project
  • Having been a leaderâof anythingâespecially online, especially tech-related
  • Understanding and being able to hack on projects that push the limits of user freedom such as: TOR, Bitcoin, Bittorrent, GPG, OTR messaging, academic P2P work, etc.

To apply: To apply for this position, please fill out our form here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd2SYlDGFnDblUmqBh6qpyVnaSH-6F80B8DroMEUkFU3fuDtg/viewform

item.title: PHP Drupal Developer For Legacy Ecommerce Site
item.description:
We are looking for a PHP developer to help support a legacy Drupal 5/Ubercart eCommerce site as well as be a part of the next generation website to be worked on this year. We currently utilize a fairly standard LEMP stack and need help supporting custom applications that include both admin and customer facing tools and modules. 


Types of projects you'll work on include integration modules with our proprietary eCommerce data back-end API, financial reports and integrations, custom decoration service quoting, and more. 


For our remote workers we prefer to get a time estimate ahead of time- but we know with a project like this to be flexible, especially as you get up to speed. 


Good candidates for this position will be self motivated, easily taught, have a solid understanding of Drupal and not be afraid to get their hands dirty with things like CURL/Guzzle, new APIs, etc.

item.title: Senior Mobile Software Engineer
item.description:
As a Senior Mobile Software Engineer at Fleetio, youâll build incredible mobile apps that help our customers and users be successful in their jobs. This is a demanding but rewarding role that requires a broad engineering skill set.

Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage a fleet. Transportation technology is a hot market and weâre leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day.

Your job is to build the tools our users need to manage fleet operations using their smartphones and tablets.

We currently use the Ionic framework to build and deploy multiple iOS and Android apps, such as Fleetio Go and Fleetio Parts. Our full platform stack includes Ruby/Rails, AngularJS, Bootstrap, Postgres and more, hosted on Heroku. Our mobile apps consume our public API.

We're hardcore believers in easy-to-use software. Crafting a delightful user experience is hard work, but we welcome the challenge and are looking for team members who share our ambition.

Mobile is big part of our strategy and this is a position we consider essential to the companyâs success. Bonus points for mentioning coffee in your application so we know you actually read this.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Build software used by users all around the world. So many different types of companies and organizations operate a fleet each day, and Fleetio is a good fit for most of them (itâs a huge market).
  • Be a part of an incredible team of âAâ players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. Weâre a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers.
  • Work from our HQ in Birmingham, AL or wherever youâd like as a part of our strong remote working culture.

To apply: https://fleetio.workable.com/jobs/425168

item.title: Front End Data Visualization Developer
item.description:
This is a part-time role to start although continued demonstration of required skills and on-time deliveries may lead to a full-time offer (part time is approx 20 hours per week of effort although this is negotiable). Initially, we will start by issuing small discrete work packages which can be done in isolation and then later integrated into a larger solution. These tasks will require experience making REST'ful calls for graphs of data, storage in the client, and fairly nuanced/fluid visualization of data to allow users to interact with. Final deliveries will require integration into a React framework but other supporting technology choices may be open for discussion. These projects will also require knowledge of formula's relating to lending, money management, interest calculations, etc... (Ex. calculate loan interest, APRs, etc...) This will also include calculation of amortization schedules, and similar methods to visualize financial relationships for customers. Candidates will also work with our graphic designers to determine appropriate layouts and points of interactivity for target users.


We fully embrace professionals who prefer (or require) to work remotely and are looking for mature candidates that can self-manage and deliver reliably. With this arrangement comes lots of flexibility in day-to-day schedules allowing our team members to maintain a work-life balance that suites their individual needs. While some core operating hours are required to facilitate online SCRUMs, etc… individuals will be able to manage most of their schedule on their own. 


If you are a student, stay-at-home parent, someone caring for your parents, disabled, or someone else needing flexible time, this could work out well for you.

item.title: Architect
item.description: This is a hands-on Architect position which will require gaining intimate knowledge of Phreesia’s users, customers and architecture and then building, documenting and maintaining products that connect Phreesia’s users to their patients and systems of record. Phreesia has developed a highly flexible and configurable platform for checking patients in at their doctor’s office. The Architect will work closely with Product Management and Operations staff and will supervise other Engineering staff to ensure that the products being built drive customer usage, are easily supportable by Customer teams, accurate, highly available, scalable and easily deployable.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer
item.description:
If you want to work remotely as a full-time developer for an innovative, leading company in an emerging market, you've found the right team! As a core member of our engineering team, you’ll solve complex technical problems in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with experienced leaders and a clear roadmap.


Responsibilities:



  • Take ownership of our platform including the architecture, design and technical direction.

  • Identify constraints and assess the feasibility of the features.

  • Evaluate risk, development complexity, limitations and impact.

  • Collaborate with management to interpret and translate requirements into technical features and documentation.

  • Adhere to industry standard best practices and guidelines while defining our own.

  • Provide regular technical and non-technical communication regarding the status of the project including all components.

item.title: Full-Stack Programmer
item.description:
Pirate Studios is a rapidly expanding music rehearsal studio company, currently based in 8 cities in the UK. We're planning on at least doubling that in the next year. A big part of our business is our online booking system, however we're also working to integrate technology into lots more aspects of the business, such as automatic power on/off, light controls, video/audio streaming etc.

We're looking for an enthusiastic programmer who is willing to learn new things, throw around ideas, and work as part of our small development team on various projects. Our current web stack is built in Ruby (Rails, Postgres, Redis), but knowing Ruby isn't a hard requirement; anyone willing to learn new languages is welcome. We are working on rebuilding our main application into separate API and client components to allow us to build for new platforms more easily, such as mobile applications and integrated components inside our studios.

We work remotely, although we do have an office in London and a workshop in Bristol if you're in those areas. We sometimes do R&D and testing on-site in the studios, and we work alongside a large team of people who design and build the studios. We also meet up every few weeks for a day at either the workshop or elsewhere to chat and plan stuff out. As we do meet up semi-regularly, this position is (most likely) based in the UK.

We have loads of projects lined up for you to get stuck into. We're working on moving from our monolithic Rails app to separate API and client applications so that we can branch out into other platforms, as well as working on internal systems and IoT devices that are used in our studios.

You should be/have:
  • Experienced in at least a couple of different programming languages
  • Good communication and personal skills
  • Enthusiastic about security, optimisation, performance, and solid code
  • Comfortable working with other people via code reviews, on Slack, and on voice chat (occasionally)
  • Excited about working with physical devices
  • Self-motivation when working remotely
  • Happy to meet up every now and then

Useful to have but not required:
  • Ruby and JavaScript experience
  • Varied database experience (we currently use PostgreSQL and Redis, with an experiment using RethinkDB for one project)
  • Linux systems administration
  • Networking experience (for our R&D work we sometimes install kit ourselves)
  • Creativity is encouraged; we love sharing ideas for solutions
  • Experience in some form of project-management system, such as Agile or Scrum
  • As a music startup we obviously have a lot of staff who are excited about music, performance, or production. It's not a requirement but if that's your sorta thing then our project may be more exciting for you!

Benefits
  • Salary between Â£28,000-Â£35,000 depending on experience
  • 22 days of holiday leave (not including public holidays)
  • Company laptop if needed

To apply: Send us your details and any questions to systems@piratestudios.co.uk. Give us an outline of who you are, what you do, what you enjoy, and any examples of your work or open-source projects you have/contribute to.We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Expert JavaScript, NodeJS, and React Nomad
item.description:
Pathable, Inc. is hiring expert JavaScript developers to join our nomadic team of software craftspeople. We're building from the ground up the second version of our industry leading mobile/web application in Meteor and React. Live and work from anywhere, while learning new things, working on a product thousands of people love to use every day. Our company is successful, self-funded, profitable, twenty people strong, and growing. We've developed a fantastic culture that embraces adventure in business, engineering and lifestyle. Please join us!

Specific Responsibilities:

  • You're an expert with deep programming experience using a variety of tools and languages.
  • You'll write beautiful, well tested JavaScript both in the browser and on the server.
  • You'll use your intimate knowledge of React, NodeJS and related technology to develop our second generation Meteor based web and mobile application.
  • You'll dive into Apollo as part of our continuous commitment to paying down technical debt.
  • You, being a polyglot, will occasionally dive into our Ruby/Rails application to develop features and bug fixes.
  • You'll deploy code weekly, sometimes daily, to our AWS and Galaxy clusters. 
  • In addition to clear and frequent written communication, you'll video conference daily with team members to design and refine new features for the product, marketing websites, email campaigns and more.
  • You have strong opinions loosely held; you enjoy vigorously defending what you know to be right as much as you enjoy being wrong when the best answers wins.
  • You enjoy the challenge of accurately estimating your work and ensuring its on-time completion. You're loath to have your co-workers discover bugs you've missed.
  • You thrive in a remove working environment where you define completely your own setup and interact with exclusively via computer; you go wherever you want.

About Us:

  • Pathable (http://pathable.com) is the leading provider of mobile event apps and online community platforms for conferences, tradeshows, events, and associations. From 10,000 doctors at a convention center to 200 community organizers meeting for a weekend, our software improves the entire experience of attending in-person conferences and events. 
  • Though we develop products delivered over the Internet, as a nearly 10 year-old profitable company, we're not quite a startup anymore. We're fortunate to have room to innovate and experiment as we develop new products and services.
  • Managed and majority owned by the original founders, we've got the freedom to chart our own course -- our only influence is what's best for our customers. 
  • From the beginning our culture has supported and embraced remote workers. We don't have an office and the Pathable family lives or is traveling in over 10 countries. Our members enjoy more time with their children, living in remote and unusual places, or exploring the world; all while growing professionally and building things about which they are proud.
  • We're building a new product, from the ground up, using the latest tools, integrated everything we've learned from nearly 10 years of product development to the same market. 

Benefits:

  • Accrued paid vacation
  • Paid holidays
  • Full medical+dental benefits for US workers
  • Medical insurance stipend for non-US workers
  • Yearly self improvement stipend
  • Monthly stipend for co-working space

To apply: Please visit https://www.jsco.re/ogks and be sure to enter the URL of your personal site or resume in the field marked XKCDTHX1138.

item.title: Ruby On Rails Ninjaneer
item.description: AgilityFeat is looking to hire an exceptional to be software developer on our team person. Full time. Telecommuting. 're looking for someone who values diversity in its challenges daily and someone who is comfortable programming and talking to others about your code. We are looking for someone bright with a proven track record in developing software high quality , easy to use: beautiful applications.

item.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer
item.description: You are a self starter who has a passion for finding bugs. By using your unique perspective as QA Engineer you break the code to forge a better product. At Modus Create you will collaborate daily on a cross functional, distributed SCRUM team to build better products. We pride ourselves on not just being excellent, but an excellent remote workforce.__Your Duties In This Role__ - You will act as senior QA Automation Engineer on a team building Sencha ExtJS app for the insurance industry. You will discover bugs and vulnerabilities and decide how to fix them You will collaborate daily representing QA on a SCRUM team. This is a full-time contract, remote role.__For this role, You Must Have:__* Previous experience testing Sencha ExtJS apps * Experience with Sencha Test or Siesta Framework* Current experience with JavaScript* Have Linux Shell Scripting knowledge* Clear written communication skills in order to document concise bug reports and test cases* Experience testing in a SCRUM environment* A good understanding of cross browser testing, typical vulnerabilities* A consistent, reliable internet connection__Not required, but priority will be given to candidates who:__* Have experience with CI tools such as Jenkins* Have MySQL experience* Have prior experience setting up and installing VMs__Discover what is possible with Modus Create:__* GitHub repos for your projects* A chance to get your personal projects sponsored* Connect with your colleagues* Assisted continuous self-development

item.title: Lead Web App Developer Tropical Agriculture Start Up
item.description:
We are looking for a talented web app developer to help us deliver scalable solutions to some of agriculture's biggest problems.


By working with us you will start by applying your skill set to the complex world of Tropical Agriculture, creating a web app to visualise environmental data to help coffee farmers battle Climate Change.


You will be working within a multi-disciplinary team and directly communicate with your users. If you choose to continue with us you will also be encouraged to join us (all expense paid) during our work abroad with our users in the fields of Central America, Africa and Asia. 


The position would be initially for a contract with set deliverables, giving both parties an opportunity to get to know each other. However, we are also looking to employ on a longer term basis and, if desired, would look to extend into a longer term salaried position. 


We are flexible to both full-time and part-time applicants and happy for remote working (with regular communication), but we would prefer to work with you in person.

item.title: Junior Product Manager
item.description:
About LaterPay

With LaterPay, we want to change the way people buy and sell digital content on the Internet. Why? Because we believe paying for digital content should be fast, convenient, and fair. And because we think you should be able to buy the exact piece of content you want.

We want to create a great software product which influences and changes the way people use paid content of any kind on the Internet. The usage of paid content should be as easy and convenient as going out to dinner: you are served first and pay later. We want to build a user-centric product, which makes it easy for users to buy and easy for merchants to sell. It should represent the simplest, most secure way to buy digital goods. We want to change the way people regard paid content, turning it into a great experience. We want to enable businesses to offer âpaid content as a serviceâ, convincing users of their contentâs value instead of forcing them to pay before actually getting the content.

How we work

As a distributed team, weâre not too bothered by when and where you work. That said, most of us work Monday - Friday from 9ish UTC to 6ish UTC, and ideally youâd overlap heavily with that. Our current PM team is located in UTC+1 and prefers the new Jr PM to be in the same time zone.

We try to be as asynchronous as possible, but still feel that we need some âsynchronicityâ to work well. We care more about what you do and how you work with the rest of the team, than we do about your ability to be at a chair at a desk at 9am every day. So if you have hobbies, family, pets etc. that require you to take time out of your day? Assuming you can maintain a reasonable amount of overlap with the rest of the team, it shouldnât be a problem.

What weâre looking for

To support our product management team, we are looking for a Junior Product Manager.
As part of the product management team within LaterPay, you will act as the interface between the market and tech team and will be supporting the team to deliver the right product and features to the market. You will make sure that the product is easy and intuitive to use, and provides a consistent and appealing user experience.

Good command of written English

This is probably the most important quality. Communication is vital, especially as a distributed team, where most tools we use donât communicate tone or body language.
Additionally, if you happen to speak German that is great, but itâs not mandatory.

Experience and drive

You donât need to be a Senior X or Chief Y, but you do need to be capable of taking a task and owning it.
That doesnât mean you necessarily do all the work, but it does mean you take on responsibility for completion, and ask for help and advice as appropriate.

Specifics

You will identify market needs based on: analytics data, market research, customer support evaluations, user testing, internal and external feature requests, legal requirements.

You will support the Product Management team to: evaluate and prioritize feature requests,, specify features in our ticketing system, provide mockups/wireframes, prepare and conduct user testings, evaluate analytics data, document product decisions.

Experience with MacOS, Microsoft Office or Apple productivity tools (Keynote, Numbers) are required. Experience with the Adobe Creative Suite, especially Adobe Illustrator, Jira, and GitHub is an advantage.

Apply

If this sounds interesting, but youâre not sure youâre quite the right fit, apply, and let us know what you bring to the table. Weâre not just looking for âBusiness administration degree and X years of experience with Yâ.

To apply: https://laterpay.workable.com/jobs/368119

item.title: ReactJS Developer
item.description:
GetTechTalent is a new and fast growing network of Europeâs best freelance developers, designer and product managers. We empower our clients to build outstanding digital products with remote freelance teams. By joining our network, youâll work on eye-level with top-notch peers on exciting projects for clients ranging from renown start-ups to Fortune 500 companies. 

Your opportunity
We are currently looking for React.js Developers (Freelance) who loves to create high-quality web applications with beautiful, well-designed UIs. Your core responsibility will be the implementation of web front-ends. Our ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at âgetting things doneâ. You will work with both front-end and back-end developers and play an active role how the entire application looks and functions.

Your responsibilities
- Develop new, user-facing features using React.js
- Build reusable components and front-end libraries
- Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code
- Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
- Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
- Challenge established thinking and 

Skills
- Strong proficiency in JavaScript (including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model), HTML5, (S)CSS3
- Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
- Knowledge of nodeJS, serverless and AWS infrastructure are a plus
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs, AJAX, JSON Web Token, etc.
- Proficient knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues.
- A knack for benchmarking and optimization
- Proficient understanding of tools like Git, Grunt, Gulp, etc.
- Excellent communication skills
- Fluency in English (spoken and written), German skills are a plus

Your benefits:
- Flexibility: Choose your own schedule from a variety part-time, and full-time projects.
- Remote work: Pick your favorite work placeâno matter if you like to work from an exotic location or from homeâthe choice is yours. 
- Long-term commitment: get into a topic and work on projects that last minimum one month
- Interesting projects: work on interesting projects from renown startups to international enterprises, primarily in Germany/Western Europe
- Shared values: work with experienced peers that are as dedicated reliable and quality-oriented as you are

To apply: Please apply here: https://techtal.typeform.com/to/AmmUrZ

item.title: Full stack developer
item.description:
Youâre a product-obsessed software engineer. You can work in all layers of the stack. Youâve worked on a number of fully-formed software products that have been released into the wild. Youâll be working with the entire team in creating new customer-facing features, from idea, through prototype, to release and maintenance.

About us

At Happiness Works we're passionate about creating a better world of work. We believe if more people genuinely enjoyed their work then everyone would benefit, including employees, customers and shareholders. 

Founded by Nic Marks, a world expert in well-being measurement and TED speaker, weâre taking over ten years experience of applied research and turning it into products to help make better workplaces.

About the job

  • Youâll be joining a friendly high performing team who are passionate about what they do.
  • Youâll be working closely with the CTO building our innovative online and mobile applications.
  • Youâll get to work with the latest methodologies and tools.
  • Youâll have the opportunity to help develop our product roadmap and shape the company strategy.
  • Youâll be able to make a direct impact on the world, making peopleâs working lives better.

About you

  • You need to be self-motivated and enthusiastic about both technology and social science.
  • You should be experienced with Ruby on Rails (our backend runs on Rails with PostgreSQL and Redis on AWS).
  • You should have a good understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript (we use Coffeescript, SASS, and HAML).
  • Strong JavaScript fundamentals, solid understanding of the JavaScript type system, prototypes, scopes, ES6
  • You should have experience of writing unit tests and test driven development (we write automated tests for all our code).
  • You should understand SQL database design and know how to write and optimise queries.
  • You should have experience of Linux server administration.
  • You should have an appreciation of good design and high attention to detail.

Ideally you will have one or more ofâ¦

  • Experience of building Single Page Applications with REST services using React or similar frameworks.
  • Experience building mobile apps for either iOS or Android.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS.

What we offer

  • Salary 50k-60k.
  • 30 daysâ holiday a year.
  • Flexible working hours and locations.
  • Choose your equipment

No recruiters please.

To apply: Please apply at: http://jobs.happinessworks.com/full-stack-developer/

item.title: FullStack WordPress Developer
item.description: You* love working on all sides of web development, whether it is making WordPress do what you want by coding your own plugins, styling beautiful websites, making websites blazingly fast, or improving peoples lives by moving their databases from crummy CMSs into the light. * get excited by new tech; PHP7 is here to stay, but you know when to use it.* know your way around a unix command line* are comfortable working with GIT, and maybe the odd pull-request* want to joint a team spread over the entire world, although hopefully your are within Â±6h of Central European Time.* can communicate efficiently using Slack and track your own projects using JIRA* are happy to break down your problems into smaller tasks and keep track of your time using harvest

item.title: Front End Rails Developer
item.description:
Front-End Rails Developer - Dekeo

Are you driven to build problem-solving applications? Do you get energized by collaborating -- and learning alongside -- super-talented team members? Are you passionate and pragmatic about the craft of writing code?

We seek an insanely curious and resourceful Front End Software Engineer to join our growing Engineering team. This team delivers the core functionality for our leading design eCommerce site. Over a million customers interact with our technology, and we're committed to making each of those interactions a seamless Experience.

Who We Are:

Dekeo is a new business line being spun out of a fast-growing, profitable company. Dekeo is creating a global ecommerce marketplace for creative promotional products (putting company or team logos on t-shirts, water bottles, and stickers).  While the company is still very much at a growth stage â there's a huge number of technical challenges still to solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to be built.

Responsibilities:

  • Write clean, maintainable and efficient code
  • Build and maintain critical features and functionality
  • Design robust, scalable and secure features
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle
  • Coordinate with Product Managers and UX Designers
  • Work closely with other teams and disciplines to come up with simple, elegant solutions that balances everyoneâs needs
  • The ability to work well with others in pursuit of a collective and common goal
  • Willing to set up others for success AND personally step up to achieve results

Your primary focus is to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. You will work with the UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it works.

Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring great user experience.

Requirements:

  • BS in computer science and 2+ years of work experience
  • Advanced understanding of front-end technologies HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
  • Good understanding of server-side templating languages (such as ERB)
  • Good understanding of server-side CSS preprocessors (such as SCSS, based on project requirements)
  • Experience with Bootstrap
  • Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (e.g. Git)
  • Experience with agile story tool such as Jira
  • Commitment to test driven development and demonstrated examples of how you've incorporated it into recent projects.
  • Love to see open source work contributions.

Job Location:

This position is remote but you will also have to option for those that want to come into an office and work with other developers in the Playa Vista area. 

To apply: Please send your resume with a cover letter mentioning "We Work Remotely" to 3A8787D361@jobs.workablemail.com

item.title: Back end Engineer
item.description:
ManageFlitter http://manageflitter.com is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

We have huge plans for the next couple of years and some exciting new projects are close to fruition - including our new product http://ManageSocial.com .

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney and with customer support based in the United States.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team.

Whilst this role is remote you will need at least 4-5 hours per day time crossover with the Sydney Australia timezone.


Benefits


Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

item.title: Cloud Operations Production Operations Engineer
item.description:
Position Summary


The Cloud Operations – Production Operations Engineer will be responsible for supporting highly reliable, high performing and secure operations for n-tier SaaS applications, comprising both UI and data integration components and for provisioning and administering the R&D AWS environment. The person in this position will work closely with the Cloud Development team maintaining a “DevOps” culture. This position reports through R&D IT leadership, but will be a key contributor to Cloud Development and Product Support teams.

item.title: ASP.Net Developer Wanted Join Fun Growing Company
item.description:
Looking for a mid-level developer familiar with ASP.Net 4+ with MVC and Webforms to begin work on projects using a proprietary .Net e-commerce platform, as well as general .Net web development. Developer would be trained and mentored until comfortable with tasks. Platform interfaces with MS SQL databases, so working with SQL is essential, as well as Entity Framework and Linq to SQL.


Programmers meet once a week to share ideas, gotchas, expectactions, etc.


Programmer can expect to work on one to three projects at any given time. HTML and JS will be provided to them along with a functional and technical spec, a dedicated Project Manager and a senior developer for guidance. The programmer will generally lead the project from beginning to end

item.title: UX Designer
item.description:
At Modern Message our focus is on building great products that solve real-world problems for our customers. Our core product Community Rewards, an engagement platform for apartment residents, and our rapid growth will present you with a plethora of opportunities for achievement and growth.

We're looking for a talented user experience designer to help us maintain our software and direct the design of new features and product improvements. This person should have a real passion for usability, an eye for visual consistency, and a knack for reducing the complex to the bare essentials.

You will work closely with both business owners, product managers and engineers, and will need to understand their perspectives. We're a small team so the opportunity for you to take on a big role and have a huge impact is very real. Our culture is collaborative, focused and dynamic. If you are the best at what you do and our mission resonates with you, we'd love to have you join us.

You:
  • Have 5+ years' education and/or experience in design, user experience, HCI, psychology, front-end development or related field(s).
  • Have a deep understanding of your chosen design tools
  • Are flexible and embrace constraints as a necessary component of the design process
  • Are proficient with HTML and CSS.
Responsibilities:
  • Keep the interface beautiful and easy to use. Direct the visual appearance of all new features and enhancements on our software application
  • Initiate, suggest, and spearhead major UI refactorings for a more intuitive user-experience
  • Design elegant solutions to complex workflows. Design things that people will talk about
  • Be the user-advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing or expert review, and offering implementation suggestions from a user-centered perspective
  • Act as the "go to" with in-depth knowledge of user interface methodologies and standards. Use research-related services, theories and methods to support your recommendations
  • Take the initiative in providing input and feedback in both departmental discussions and on issues relating to other departments
  • Develop wireframes, behavioral specifications, and personas
  • Develop front-end UI components

Benefits: Competitive salary; health and retirement benefits; if you're in Dallas, we have a pretty stylish office downtown and are very particular about our coffee. We will get you whatever equipment you need.

Remote candidates in the US are welcome!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To apply: Complete this survey: https://www.cindexinc.com/c/A44AB9Then apply at https://gethired.com/job/ux-designer

item.title: Full-stack Ruby Developer
item.description:
Are you the type of developer that wants to be responsible for a product from end to end, and write code that solves actual customer problems? Do you want to work in a dynamic environment with a product that's already at scale?

At Modern Message our focus is on building great products that solve real-world problems for our customers. Everyone on the team is critical, so an ability to communicate effectively is vital.

Our core product (Community Rewards), and our rapid growth will present you with a plethora of opportunities for technical growth. You will be involved in the entire technology stack: Ruby on Rails, Postgres, Backbone, and more as our company continues to evolve. But more importantly, you'll have ownership of something even more rewarding--a product used by hundreds of thousands of users. 

Sound like a place you want to be? Have the right skill set to do it? Then help us take our software to the next level!

What you'll do:
  • Plan, build and test new features and integrations of our core product
  • Maintain, extend, and debug our existing framework and codebase
  • Collaborate with product designers, backend developers, and client reps
What we're looking for:
  • Experience with our current stack: Ruby on Rails 4.x, PostgreSQL, JavaScript
  • 2+ years work experience
  • Examples of recent work required (Github username is fine)
  • A strong sense of product ownership
  • Previous startup experience preferred but not required
  • Smarts, humility, and a willingness to both teach and learn.
Remote candidates in the US are welcome!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To apply: For consideration, all applicants must complete this survey: https://www.cindexinc.com/c/A44AB9 Then apply here: https://gethired.com/job/full-stack-ruby-developer

item.title: Software Developer
item.description:
PhishMe is seeking experienced Rails developers to join its expanding software engineering teams.

If adding features, extending capabilities, and delivering working and fully tested software excites you, then we want to speak with you! Weâre looking for enthusiastic people, not just coders.

The successful candidate will have professional work experience (internships or professional jobs held as a student are valid). This is a full-time position working for PhishMe, Inc.


Successful Applicants Must Be:

  • A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to completion
  • Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of both collocated and remote teams in a dynamic business environment
  • Comfortable working alone or paring with other developers
  • Able to communicate effectively
  • Eager to learn and apply new knowledge quickly
  • Willing to mentor team members kindly and constructively
  • Detail-oriented
  • Willing to work for eight hours per day where at least five overlap with 8am to 6pm EST
  • Available to work off-hours occasionally
  • Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events

Your Experience Should Demonstrate That You:

  • 3+ years in Software Development
  • Have solid production Rails experience (1-2 years minimum)
  • Are proficient with full-stack web development (HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript)
  • Can comfortably work outside the boundaries of Rails (SQL, basic system administration, etc.)
  • Can comfortably use advanced git features such as rebase, rebase -i, merge no-ff
  • Read and generally agree with the ideas in Sandi Metzâs POODR / 99 Bottles etc.,
  • Adhere to best practices
  • Can write code that is intentional and readable rather than magically obscure
  • Stay on top of current Ruby, Rails, and programming news
  • Are fluent in SQL
  • `echo Azj mjzi bksnkzftxwj ue fcj Ueur bksstey wuej | tr ekmgiphabvnydqlxwtfrsczjou novgypqzcjfdskublatxmhrewi`
  • Are comfortable with the RSpec test framework
  • Have worked in an Agile/Scrum environment

It Would Be Outstanding If You:

  • Have experience in more than one programming language
  • Have built or maintained a large SaaS application
  • Have attained a four-year degree
  • Have customer support experience (retail, help desk, consulting, etc.)
  • Have professional experience with server configuration and deploying Rails applications
  • Have experience with distributed programming using message queues
  • Have a bookmark to https://github.com/styleguide/ruby
  • Have experience with Amazon Web Services

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecommuting expense reimbursement
  • Peers who enjoy appropriate use of internet memes

Location

  • Leesburg, Virginia or Remote

The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied. Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at any time without notice.

PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legallyrecognized basis [protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

To apply: Follow the link below:https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/index.php?/job/apply&clientkey=A9D4A2503BE71F57EC607E67A7D96692&job=2670

item.title: Senior Software Developer, Intelligence
item.description:
PhishMe is seeking an experienced senior developer to join our PhishMe Intelligence team.

The successful candidate will have relevant experience working with a number of different technologies which support the growth of our Intelligence service. The ideal candidate will have excellent written and verbal communications skills and be a team player willing to adjust to the dynamic needs of a fast-paced company.


Skills

  • Experience and comfort developing large scale distributed applications using Java (core, concurrency, threading)
  • Knowledge and experience using Spring and dependency injection in general.
  • Knowledge and experience using JPA / Hibernate.
  • Knowledge and experience using relational database systems especially PostgreSQL and MySQL.
  • Knowledge and experience using ElasticSearch as a developer as well as designing indexes and search clusters for efficient search across massive data sets.
  • Ability to comfortably do full stack development from backend systems to user interfaces as necessary.
  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Works well with others, capable of working constructively with a group of people that have different skill sets and interests. Effective at communication.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative as a member of a dynamic and fast moving team.
Compensation

  • Competitive salary and stock options
  • 401k plan with company match
  • Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
  • Telecommuting expense reimbursement
  • Peers who enjoy appropriate use of internet memes
Location

  • Telecommute (United States only)

To apply: https://www.paycomonline.net/v4/ats/index.php?/job/apply&clientkey=A9D4A2503BE71F57EC607E67A7D96692&job=5789

item.title: Sales Representative
item.description:
This position is remote, you can work from anywhere in the US if you're available on East Coast hours.

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a non-traditional private tour company crafting museum experiences that encourage visitors to look at museums in new ways. We use the expansive collection of the museums we work in as our playground to create âun-highlightsâ tours that focus on hidden works and unexpected stories. Weâre a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients.

Founded in 2013 and having grown to over $2 million in sales in 2016, Weâve uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned cultural institutions and quirky locations in New York City and other major cities to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

Museum Hack has been featured by The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include private citizens, schools, industry groups, and large companies like Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and CitiBank.

JOB DUTIES

  • Communicate with prospective clients via inbound/outbound calls and email
  • Put together proposals and follow up as necessary
  • Manage pipeline with our CRM
  • Request invoices be sent to clients
  • Other duties as assigned

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • 1 year previous sales & customer service experience
  • You have a home office and prior experience working remotely
  • Available to work Eastern USA time zone + peek in on weekends
  • Must have nearly perfect written English skills and amazingly awesome spoken English skills
  • High quality work: You are an efficient individual who makes projects happen behind the scenes with a fine eye for details (in short: you get shit done)
  • Technically inclined, able to pick up new things quickly: we use a lot of web-based services (including, but not limited to: Google Docs, Gmail, Google Calendar, Slack, Xero, PandaDoc, Base CRM)
  • Flexibility quotient high: Things can and do change on a dime around here -- you gotta go with the flow, and be ready to kick it into high gear at a moment's notice
  • Be fun and exciting without using too many exclamation marks!!!!!!!!!
  • Authorized to work in the US

HOURS / PAY RATE

  • Flexibility to work as needed from 9am to 8pm Eastern Monday - Friday and on-call during the weekends (as-needed) from 9am to 6pm Eastern
  • 25-30 hours per week. Option to work up to 40 hrs / week with approval and during busy times.
  • $14 to $15 per hour, DOE + commission (commission plan based on sales, TBD)
  • Must be eligible to work in the US

MORE INFO

  • Many people on our team are remote and work from home
  • Most of our Sale Representatives stay with the company for years, and move up to do really exciting things with us.
  • Sales Reps occasionally receive performance-based rewards and incentives
  • Find out more about us by watching our CEO Nick's Tedx Talk.

To apply: Apply via our website: http://jobs.museumhack.com/apply/UURxeHwgpZ/Sales-Representative-Remote?source=WWR

item.title: Customer Service Representative
item.description:
This position is remote, you can work from anywhere in the US if you're available on East Coast hours.

ABOUT US

Museum Hack is a creative company that offers irreverent, renegade museum tours and cultural offsites to corporate and private clients. Founded in 2013 and having grown to over $2 million in sales in 2016, Museum Hack has uplifted the lives of tens of thousands of new museum guests. We work at renowned cultural institutions and quirky locations in New York City and other major cities to bring these innovative experiences to companies and groups.

Museum Hack has been featured by The Wall Street Journal, The Washington Post, PBS, TimeOut New York, Huffington Post, TEDx, and more. Beloved clients include private citizens, schools, industry groups, and large companies like Google, Lego, LinkedIn, and CitiBank.

JOB DESCRIPTION 

You'll be helping us message and respond to our customers via email and sometimes via telephone, as well as a variety of other tasks. You will be working on our help desk (Groove), Slack, Google Docs, Gmail, Google Calendar, and other web-based services.

JOB DUTIES

  • Use our help desk software to respond to clients via email (and sometimes phone) to answer questions regarding booking, invoices, etc.
  • Manage difficult situations / unhappy customers and escalate when necessary
  • Other customer service / admin duties as assigned
  • Use our software to send invoices to clients
  • Input and manage events in Google Calendar
  • Write content for our website as assigned

JOB REQUIREMENTS 

  • Previous customer service experience
  • You have a home office and prior experience working remotely 
  • Available to work Eastern USA time zone (must be available: 8am to 10am ET + peeking in on weekends)
  • Must have nearly perfect written English skills and amazingly awesome spoken English skills. Creative writing skills a plus!
  • Quick learner
  • High quality work: You are an efficient individual who makes projects happen behind the scenes with a fine eye for details (in short: you get shit done)
  • Technically inclined, able to pick up new things quickly: we use a lot of web-based services (including, but not limited to: Google Docs, Gmail, Google Calendar, Slack, Xero, PandaDoc, Base CRM)
  • Flexibility quotient high: Things can and do change on a dime around here -- you gotta go with the flow, and be ready to kick it into high gear at a moment's notice
  • Be fun and exciting without using too many exclamation marks!!!!!!!!!
  • Authorized to work in the US

HOURS / PAY

About 30 hours per week with the possibility of becoming full time -- you should be available to work a flexible amount of hours in the Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00), 8am to 6pm Monday to Friday with an hour or two per day on weekends (flexible time).

Must be available Monday to Friday from 8am to 10am ET.

$12 to $15 per hour, DOE

MORE INFO

  • Many people on our team are remote and work from home
  • Most of our Customer Service Representatives stay with the company for years, and move up to do really exciting things with us.
  • CSR occasionally receive performance-based rewards and incentives
  • Our company is GROWING! We are an innovative arts-based business in New York City. Find out more about us by watching our CEO Nick's Tedx Talk.

To apply: Apply on our website:http://jobs.museumhack.com/apply/OQE1IP2ac2/Customer-Service-Representative-Remote?source=WWR

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer Architect
item.description:
We’re looking for an entrepreneurial engineer to join Knock as an early employee. Your decisions will help shape the direction of our engineering organization for years to come. We’ll give you the responsibility and the support to help make the lives of millions of home buyers and sellers better.


We are looking for an experienced technology leader who can manage and work closely with growing team of engineers. We expect the person to lead the design effort, drive development, implement and maintain the next generation home selling platform. Your primary focus will be to ensure our solutions are scalable, secure, and perform well under duress. You will need to be ambitious, curious, creative, execution driven, with a can-do attitude. A person with start up mentality and willingness to learn and contribute.

item.title: Team Lead
item.description:
As an Engineering Team Lead at Toptal you will work with engineers, designers, product managers, our VP of Engineering, and CTO to develop and deliver the highest quality products into the market.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere; however, we do things like rent out hotels in Africa or mansions in Thailand, and you will certainly be invited to come work with us.

item.description:

item.title: Senior Erlang Developer
item.description:
Scrapinghub is looking for an Erlang software developer to join our Crawlera team.

Crawlera is a smart downloader designed specifically for web crawling and scraping. It allows crawler developers to crawl quickly and reliably by managing thousands of proxies internally. It is part of the Scrapinghub platform, the worldâs most comprehensive web crawling stack which powers crawls of over 4 billion pages a month.

Scrapinghub helps companies, ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to early stage startups, turn web content into useful data with a cloud-based web crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

Join us in making the world a better place for web crawler developers with our team of top talented engineers working remotely from more than 30 countries.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, maintain and support a high load distributed system.
  • Analyze our current and historical Crawlera usage to augment and enhance its routing and rotation logic.
  • Leverage the Scrapinghub platform to provide extended functionality, both to end users and for internal purposes.
  • Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues with distributed crawling at scale.
  • Liaison with other platform teams to provide Crawlera with the best possible integration to the growing Scrapinghub platform.

About you

  • 2+ years of production experience with Erlang.
  • Good communication in written English.
  • Strong knowledge of Linux/UNIX, HTTP and Networking.

Bonus points for:
  • Python Knowledge.
  • Familiarity with techniques and tools for crawling, extracting and processing data.
  • Knowledge of ELK, Graylog, Docker and Mesos.
  • Good spoken English.

To apply: https://jobs.lever.co/scrapinghub/1595d1f7-37b2-4840-82fb-297d96295972?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=weworkremotely

item.title: .NET Software Engineer
item.description:
Do you love building products that are simple, elegant and intuitive? Have you been looking for more freedom in your engineering role to truly build products from the ground up? At UPSafety, we aim to create software that makes people say 'wow!'. Our goal is to give users of all ages and technical backgrounds that same feeling - software so intuitive and robust that its use flows like a pen to paper. 


United Public Safety is a leading SaaS provider for parking and code-enforcement organizations.  As a Software Engineer at UP Safety, you will have the opportunity to become a key member of our fast-paced software development team. Your responsibilities will touch all aspects of the SDLC, and being part of a small and rapidly growing company, there will be ample room to make a real impact.


Our ideal candidate is a motivated self-starter who wishes to have more client and business involvement than a normal developer would, and who is ready to bring their passion for effective and efficient design to life.

item.title: Digital Campaigns Specialist
item.description:
Location: Open

Position Summary: Reporting to the Manager of Digital Campaigns and Email Marketing, The Digital Campaigns Specialist plays a key role in ensuring that digital fundraising and engagement campaigns launch completely and on time, run smoothly, and are effective. This role is crucial to our success in fundraising, new donor acquisition, email acquisition and stewardship.

The ideal candidate is a collaborative and confident project manager who can juggle multiple tasks at once, working with stakeholders across teams under tight deadlines. They are comfortable creating pages and forms within Luminate or another CMS using basic HTML/CSS and have a good eye for detail, including proofreading and testing. They are excited to learn new tools and technologies and proactively look for process improvements and new strategies to try. This person is energized about the mission to Save Them All and understands the role of digital in saving the lives of animals.

Responsibilities

  • Support digital fundraising and engagement campaigns through project management, creative development, launch and reporting back results
  • Manage campaign deliverables from start to finish, including creative asset request and collection, donation form creation, analytics setup, and reporting
  • Creation of basic digital assets including standard signup and donation forms, autoresponders, and basic pages in a CMS.
  • Coordinate email, social and other channel needs from stakeholders and lead review process
  • Support campaign implementation with database queries and source code setup, link building and basic QA/troubleshooting
  • Interpret data from multiple sources and create reporting to be used for decision making and driving better results
  • Work with stakeholders across the digital team and organization to coordinate campaign needs and set timelines and project plans.
  • Proactively improve processes to help digital fundraising program launch more campaigns faster and easier.
  • This position requires travel of up to two weeks per year via various forms of public transportation and accommodations on behalf of organization business.

Skills and Experience:

  • BA/BS degree
  • 3-5 years of experience in digital fundraising and digital marketing
  • Hands-on experience using an email service provider (ESP) and donation management system (Luminate preferred, but others include Blue State Digital, Salsa, NGP Van, etc).
  • Experience seeing projects through successfully from initial concept to completion.
  • Project management experience, including working with stakeholders across teams and setting and maintaining deadlines
  • Basic HTML/CSS coding and troubleshooting experience required
  • Experience using databases for query and reporting
  • Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting engagement and fundraising metrics from multiple sources
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work collaboratively, build positive relationships, and manage conflict constructively
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Self-starter with ability to operate at a hands-on detailed level, take the lead on complicated projects and anticipate strategies through to the end
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to anticipate needs, innovate, multi-task, lead and excel in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment with a positive attitude.
  • Ability to learn new technologies quickly

Physical Requirements:

  • Extended periods of time working on the computer

Thank you for your interest in pursuing a career at Best Friends Animal Society.  Best Friends Animal Society is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, or medical condition.


To apply: To apply, please visit our website at http://bestfriends.org/about-best-friends/careers

item.title: Data Software Engineer
item.description:
About BEN Energy

Our mission is to develop the Europeâs leading Energy Analytics Platform.Our main USP is the combination of data analytics and behavioral economics topredict and improve the way residential households are dealing with energy. Withoffices in Munich and Zurich, we provide cloud-based customer intelligence andcustomer engagement software for the utility market and their residentialcustomers. With a current team of 15 computer scientists, behavioralpsychologists, UX specialists, data scientists, marketing and sales specialistsand 35 clients, BEN Energy is quickly growing and strives towards becoming the#1 provider of customer intelligence software in Europeâs energy market. 

About thejob

  • Support development teams to expand our EnergyAnalytics and Engagement Platform
  • Assess the business and technical implications of keyapplication technology alternatives
  • Implement, test and maintain components of ourproducts
  • Participate in technical project sessions with productowners, project managers and clients
  • Ensure quality, stability and scalability of ourproducts and infrastructure
  • Design, implement and optimize data flows fromenterprise systems all the way to our Dashboards
  • Research and prototype new technologies

About you

  • Fluent in German and English
  • Degree in computer science and 3+ years of experiencein building advanced analytics software
  • Experience in  our analytics and application languages (R, sql, php)
  • Experience with our server, persistence andintegration technologies (Nginx, Apache, MySQL, Hadoop, REST, WSO2, Pentaho)
  • Experience with most of our infrastructure and DevOpstechnologies (Debian, Ansible, Sophos)
  • Bonus: Experience in our frontend technologies andproducts (Qlik Sense, Dojo, iOS, Android)
  • Excited about the mixture of coding, managinginfrastructure and working with data
  • Interested in energy, data analytics and behaviouraleconomics
  • Work most of the time in a timezone that is not to different to the Zurich one (CET)

Our offer

  • You are part of our mission to enable sustainableenergy consumption
  • You have flexible working hours and can work remotely
  •  You will receive a competitive salary

To apply: Send a resume to jobs@ben-energy.com

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
ManageFlitter â http://manageflitter.com â is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

We have huge plans for the next couple of years and some exciting new projects are close to fruition - including our new product http://ManageSocial.com. 

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney and with customer support based in the United States.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team.

Whilst this role is remote you will need at least 4-5 hours per day time crossover with the Sydney Australia timezone. 

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years commercial experience with Linux and Open Source Technologies
  • Experience building and configuring a LAMP stack
  • DevOps experience and can architect solutions that scale
  • Experience working with large datasets in MySQL (> 5 TB)
  • Experience working with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, but specifically SaltStack
  • Proficient with shell scripting and the Unix / Linux CLI
  • Experience debugging, refactoring and improving legacy, monolithic PHP applications
  • Strong background in OO development in PHP with a proficient understanding of fundamental principles such as SOLID, DRY and KISS
  • Working knowledge of OO design patterns and architecture patterns (e.g. ETL)
  • Practical knowledge of modern frameworks and libraries (Symfony2, Silex, Doctrine, etc)
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services including EC2, S3, RDS, CloudSearch and DynamoDB
  • Familiar with Redis, Memcached, PostgreSQL and Beanstalkd
  • Experienced writing unit and integration tests with PHPUnit
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS:

  • Strong working knowledge of the Twitter API
  • Experience with other scripting or OO languages, e.g. Python, GoLang
  • Experience working in Agile / Scrum workflows
  • Experience working with Rackspace cloud services
  • Experience writing technical specifications and documentation
  • Has contributed to open source projects (give examples if available)
  • Experience using Vagrant
  • Proven commercial experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript

BENEFITS

Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

To apply: Please apply at:https://manageflitter.workable.com/jobs/425574/candidates/new

item.title: Back-end Engineer
item.description:
ManageFlitter â http://manageflitter.com â is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

We have huge plans for the next couple of years and some exciting new projects are close to fruition - including our new product http://ManageSocial.com. 

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney and with customer support based in the United States.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team.

Whilst this role is remote you will need at least 4-5 hours per day time crossover with the Sydney Australia timezone. 

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years commercial experience with Linux and Open Source Technologies
  • Experience building and configuring a LAMP stack
  • DevOps experience and can architect solutions that scale
  • Experience working with large datasets in MySQL (> 5 TB)
  • Experience working with configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, but specifically SaltStack
  • Proficient with shell scripting and the Unix / Linux CLI
  • Experience debugging, refactoring and improving legacy, monolithic PHP applications
  • Strong background in OO development in PHP with a proficient understanding of fundemental principles such as SOLID, DRY and KISS
  • Working knowledge of OO design patterns and architecture patterns (e.g. ETL)
  • Practical knowledge of modern frameworks and libraries (Symfony2, Silex, Doctrine, etc)
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services including EC2, S3, RDS, CloudSearch and DynamoDB
  • Familiar with Redis, Memcached, PostgreSQL and Beanstalkd
  • Experienced writing unit and integration tests with PHPUnit
  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills

BONUS SKILLS:

  • Strong working knowledge of the Twitter API
  • Experience with other scripting or OO languages, e.g. Python, GoLang
  • Experience working in Agile / Scrum workflows
  • Experience working with Rackspace cloud services
  • Experience writing technical specifications and documentation
  • Has contributed to open source projects (give examples if available)
  • Experience using Vagrant
  • Proven commercial experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript

BENEFITS

Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

To apply: Please apply at:https://manageflitter.workable.com/jobs/425574/candidates/new

item.title: Full Stack Rails Developer
item.description:
Dekeo
Ruby, Full Stack, Software Developer

Are you the Full Stack Developer we're looking for?

Are you passionate about creating magical user experiences? Bring that love, and your skillful way of solving usersâ needs to us. We're looking for an experienced full-stack engineer equally comfortable working on greenfield features and refactoring legacy code.

If you love setting others up for success as much as you love stepping up to achieve results, you're probably the type of person we want on our team. We are looking for engineers who can raise the skill level of their teammates and love to give back through tech talks, lightning talks, etc. We would also love it if you were an Open Source contributor.

You will be working closely with our customer success team.  If you love seeing real customers quickly benefiting your work, then this is the role for you.

About Us:
Dekeo is a new business line being spun out of a fast-growing, profitable company.  Dekeo is creating a global ecommerce marketplace for creative promotional products (putting company or team logos on t-shirts, water bottles, and stickers).  While the company is still very much at a growth stage â there's a huge number of technical challenges still to solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to be built.

How we'd like you to help us:

  • Write clean, maintainable and efficient code
  • Design robust, scalable and secure features
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle

What we'd like to see in the candidate:

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (e.g. Git)
  • Possible experience working with large, custom search systems using Solr or ElasticSearch
  • Experience with agile story tool such as Pivotal Tracker

Compensation
Competitive Compensation

item.title: PHP Developer
item.description:
Senior Back End Developer Job Description:
Joinpiggy.com is looking for the highest caliber back end developers to join its technical teamâs expansion.  

We are looking for a PHP Developer responsible for managing back-end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition and maintenance of the central database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.

What We Are Looking For
  • Excellent Object Oriented PHP Skills.
  • Agile Dev Environment, CI, with Functional Testing.
  • Strong knowledge of PHP web frameworks
  • Understanding the fully synchronous behavior of PHP
  • Knowledge of object oriented PHP programming
  • Enjoys Improving when possible, but fixing when urgent.
  • Strong knowledge of the common PHP or web server exploits and their solutions
  • Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
  • User authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
  • Integration of multiple data sources and databases into one system
  • Familiarity with limitations of PHP as a platform and its workarounds
  • Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes
  • Familiarity with MySQL databases
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • SPACES vs Tabs.
  • PSR / PHP-FIG Standards.

The Opportunity
  • Collaborative working environment with the full support of a team of industry experts.

Job Functions:
  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers
  • Build efficient, testable, and reusable PHP modules
  • Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges
  • Integration of data storage solutions
  • Will integrate various APIs from third parties;
  • Build our own APIs to be used by Apps
  • Improve and convert existing code to new standards.
  • Build Unit Testing

Job Requirements:
  • Strong English language skills.
  • Excellent communication skills, including verbal, written, and presentation.

Include in Cover Letter
Include in your cover letter answers to the following questions:

  • What is one tool that every single php application SHOULD use?

To apply: Please apply by sending your cv to the following email address:303855fccc06@apply.breezy.hr

item.title: Software Engineer
item.description:
Who We Are

Food52 is a James Beard Award-winning online food community, recipe hub, and home and kitchen shop. Our mission is to inspire people to eat thoughtfully and live joyfully. We see the kitchen as a gateway to how you live. 

Our product and engineering team consists of the product managers, designers, and engineers who build the systems that Food52 uses to produce amazing editorial content and a shopping experience that delights our users. Our website is written in Ruby on Rails, with a sprinkling of AWS services (RDS Postgres, redis). On the client side we use React and Knockout. Our batch systems are authored in Python and Clojure (for Cascalog / Hadoop). 

We are committed to building a diverse team, and are especially interested in applicants who will expand our range of experiences and perspectives. We have several openings on the team! If you feel like you don't exactly fit this one, take a look at the others at https://food52.com/jobs

Who You Are
  • You are an experienced software engineer with at least five years experience who loves writing code and finding simple solutions that solve user and business needs.
  • You see your role as both mentor and coder, putting the needs of the team first. You enjoy helping other engineers understand best practices in a thoughtful and considerate way, and earn respect through high quality work.

Responsibilities
  • Mentor other software engineers by collaborating on architectural and design considerations and helping them understand standard solutions and when to cut corners.
  • Implement features in our editorial and e-commerce platform, such as international shopping, automated recommended content, and video management.
  • Build personalization systems, giving our users delightful contentâwhat does go well with chocolate and bananas? The perfect answer must be somewhere in our recipe data.
  • Help our team improve the quality of our code through thoughtful collaboration, code refactoring, and other software engineering best practices.

Qualifications
  • At least several years of experience in software engineering teams, with some amount of team lead or mentorship experience.
  • Strong background in algorithms, data structures, and software engineering principles.
  • Strong background in web technologies, including a deep understanding of how a modern web application works end to end (HTTP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, etc) and how applications perform under load.
  • A continued love and curiosity for technology, and a desire to stay familiar with the latest available technologies.

Nice to Haves
  • Experience with AWS and frameworks like Ruby on Rails, or with Python and a similar framework
  • Experience with data analytics, data warehousing, and SQL
  • Love of food and cooking

To apply: Apply at https://food52.com/jobs - or email eng-jobs@food52.com

item.title: QA Engineer
item.description:
LiteracyPro Systems creates software to make the world a better place. We are leaders in the custom web application space for government agencies. Our data collection and reporting software helps agencies help millions of disadvantaged people improve their opportunities to get jobs with sustainable, living wages for themselves and their families. Enjoy being part of a fun group of bright, passionate folks, in a great working environment, with superb salary & benefits while helping those who help others.


We’re looking for an extraordinary QA Engineer to help us grow our new, cloud-based application.   This enterprise application – known as “CommunityPro Suite” – was released last Spring and is getting rave reviews. Our Company is poised for explosive growth in the coming months due to national demand, and we’re looking for a talented engineer with the smarts, passion and people skills to test and be part of moving CommunityPro Suites forward. You’d be an important player as we continue expanding the product according to our roadmap.


CommunityPro Suite enables huge state and local agencies to securely match, consolidate and share data between themselves in real time. The purpose of the software is to reduce organizational friction by helping local agencies help people achieve economic self-sufficiency. The end goal is to play an important role in creating healthy, vibrant communities.


Please no staffing agencies or contractors.
